I fear that this one isolated negative experience will impact my future electronics purchasing decisions, as well as the recommendations that I give to friends, family and co-workers.  I wish Samsung would have just honored this customer complaint, and exchanged the unit.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV, not quite so fantastic Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jamin B.
Reviews.Content: We got this TV shortly before Thanksgiving, so after having it for almost a month, I am quite impressed. It's got a beautiful picture, great color, good enough sound, looks great sitting on the TV stand. Watching TV looks great, playing games looks great (sometimes I just want to sit and watch the PS3's XMB home screen, it looks that good!). The smart features are pretty good, app selection seems on par with Roku, though I haven't gone in and done an app-for-app checklist or anything - actually, since this has YouTube, it's actually better than Roku, at least as far as the apps that we care about.The Clear Motion thing is weird, we dialed ours back to the "clear" setting, which made things nice and sharp but did not give a noticeable "soap opera" effect. I think the default was "sharp" or something, which definitely had the soap opera thing.I have a few cons that, collectively, cause me to drop a star. I'd go a star and a half if I could, but I will err on the positive side, I guess.First, setting the aspect ratio to "screen fit" vs "wide fit" affects the entire input source... which would be fine, except our cable box obviously goes through a single source, so we keep having to switch back and forth depending on whether we're watching an HD or SD channel. Our last TV's equivalent setting correctly stretched the SD channels, but HD channels came through untouched. This stretches *everything* including HD, so if you have it on the correct mode for an SD channel but then change to an HD channel, it's zoomed in and the edges get cut off, and you have to flip it back to the other mode. And vice-versa, moving from HD to SD you get black bars until you flip it.Second, the Smart Hub as a whole seems kind of unstable. I've not experienced the daily/random wifi drop like other reviewers, however, we've had other problems. At one point it lost every single app, so we had to do a factory reset and walk through the entire setup process again to get it to pick them back up and redownload everything. We've had to log into Netflix at least four different times because it lost/reset the stored credentials (and trying to enter a secure password with an onscreen, remote-based keyboard is... unpleasant...). When it works, it's great. But it's just unstable enough to be annoying. Hopefully they'll get a firmware update to fix.Finally, we complemented the TV with a Samsung soundbar, plugged into the optical out. This TV did not support the wireless connection. Not a big deal, I'd actually prefer the optical over wireless anyway. Normally everything's great. However, in the YouTube app specifically, the sound is noticeably delayed. But only in YouTube. Netflix works fine, cable and PS3 work fine, the other apps I've played with all seem fine. But YouTube gets delayed. If you leave the TV speakers enabled, you can hear it "echo" as the TV speakers play something first, then half a second later the soundbar plays it. I have messed with the delay settings on both the TV and the soundbar and I've managed to minimize it, but - much like the aspect ratio above - if I fix it for one source, I have to unfix it everywhere else. If it was across the board, I'd guess it was the soundbar's fault (or my own fault for failing to get the delay settings correct), but since it's only in one specific app, I can only assume it's the TV's fault, something is causing the video and audio to desync in YouTube.That's it. Other than the issues above, we're more than happy with this TV. It was a great upgrade from what we had before.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Bad Ghosting
Reviews.Author: Mideel
Reviews.Content: This review pertains to the the 60 inch version of the Samsung LED F6300.The picture quality of this set is very good. I am impressed with the colors and black levels.The Smart TV apps are pretty bad. Most of them I couldn't get to actually stream in HD (Netflix, HBO GO, Crunchyroll) so I plugged in an Apple TV instead and it worked great.The major issue I have with this TV is that it has a severe dark image ghosting issue. When the brightness level is set below 50 dark objects in games and movies will smear/ghost. I first noticed it while playing Dark Souls and it was quite obvious while watching 2d animated films like Lilo and Stitch or Princess and the Frog. This issue caused me to exchange with Amazon (very smooth return/exchange process) the TV thinking it was something specific to the first TV but the second TV had the same issue. I plan to return it and look for a different model. If someone can tell me this is specific to the 60inch versions maybe I will get the 55inch version.I do like most things about the TV but the ghosting issue is a deal breaker for me. Avoid the 60inch version.

Reviews.Title: Great looking HDTV, still average "Smart" capabilities
Reviews.Author: Chris Crawford
Reviews.Content: This 60" TV replaced a 8 year old 42" plasma. This was my first LED/LCD TV after two Panasonic plasmas. Some early impressions:1. Picture is as good as I hoped. Even colors and lighting. Inky blacks. No complaints here. I have not fine-tuned the colors, and am generally running in "movie" mode. I think my recently purchased Panasonic plasma has more realistic color (e.g. looking at green grass) but I may need to play with the adjustments.2. The set itself looks great. Thin bezel, unobtrusive logo (I hate big, glowing logos!) Nice, swivel stand that was very easy to assemble.3. Remote is nothing spectacular. It does configure itself to control your cable box, and it worked with the somewhat obscure Arris box that my provider uses. However, it still can't completely replace the dedicated cable remote, nor is it as configurable as something like a Harmony remote.4. The SmartTV functions are improving, but they're certainly not the reason to buy this TV. It is kind of nice to have a built-in Amazon and Netflix apps, but honestly, I still prefer a $99 Apple TV over the Samsung capabilities. The TV's web browser app is actually usable in a pinch. (I used it to find the Samsung codes to program my cable remote...)5. There's a SmartTV function to suggest/preview upcoming TV shows (you tell the TV your cable provider during setup and it fetches schedule information, etc over the internet.) The TV then changes the channel on your cable box for you using an IR blaster which is included with the TV. Irritatingly, it tunes the SD channel rather than the HD channel for my cable provider.6. The sound is much better than I expected. I figured with small, down-firing speakers I'd need to buy a sound bar right away. I probably still will, but for now, the sound isn't awful.So, I'd buy this one again, but if "apps" are important to you, I'd probably consider a cheaper model and get a PS3 or an AppleTV.

Reviews.Title: LOVE it!!
Reviews.Author: Amie
Reviews.Content: Just received today - received a day early from Amazon - FREE shipping with Amazon Prime - so worth the annual fee!! VERY easy to unbox & set up, thanks to the fact that the TV weighs about 30 lbs.! LOVE that!This TV replaces the piece of crap 50" Panasonic Viera Plasma I bought two years ago and it broke TWICE!! The first was covered under warranty, the second time it would have cost me over $400!! No way I was going to waste any more $$ on Panasonic. Saved up for a couple of months and now I was able to get this GREAT TV!!Set up was easy, establishing my Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hulu & Pandora accounts. Read a couple of reviews about the fact that is no key board, but found using the remote control was easy - one of the easiest I've used.The picture quality is FABULOUS, sound is FABULOUS!! I'm not a gamer and don't watch a lot of sports, so this TV seemed to be perfect Will update as time goes on, but VERY happy with the first few hours of ownership!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: LoneJedi+2
Reviews.Content: Did my research and found this TV in my price range. Looked a long time before I settled on this one. Ultimately, I decided that I didn't care about 3D but wanted the Smart Feature. (In the end, don't really care about that either since I use Apple TV). I was just focused on picture quality. I bought the 46 in. model. The shipping got messed up my Amazon. I ordered Thursday and chose Saturday deliver, it arrived Tuesday. After some exchange, they admitted they were wrong- watch out, this thing ships via FedEx home delivery service.That aside, the picture quality is awesome. 120hz is worth the money. Fell in love as soon as I turned it on. Going through set up, I had some issues setting up Smart TV. It kept saying that it couldn't find my service provider when entering my zip code. This was sort of a let down because it meant that the 'Smart TV' function would not work. Fine. Whatever. After some time messing with it, I got it to work, sort of. (This just means it doesn't fully use the 'On TV' function to learn what you watch and then make recommendations based on what's on other channels). In my particular application, I don't care. Keep in mind that I'm using it without a set-top box (no cable box attached, just a straight coaxial from the wall). In the end, I don't care about that either. It's got some apps that work nice- Netflix, TimeWarner Cable, HBO Go, a few others. It was a built in web browser, it works but won't blow your socks off, and interface is cumbersome, just using the supplied remote.I'm using it in an office. I've got an Apple TV, PS3, and computer hooked up to this baby. The Apple TV test worked great- looks so sharp. The PS3 worked even better- the blue-ray quality on this thing is just sick. The real shocker came when I hooked up the computer. The picture looks almost as sharp as any decent computer monitor. (Note that I'm using an NVidia GTX570 card). Star Craft 2 and others looks awesome on this thing. (Had to tweak settings on both the TV and computer but, once done- awesome).One important note, and something I noticed in other reviews- people complained of dark picture quality. This thing is an LED TV. If the picture is too dark, you're doing it wrong. During set-up, it automatically switched to Eco Sensor. It was quick- like, if I wasn't paying attention, I would have missed it. I had to dig around in the settings a little to find it but, when I turned that off, brightness improved by 100% (I did a couple other tweaks as well, again, my application is a dark windowless office room). I tested it in a my loft, where there's a lot of natural light, again, after a few tweaks, I can see the picture well, although dark scenes are a little hard to see.The speakers aren't all that great but let's be honest, if you're spending money on a TV like this- do you really care about the audio that comes with it? I'm hooked up to a sound bar- works fine. This is all about picture quality and Samsung always nails it. I've had it almost a week now and done some extensive testing and love it. I wall mounted it now, and it looks so pretty sitting on my wall. (Side note, pictures look incredible as a screen saver on this thing).Note that the only audio output is optical. Hmm... Interesting. Fine, whatever. And there is no DVI output, nor is there a VGA connection. My graphics card has HDMI output, so, not an issue for me. If you have VGA output, buy a converter, they're pretty cheap.All said and done, I love it. I buy another. In fact, I just might. I paid $800. Worth. Every. Penny.

Reviews.Title: Samsung's Excellent Response To Vizio
Reviews.Author: NotaSecondTime
Reviews.Content: From their own literature and product announcements, Samsung did not plan to introduce a 75" display at less than $4k this year. Obviously they felt pressured by the new Vizio 'M' Series!I compared these two lines at a local Warehouse club. The UN75F6300 was also clear, colorful and bright. The picture "poped" and was involving. The $4K Samsung UN75F6400 75-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D Slim Smart LED HDTV was evaluated twice and i was not too impressed. Its almost seems as if Samsung delays picture quality improvements until the competition catches-up?The UN75F6300 offers good value being priced in between the Vizio 70" and 80" models.Cons: lack of 3D. The Vizio offers a wider viewing angle but probably has poorer black level.

Reviews.Title: Expensive but worth it
Reviews.Author: --chris
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade the TV in my bedroom and thought about getting a less expensive TV.  I'm glad I didn't go that route.Pros:- Picture Quality - Just amazing.  Picture is clear, fluid and just looks great.- Samsung Apps - Really nice to have HBO Go, Pandora, Plex (the best home media server), Vudu, Netflix all integrated right into the TV.  I watch a lot of TV from streaming sources and the implementation on the Samsung apps is one of the best I've used.-  Light weight.  It was amazingly light weight.  Made mounting it a breeze.-  Sound Quality - Since this is a bedroom set it's not hooked up to surround sound.  I was really pleasantly surprised by the sound quality.Cons- Cord is VERY short I think about 4 ft.  Not a good length if you are wall mounting it.- Cord is also not a standard " IEC320C13" connector like most monitors, computers etc use.  I believe it's a Nonpolarized "IEC320C7"  but I can't swear to that.- Price.  This is a very expensive set.  Several Hundred more that the UN32F5500.  Be sure that the extra features and refresh rate are worth it for you.  For me they were.  You may decide it is not.Neutral- Lot's of features I will probably never use like gesture control (requires a webcam) or Skype (also requires a webcam).

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but DO NOT buy this if you plan streaming.
Reviews.Author: Edward Dye
Reviews.Content: I bought this model and while streaming HD the picture pixelizes pretty bad.  I tried their tech support who refused to assist me saying it was my local wireless causing the issue.  He said they don't guarantee ANY speeds through the internal wifi, just that it will connect to a network.  So if it connects at 1k you are out of luck on getting it repaired.I explained that my laptop and LG smart TV are streaming HD without any problems.  I then explained that I tested my friends Netgear wireless bridge and connected that to the TV and the problem disappeared.  He insisted that was because the remote end of the bridge connected via Ethernet.  He could not get the concept that no matter how the remote end is connected it still uses that same wireless signal between the two ends of the bridge... the same wireless he blames for being the cause.  He then suggested I buy my own bridge if that is a solution.  Really I buy a new TV and you tell me to buy third party hardware to bypass the TVs internal hardware that should be working?In summary using the TVs internal wireless = FAILURE!Adding third party wireless device = Perfection!I also emailed Samsung and got no reply.  Its time to box this up and return it.I have a ZyXEL wireless AC HD Media/ Gaming Router, 1750Mbps, Dual-Band with Gig Ethernet.

Reviews.Title: Not as "smart" as it thinks
Reviews.Author: Chris Happy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my girlfriend, to be wall mounted in our bedroom. I chose this model for its light weight, built in wi-fi, and its controllability from a smart device. The physical stature of the tv is awesome. It is super light weight, very thin, and has a great physical appearance. The built in wi-fi has some connectivity problems very randomly, mostly while streaming video, It seems to work better for music. Samsungs interface, the "smart hub", is so time consuming to use without an external keyboard that its ridiculous. Enter Samsungs answer, Allshare. Allshare is a downloadable app that lets you use your smartphone to control the tv, including channel, volume, screen mirroring, and some other cool features, but what they don't advertise, is that Allshare is only available on Samsung smartphones and tablets. There are other programs for android and iOS that will control the tv, but only with basic controls of volume, channel, input and power. The tv also has no bluetooth capability, so a usb bluetooth connector has to be used. Overall it is a decent tv, but if your trying to use this model based on its "smart" capabilities, it needs some more education.

Reviews.Title: Minor gripes, but overall, good TV.
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Pro 1: The picture quality on this thing is amazing. I was also able to tweak the "Soap Opera Effect" with custom settings, turning up the clarity while turning down the ultra-smoothness. Looks absolutely outstanding.Pro 2: The Smart TV software can connect to my media server, on my computer. I mean, my PS3 does it already, but it's kinda nifty anyway. It doesn't do the best job buffering though, so I'll need to pick up a hub and make sure it's wired into Ethernet.Con 1: The Amazon page for this product very clearly states that this model (60 inch, F6300) supports SoundShare. However, this is not the case. I had purchased this tv and a sound system, expecting to hook up the sound system via SoundShare (wireless), and was very surprised to learn that, contrary to the product description, SoundShare is only supported on the F6400 model and up. So, that was really lame. Amazon did give me a 10% refund though, so if I could give a half star back for that, I would.Con 2: I am not impressed with the "smart" portion's user interface and menus. It all feels very clunky and laggy and slow. Especially the browswer. And the media server reading software. And, the OSD it takes nearly the whole screen, you'd think with a 60" TV they could have an option to shrink down the user interface a bit. Eh.Final score: 3.5 / 5

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV - Unboxing Video
Reviews.Author: Chris Keller
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV recently after extensive research comparing this to other products out there.  The video and voice quality were both excellent.  I used the WiFi feature on it and even though the signal in my room where I have the TV is not that great, the TV is able to pick it up with no problem.  It supports a/b/g/n wireless standards.  I made a video you can check out if you like of me unboxing it.  This will let you know what to expect before you open it.  There is also another video on my channel on installing the TV stand.  http://youtu.be/hiVtgBLE1NE

Reviews.Title: Helps to have a Masters degree....
Reviews.Author: A. Bailey
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Pairs with Samsung Airplay speakers for unbeatable sound. Learning all the features is daunting. It took one weekend to understand what the unit can do, and about two weekends to get comfortable navigating, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: just wow!!
Reviews.Author: sergio huerta
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!!!! This TV is amazing! The picture quality is fantastic, the menu is easy to navigate and the smart tv apps are easy to set up and use. i highly recommend this model and its made by samsung.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous TV
Reviews.Author: M. Dana
Reviews.Content: I have 6 other Samsung's, so I am definitely a fan. This is a great TV. I like the light weight, it was easy to hang on my articulating mount, except that they do not include any mounting screws and the 32" Samsung I replaced had smaller screws. The sound is what you would expect out of 10W speakers, decent but most people will add a sound system or sound bar as I did. I like the built in Apps like Netflix and Amazon Video and setting up the internet was very simple. The remote is intuitive but not backlit, nice large buttons. Picture quality is beautiful, you can select a few preset settings as I did or tweak them as you desire. I have been extremely happy with all of my Samsung's and you won't be disappointed in this set.

Reviews.Title: Sound problems over LAN or WiFi make this nothing more than an expensive monitor. Smart features are worthless
Reviews.Author: Cavehobbit "tom"
Reviews.Content: After receiving this I hooked it up to a Roku, and it worked fine, and a PC which also worked fine, so I trashed the packaging. I also set it up with Wifi, which went fine and immediately downloaded the latest firmware update. But I did not use the WiFi for streaming or any smart features, like the Netflix app. Once I did, I experienced the same dropping of audio and audio out of sync issues with Netflix others have reported. I then hooked it up over a hardwired LAN cable to my router. The same issues continue, so this is a hardware or firmware issue.If you plan to only use this hooked up to a Roku, PC or other device for streaming you will be OK. But if you are planning on using any of the not so Smart features, avoid this one. I can stream over wireless to a laptop or Roku and feed the video to the TV over HDMI and have 0 issues with the sound dropping out or being out of synch. Which is pretty unacceptable performance from the TV.Samsung really screwed up on this one.Overall, I am very disappointed in this product. If I had not disposed of the packaging already I would return it, which would be a first for any TV or Monitor I have ever bought in my life. As it is, I am stuck with it. Luckily I have enough old laptops and PC's laying around I can make do, but I was hoping to avoid having all those HDMI cables hanging off the back as it is wall mounted, and very unsightly.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN50F6300 50-Inch ***DEAD AFTER 1 WEEK***
Reviews.Author: C. Lewis "DTown220"
Reviews.Content: I've had the UN50F6300 50-Inch TV for 2 weeks.  It was a beautiful picture and it looked great on my wall.  Then, a week later while I was watching it, I heard a loud "bang" from the TV, and it went dead.  Completely dead.  No power. Now it's just a big shiny black painting on my wall. Still looks good up there -- too bad I can't watch it.  Sounds like a bad power supply or capacitor.  Samsung customer service has been a nightmare so far. I will update if it resolved amicably.

Reviews.Title: NOT for streaming
Reviews.Author: GINNIE FLORADAY
Reviews.Content: Truly all the statements in the good reviews are accurate. HOWEVER, if you intend to stream through the web browser -- you cannot!The Flash Player version required with most current web accessible streams is 11.8. This model only supports up to 11.2 and good luck even getting that (ships with 11.1). Otherwise a good unit.Would have been more convenient to have this limitation indicated somewhere in the online product doc rather than put us and Amazon through the process of shipping and returning. (Amazon BTW was VERY professional and the service very good.)

Reviews.Title: Smart TV part was very disapointing
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: The picture and quality of this tv is all up to speed but the smart portion is weak.  I would rather use a roku with HD capacity.  The way this tv has you download and set up apps is a pain in the ass expecually ones like YouTube.  Also, apps are much slower than when I used my roku. (Vudu, Netflix, Hulu etc)  If you can save money buying a roku instead of a tv with internet capabilities I would go that route if a samsung is your tv of choice.  I would give this tv 5 stars if the smart portion worked like a roku its just too inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with 40" Samsung F6300
Reviews.Author: John Adams
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Panasonic TC-L32X5 32".  I wanted CEC for controlling HDMI-attached devices - OpenELEC on a Raspberry Pi and Panasonic Blu-Ray player.  I also wanted the 120Hz refresh rate.  It has a much better picture than the Panasonic - especially the deep blacks.  The Panny would have swaths of grey on black screens.  The Samsung delivers a uniform dark screen.I found that the M8-1.25 x 30mm machine screw with four washers works for mounting the Samsung UN40F6300 to a wall mount. Be careful, as there is an M8-1.00 screw as well as the M8-1.25. A better size would be M8-1.25 x 25mm, but my local HW stores only stock the 30mm.So, my parts list:QTY 4 - M8-1.25 x 30mm screwQTY 16 - M8 washerToo bad Amazon sells the correct screw in lots of 500.M8-1.25 X 25 Metric Machine Screws Phillips / Pan Head / Steel / Zinc / DIN7985A / 500 Pc. Carton

Reviews.Title: Not to bad
Reviews.Author: DUSTBUSTER
Reviews.Content: This tv has some awesome features however the built in wifi turns on and off randomly which sucks when watching netflix.

Reviews.Title: Could have been 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Stephen P Ferguson
Reviews.Content: Picture is brilliant.  Everything from film to sports looks super life-like.  Bravo.Wonderfully thin.However some of Smart TV features can be annoying, particularly in the search functionality in YouTube, Hulu Plus, etc.Instead of a QWERTY keyboard, its alphabetical.  And with no keyboard provided or potential to use one via the missing Bluetooth, its a painful process to do what should be an easy search.I have an iPad & iPhone, so its frustrating that my sparkling new TV is only compatible with Samsung-only, Android products.  I understand the corporate battle of Samsung v Apple, they really should make equipment useful for EVERYBODY.

Reviews.Title: Mounting Information
Reviews.Author: OzzyNyc
Reviews.Content: This review will be loved by those trying to mount this tv and finding ZERO information on the exact specs of the screws anywhere on the internet or even by calling Samsung :) This TV uses M8 1.25mm screws and the length is 25mm. It it's Machine type screws: m8 1.25x25mm .....It will be a perfect fit. Also if you have an OLDER VESA 200x200 mounts, your screw holes will be smaller in a diameter. You can drill a larger holes to avoid replacing  your mount and save $$$. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Good quality picture and great looks but one huge design flaw!
Reviews.Author: Rich S. "Rich S."
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price (I got it on sale for $649).Excellent picture quality and loaded with features. This TV looks great mounted on the wall!Setting up the picture settings was fairly simple and straight forward. Getting some of the apps going for the first time was a little complicated for me, but then again this is my first "smart" TV.I did however knock one star off due to a huge design flaw. Some of the connections are flush mounted on the back of the TV. Not a problem if you are using the stand but could be a major problem for wall mounting depending on the mount you use. In my case it was a big problem. The cables stick out enough to prevent the TV from being mounted. I was able to finally mount it but only using the 3 HDMI inputs on the side. I am going to try to purchase 90 degree adaptors so I can use the toslink audio out, the component (RCA) inputs for the WII, and the 3.5" mini connector for the IR extender.My last TV (Vizio) had the inputs/outputs recessed on the bottom and side so they were accessible, out of the way, and hidden.Even If I am able to use the rear connections with the 90 degree adaptors, the TV will have to be removed from the wall mount if I ever need to access them again.The genius that designed this obviously didn't take wall mounting into consideration.Still happy with the TV, just beware of this issue if you plan to mount it to the wall.

Reviews.Title: Great television! <--- 46-inch
Reviews.Author: Matthew Naumann
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be a fairly picky person when it comes to TVs, and this TV is nothing short of amazing. The picture is almost flawless from any HD source (Blu-Ray, Gaming system, etc.). Black levels are great. Colors are gorgeous. I told myself the very first thing I was going to watch on it was Planet Earth on Blu-Ray. I was nothing short of blown away by the image quality right out of the box with ZERO tweaking. Though I'm sure it could get even better.After reading other reviews, I expected the built-in speakers to sound like listening to Charlie Brown's teacher through a wooden door. But honestly, they're not as bad as some of the other reviews make them sound. There is no bass....okay, granted. But omg, you either get bass in your speakers or an amazingly slim television. You can't have your cake and eat it, too (at least with today's technology). The speakers are just fine.The SMART TV interface is great. Very smooth and more features than I will personally ever be able to take full advantage of...I would highly recommend this TV to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Go ahead and be in movie heaven.
Reviews.Author: major tom "tom"
Reviews.Content: Picture  was great out of the box,turned off most of the settings and wow. I put in Pacific Rim and when the Kujai show up to do battle with the Jaeger it was jaw dropping, the wife usually runs her mouth during movies sat there gobsmacked,it was great.Its hooked to a Klipsch system with 2 subs  sounds better than the movies .Put my 60 Samsung in the den which has been on about 15hrs a day for 5 yrs, that's why I stayed with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Very clear picture and modern
Reviews.Author: Thomas Sell
Reviews.Content: Samsung is clearly the leader for 40 to 46 inch TVs if you want a superior picture.  This 2013 6300 46 inch model has everything you need in a Smart TV for just a little more money.  The new brushed nickel stand and the thin glass-like frame work around the picture is well designed and modern.  This set is priced a little more than other competitor models, but is well worth it.  Sporting events are awesome on this set!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F6300 46-Inch- amazing Tv
Reviews.Author: Rexy
Reviews.Content: Just thought i should share my calibration settings.I think it might closely match what's already here.Picture Mode  MovieBacklight  16Contrast  95Brightness  45Sharpness  15Color  50Tint  G50/R50ADVANCE SETTINGSDynamic Contrast  OffBlack Tone  OffFlesh Tone  0RGB Only Mode  OffColor Space  Auto10pt White Balance  OnGamma  +1Expert Pattern  OffxvYCC  OffPICTURE OPTIONSColor Tone  Warm2Digital Noise Filter OffMPEG Noise Filter  OffHDMI Black Level  LowFilm Mode  OffAuto Motion Plus  OffLED Motion Plus  Off10PT WHITE BALANCE  ONInterval  Red  Green  Blue1  0  0  12  -1  0  -13  0  0  14  -1  0  05  -1  0  +16  0  -1  -17  -1  -1  -28  0  2  19  +1  0  010  +2  0  0WHITE BALANCESetting  ValueR-Offset  25G-Offset  25B-Offset  27R-Gain  19G-Gain  22B-Gain  21SCREEN ADJUSTMENTPicture Size  Screen Fit

Reviews.Title: TV only work for 4 months
Reviews.Author: Geoff Osterman
Reviews.Content: It is constantly turning itself off and I cant get any one to repair it.  I will never buy another Samsung product

Reviews.Title: The worst experience with samsung
Reviews.Author: Vivek M.
Reviews.Content: Hell lot of software bugs even after several updates. Recently the TV also started turning on and off by itself and lot of apps are crashing too. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Lovin' our new TV!!
Reviews.Author: Mary P.
Reviews.Content: We really love this TV thus far. We have had it up for about three weeks, and simply can't get enough of it. We did have an electrician install it for us, and he did use a heavy duty mount, not the one I purchased (Cheetah), as he said it was not sturdy enough. The SMART part of this TV was easy enough for me to figure out, and I am by no means an expert. We love that we can watch Netflix so easily. The only thing I would possibly change is that I wish it came with a wireless keyboard, as the remote is a little tough to use if you need to type, just takes longer. We don't use it for youtube or facebook yet, but I am sure we will, and it would be nice to have a keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 6 weeks - now the nightmare repair process begins.
Reviews.Author: Ms T L Childs
Reviews.Content: This TV unit is lovely to look at - slimline, narrow frame, sleek.  The picture is surprisingly good and the smart TV options are logical and well considered.  Overall I was incredibly impressed with Samsung's product - until it stopped working.Only 6 weeks after purchase the TV is emitting a loud buzzing sound, switches itself on and off constantly and when it is on the picture lightens/darkens dramatically.  We have tried every troubleshooting tip on offer and nothing has worked.  Logging a repair request with Samsung is enough to stress a veteran yogi, with clunky internet forms, data submissions lost and constant cross selling of unrelated products.  If only we could have shipped it back to Amazon and swapped it!This is a truly great TV, but bear in mind that you will be dealing with Samsung if anything goes wrong...  Just scrapes 2 stars because those first 6 weeks were a beautiful thing that I will always cherish...

Reviews.Title: Great TV but be aware there is no Samsung Soundshare.
Reviews.Author: Paul Updike
Reviews.Content: At the time of this writing the Amazon page for the F6300 series of televisions indicates that these TVs include the Soundshare feature.I have just purchased an F6300 television and I would like to point out that my model (the 65" version) does not include Soundshare.  According to the Samsung website this series does not have Soundshare so I am convinced the Amazon page is wrong.The implication is that the Samsung Soundbar I purchased cannot be wirelessly connected and controlled by the TV.  I was hoping to get TV volume to be in control of the Soundbar volume but apparently this is not possible.Otherwise I am very happy so far with this television.

Reviews.Title: TV is more than expected ...
Reviews.Author: Myks Reviews
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV and it same within the shipping date range in impeccable condition.  Setup is easier than you may think.  The TV renders HD as if it was extreme HD. The apps are a bonus especially if you have kids you would love to see youtube clips on the big screen.  One of the best purchases I have ever made.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Navid Assal
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV- picture quality is very good- Netflix runs smoothly without any errorsDelivery was prompt and no issues out of the box

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Highly recommended. We love it. The samsung remote control stinks though.
Reviews.Author: J. Lawrence Associates
Reviews.Content: The samsung 6300 sold on Amazon and the 6350 as sold by the big box discount retailers like Costco and SAMs  is the same tv.  3 months of watching this TV: Great picture, great reception, this particular model, the 65" 6300 (6350)  has LESS GLARE than the 6400. Uses a different filtering mechanism on the screen to cut down on the glassy reflectivity we see in our larger Samsung units in the rest of our home. We bought this as an added surround sound movie system for our golf room (we live on a CC golf course and the room is nearly solid glass windows on 3 sides) and frankly it works pretty darn well. We are quite pleased. It also helps that the led screen is very bright which further reduces the impact of glare. The only complaint is the ABSOLUTELY ABOMINABLE REMOTE CONTROL. UGH!!! Buttons ... Buttons .. and more Buttons. Nearly useless in its complexity. It's crazy I tell ya. Crazy. Nuts. Whacko. We added an Apple TV set top box to this Samsung TV (internet enabled movies, tv shows, sports espn, content including hulu, Netflix) to this TV which is what we mostly use, and it's 3 button remote control is a joy. Samsung should take note of Apple simplicity instead of the SAMSUNG complicated REMOTE CONTROL which is the only reason for the downgrade from 5 stars which this tv otherwise deserves. Note: this is not a 3d TV, if you want 3d you will have to step up a model to the 6400 or the 7000 series.

Reviews.Title: broke down after 7 months and samsung refuses to exchange it
Reviews.Author: J. F Villaverde
Reviews.Content: The "smart" feature is a joke....There's constantly something wrong with the apps: netflix won't keep log-in information, netflix won't load, amazon prime exits during playback all the time...Then I'd have to get on the phone with samsung and they can only do two things: either reset the TV, or tell me to wait for a fix to be released because "it's a known issue". Weeks and weeks we are out of use of this TV.Now the TV simply broke down: it keeps turning itself off and then restarts randomly. It's out of use for more than a week now and I've spent hours and hours with samsung tech. support over the phone in futile.Here's the last straw: although the TV is in warranty, samsung refuses to replace it. They only want to send someone to repair, but get this: I have to unmount the TV myself before the tech arrives and mount it back myself afterwards. How am I supposed to do that? The TV is 55" and I had it professionally hung.To sum-up: the TV only works half of the time; and samsung is not responsible if the TV turns out defective. Expensive junk.I will never buy another samsung product.

Reviews.Title: Wi-Fi continuously drops and I have to turn on/off TV to reset it
Reviews.Author: Anthony S.
Reviews.Content: Everytime I want to sit down and watch a movie or YouTube, the TV drops the wifi signal.  Not only does it drop the signal, but it also does not recover the signal.  I actually have to turn off the TV and turn it back on so that it will pick up the signal again.  I have updated to the latest firmware.  I have my Airport router within 10 feet of the TV.  Every other device in the house (iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, PC, Laptop) never loses a WiFi connection, but this TV keeps dropping it.  I tried contacting Samsung support but they were either clueless or pretended to be unaware of the issue.  I should have just paid a few hundred dollars less for the non-smart TV and then just picked up a Roku or Apple TV.  It would have saved me a few hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: great TV, easy setup, no problems
Reviews.Author: john h. wenum
Reviews.Content: I did what all of us do and checked this out at best buy first, and would have bought it there except they wanted 175 bucks to deliver it, which is lame.  So we got it through the Prime program, shipped free, and it was simple to figure out, even though I'm not good at figuring out these things.  The manual was simple, the set up instructions were simple, and the TV is great.  The picture is sharp, great color (and color control) and the sound is just right.  Be prepared if you go to Samsung online to register because every day thereafter you will get some promotional offer that clogs up your inbox.  I'd delink but you never know if you might need to contact them about a problem or whatever.  Anyway good TV, good price, good service from Amazon, as usual.

Reviews.Title: Good TV With Limitations on Expectations
Reviews.Author: Donald Canard
Reviews.Content: good performance, clumsy setup with a user manual that was written by someone unfamiliar with the English language for clarity of explanation.  TV quality is OK though as has been stated by others, Samsung provides a cheap and flimsy  plastic base, unlike the metal bases found on earlier and perhaps larger screen models.Integration of the remote with a cable box can be problematic, and the user manual, because of its ambiguity does not adequately explain how to set it up correctly.Don't expect to use the remote for any serious text insertion in the browser, but rather get a USB keyboard.  Too bad Samsung no longer provides a usable keyboard/remote with the set...probably to maintain a price point.It's a good TV, and at the tight price is a good alternative to other similar brands.I own three other Samsung Smart TV's so I'm familiar with the line.  As a Smart TV to watch HD cable services and movies from Netflix or Amazon, it's very good, but don't expect much from  Samsung's inadequate browser  for accessing internet content.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV for the person who does not care about 3D
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase the TV from Amazon but wanted to place my review. Ended up ordering it from a big box retailer when it was on sale last week. Granted, I have not played around with it much yet so this review is on initial impression and first couple times watching.Picture is fantastic for what I wanted. The blacks are not deep black but that's expected in an LED. I'm sure I could get deeper if I fiddled with the settings more. Out of the box the picture was good. It was initially blurry and I thought it was a panel issue as many people have stated various manufacturers provide the LED panel. I just had to go into settings and have the signal transmit 1080i (it was just 720) and that fixed the problem. I do have some flashlighting when looked at a mostly black screen but that's not a big deal to me. I don't use the Smart feature and didn't really like the SmartHub popping up every time I turned the TV on so I went into settings to turn that off as well.The one issue I have run into and I'm not sure if I missed a setting if it's something with my cable provider (Directv) but when I change channels, my directv switches properly but then .5-1 second later the TV itself seems to take over and show the HDMI source on the tv thus delaying the picture from coming up another 1-2 seconds. We have this same model in the 2011 line (UN60D6000) hooked up to directv in another room and this issue is not present.Overall, this is a great TV for my needs. Didn't want 3D or any of those higher features. This serves the purpose and is highly recommended to anyone looking for a good TV. You can find a similar TV for 1/3 the cost but I'm a big advocate for Samsung TVs as they have always provided a great picture!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS SAMSUNG SMART TV
Reviews.Author: Karen Mathews
Reviews.Content: It has the best picture and I love having the apps also. It picked right up on the wireless and I love listening to music, and when I don't watch TV I go to my apps and listen to music. My son also has the same TV and watching his is what made me decide on the Samsung. I am not sorry for the choice I made. Love the TV

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Colors, great Wifi-connected apps, deep blacks, difficult to initially adjust picture
Reviews.Author: JH Meyer
Reviews.Content: After many days of searching for the perfect TV for our master-bedroom area, we decided to spend the extra money for the Samsung UN40F6300.  We wanted the "Smart TV" features; but for the bedroom, we didn't opt for any 3-D picture.  We're not disappointed in the set -- it's surprisingly thin, light in weight, and very easy to set up.  I have to admit, running back and forth to my desktop computer was a hassle to type in the Samsung codes to set up some features (like Facebook and Amazon Prime), but (duh) I grabbed my Kindle HD and stayed in the same room for the other apps.  At first, the factory-set picture adjustments made people look too bright and washed out -- you know, when you turn up the color and brightness too far and the cheeks actually shine and the faces look flat.  I was disappointed it took so long and many tweaking moments to finally become satisfied.  Maybe the LCD screen had to literally burn in for a while before the picture became more realistic.  If you buy this set, make sure you go on the advanced picture settings -- there you can even adjust the white balance to finally tune the color.  I am very impressed with the deep blacks this TV produces -- one of the best I've seen in a moderately priced TV.  It doesn't have the stunning picture as compared to the top-of-the-line Panasonic and Samsung plasma sets, but for the price, it's a wonderful TV and one you should consider.

Reviews.Title: LED TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV. Picture is great as most of the features. Everything was easy to set up. The only "downside" as mentioned by others is the lack of a totally functional wireless keyboard. We did get a Logitech 400. It works for the internet use but does not fully work to use for Netflix and other apps. We still have to use the remote control. Did not get Samsung's keyboard as it is about 3 times more the price of the Logitech unit. And, others claim that the Samsung keyboard was no "ball of fire"

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY IT
Reviews.Author: Russ Herold
Reviews.Content: I have "fought" with this TV since I ordered it.  No fault of Amazon, on the contrary the tech support for the first 30 days was awesome.  Bottom line, if you want to stream movies using the smart tv feature (imagine that), Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc, forget it.  I reboot my router all the time, not exaggerating I have never been able to stream for more than an hour.  Typical Samsung support - nothing to help.  Because the problem is intermittent as soon as it works they say you are good to go.  I need to keep them on the phone for an hour at which point the wifi will drop but I am done....  Paid a lot for the TV and it simply, bottom line, DOESN'T WORK.  DONT BUY IT and based on what I have experienced with "help" the problem is even more maddening.Save yourself the money and go with another brand.Russ Herold

Reviews.Title: great picture when paired with xbox one!
Reviews.Author: Fotoflix "openCL master"
Reviews.Content: Maybe this is with most tv's, but Microsoft does an excellent job in assisting you in correcting color, contrast, gamma, and every other picture setting this tv has to offer. i had this tv for about a year before having an xbox one and I feel this tv is an entirely new tv when the picture is setup properly. The sound is okay, but no flat panel has great sound.If you get this tv, do yourself a favor and go through the hassle in setting up the picture correctly. Factory settings are mediocre at best. Not sure if the PS4 has a picture tuning function, but there are resources online that can guide you.I will say that after the correction, the blacks are the most deep ive seen and are deeper than the ipad air's black levels (including color,p and contrast). The quality is amazing. I hate writing reviews unless I feel the information can greatly benefit other buyers. So if you buy this tv, I can only recommend it if you take the time and make the picture perfect!

Reviews.Title: Nice, but definitely needs a soundbar
Reviews.Author: Jacqui
Reviews.Content: Great picture and very sleek look.  The picture is so clear it makes the TV look like everything is a soap opera, which is something to get used to.  A definite con is the sound.. I'm absolutely going to have to invest in a soundbar, because the sound on this is AWFUL compared to the 55" Sharp Aquos this is replacing.  Be sure to add the cost of a sound bar into your budget when considering this tv!Another con is that while the TV quickly connected to my home wifi network with a strong signal, the TV would kick me off my network any time I used my iPhone while watching a movie on Amazon. It did that reliably.  Then it wouldn't even remember my network info, so I'd have to re-enter my password, which isn't fun when using the remote.  After searching the Internet for solutions, moving my router everywhere it would reach in order to test it, I finally gave up and invested in a $30 ethernet adapter kit that would send the signal through the home wiring so I could use an ethernet cord on the TV instead of the wifi.  So far, that's worked fine, to my relief.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but need a sound bar
Reviews.Author: Lev Pomeranets
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Picture quality is amazing. Smart TV functions are working great. The only complaint I have is the sound quality but that is to be expected from any LED TV. You do need to use a sound bar or a home theater to improve the sound.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, network connectivity issues, Optical Sound Out issues
Reviews.Author: Chris JJ
Reviews.Content: Bought this a couple of days ago.The good:Nice picture - 5 stars (would have given it 3 stars if it weren't for the picture)The bad:Digital Optical Out appears to be downgrading the signal from Dolby/DTS to what sounds like stereo (this even when the source is the BluRay player which for sure outputs the full surround sound.  My A/V Receiver is an Onkyo with no HDMI inputs so I use the Optical Input to receive sound from the TV hoping that it would faithfully deal with the sound from the HDMI source and output Dolby Digital or DTS - but it does not - it seems to be PCM or some lower quality sound - certainly it's a lower volume. When I connect the BluRay and Satellite box directly to my Onkyo receiver to its other Digital Optical inputs, I get the full surround sound experience with Dolby/DTS so there isn't any problem with the A/V receiver.Smart TVa) Not so smart as far as handling the network connection. I also have an old Logitech Revue Google TV connected and that handles Netflix and YouTube streaming perfectly. The Smart TV almost instantly gives up stops and tells me my (wired) network connection is not good enough.b) No capability (as far as I can make out) to download Google TV applications.

Reviews.Title: Game On!
Reviews.Author: MAX
Reviews.Content: I bought the 32 inch model specifically for gaming, and I am pleased to say that I am not disappointed! The picture quality is fantastic, with deep, rich color and excellent black levels for this price range. I use the game mode all of the time because I can't stand lag; it works wonderfully in this capacity. At first, you may think that the picture in game mode looks unsatisfactory, but the menus allow for a lot of customization and with some fine tuning you can get an amazingly detailed and accurate display. Add to that the wealth of inputs (4 HDMI) and sound that is surprisingly good for a smaller set, and you have the best gaming TV for the money. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Did know what I was missing
Reviews.Author: George E. Miles "audiobook librarian"
Reviews.Content: Yep - I will admit it - I didn't know what I was missing till we replaced our 32 flat screen tube tv for this work of art.  I found that the instructions were just good enough to get you into the tv where you will find the e-manual.  That's the gold mine.Setup was a breeze, and watching is enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: Not so Smart
Reviews.Author: Ronald P. Meier
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this TV because of the reviews and checking it out at a brick and mortar store located a town away.  The picture and the sound are great; but one of the important features we were looking for was the built in apps.  I have had to reset the tv numerous times to factory settings to get the Netflix, Pandora, and Amazon apps to work.  It goes for a few days, and then things just go south.  In hindsight I would by the less "smart" tv and hook up my old Roku box up to it.  Samsung and their development partners just can't seem to keep things stable.

Reviews.Title: It's a keeper
Reviews.Author: H. Gruver
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv now for about a week. Actually have the 55f6350 which is about the same tv. Out of the box the picture was ok, but I'm kinda picky so I went online to find some popular calibrations. The stand was easy to put on. We had no dead pixels . I read from other reviews that the sound was bad, but I have to say that it was much better than expected. I was expecting it to sound like a 32 inch vizio that I have that sounds like a transistor radio. So I had gone ahead and ordered a samsung sound bar from amazon. Could have done without it, but I'm glad I bought a sound bar. Have not used much of the smart tv features as I'm sure they all cost money. But that aspect of the tv is not why I bought the tv. We bought a samsung because we've had good lunch with all samsung electronics .PROS The picture is nice and crisp and natural looking.The stand is ok, but liked the older model stands. The stand does swivel.We had no trouble setting the tv to our wireless network.The sound quality was pretty nice for such a slim tv. Not tin sounding. It's quite adequate unless you want to feel like you are at a concert or in the movie theater . If you want that, you need to buy a sound bar.A FEW WORDS AVOUT THE REMOTE-This tv has a universal remote only. Now I went back and forth as to wether or not to buy a higher model for the touch remote but read that most who had it wished they had a universal . A lot of people had a lot of trouble getting their remote to work with their cable set top box, so I was expecting to have to use both . Well I'm happy to say the my remote responds to all but a couple of things. I used the enclosed IR cable, strung it under my Motorola STB and have it 2 inches in front of box as directions suggest. It turns everything (including the sound bar) on and off together. All volume works. I can get to the cable STB guide, and I can even operate the DVR !!!!! Can record, watch and select from my recordings schedule recordings. Everything that I do with my verizon cable remote.  The only strange thing that I can't figure out is why you can't change the channel by entering the channel by number. Very strange. Have to go through the channel guide.Cons- so far I've only found one con. I'm not crazy about the mat screen finish. Seems to have more glare than my old tv that wasn't mat. But it's not a deal breaker. During the day I have a lot of daylight and it's a bit distracting .Final note, I have the samsung HW-f450 sound bar which also works along nicely with the tv remote and also goes on and off with the tv remote.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Pogos
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Shows great and sounds great. I gave this TV 5 stars because it is simply just great! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: I'm keeping this.
Reviews.Author: MML
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if I liked it at first because the picture is not as nice as the one I have that I bought at Costco but it is still nice enough.  As others have said apps are slow.  I was having trouble with the tv when I was on Amazon Prime  watching programs.  It would bufferi and then it started kicking me out every saying I don't have an internet connection.  We'd have to go all the way out rei put wireless password again etc.  we knew it wasn't out Internet speed because we get over 50 mbs so we suspected our wireless router wasn't powerful enough.  We took the tv into the office where the router is and it worked great so we are thinking about getting some type of booster or just buy another router.  Our house is only 2200 square feet, in the shape of a U office at one end of U master bedroom at other end of U so ithe wireless signal has to to travel through a couple of walls to get to the master bedroom. Web browser is nice but wish it came with a keyboard because it takes a long time to type answers to emails.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Bob Aldridge
Reviews.Content: Have the unit 6 weeks now. Purchased this to replace a 40” Samsung 720P from 2007.  My background: 50 year old male, professional, grew up as an audio/video and computer enthusiast. I paid $650 for the TV, plus $199 for the extended 5 yr warranty at HH Gregg, with tax the total was $901.99.  I chose the extended warranty because the Samsung TV this one is replacing had a problem and getting it fixed thru the extended warranty was easy. That extended warranty was on a 2007 TV purchased at Best Buy.Overall pleased with the TV. Excellent picture. Recommended. I have it hooked up to a Genie DirectTV & Apple TV units.Pros:Easy to setup.Great Picture.4 HDMI inputs. This was my overall requirement for the TV. Note: For some reason the Apple TV did not work with the HDMI #2 labeled as “ARC”. Apple TV worked fine with the HDMI #4 input.RVU technology (works with Direct TV Genie boxes)-won’t need the actually Genie box, Genie interfaces with the RVU technology in the TV to avoid having to use a physical box). Nice feature if you wife does not like boxes and cables. Note: You might consider using the Genie remote control to use the Genie, or you can use the buttons on the Samsung remote. I didn’t like the layout of the Samsung remote for controlling Genie.Dual Processor-I feel this helps the overall picture.Cons:Power cord to short. I have mine mounted in the corner of my bedroom on a VESA arm. Cord did not reach to floor where my surge protector is.Can’t custom label source inputs: I would love to label the inputs as to what they are. For instance: Apple TV or Direct TV. You have to use Samsung Generic labels, such as Satellite STB. Maybe all TV’s are like this, I don’t know.Sound is worse than the TV it replaced. I need to get a soundbar.Sleep time is buried in the On Screen Menu. Not on the remote like the previous TV.No built-in camera. Camera is $99 and is extra. The only smart App I would use is the Skye but I’m not going to pay for the $99 camera.I don’t use the Smart Apps so I can’t comment on those. I also don’t use the WI-FI so no comment either. I plugged the TV into my home network with an Ethernet cord and it updated the Smart Apps just fine.I got the calibration settings from: lcdtvbuyingguide.com

Reviews.Title: Good purchase....
Reviews.Author: N. Wright
Reviews.Content: The picture is impressive and the TV is easy enough to pick up and move to a new spot by any adult.  The remote has larger keys which makes it simple to read, even in a darkened room.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Picture, Great Game Mode
Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research to find the best TV in the mid-tier price range. The most important thing to me is picture quality. Being a photographer, little things that some folks might not notice would unfortunately annoy me. This TV is bare bones in a lot of ways to get the price down, but produces the most important thing-  a picture that has a ton of dynamic range, great contrast, brightness & motion looks great on it - especially in "game mode." "Game mode" also looks great for cable TV most of the time, but "Dynamic" looks amazing for movies. Pop "Life of Pi" in your blu-ray player & be prepared to be blown away. Btw, the people who give all the calibration options definitely have a point as far as making it technically color correct & such, but visually is not as appealing. Again, put it in "Dynamic" picture mode, play around with the picture setting a little bit & you'll be stoked. This could be the case as well because Samsung gives you an "update" via wi-fi after you plug the TV in & they made a couple tweaks on their own.Getting back to what I think is "bare bones" on the TV is the fact that it doesn't have an "Audio Out," only a "line out" or "optical out," the difference being that a "line out" makes it so you CAN NOT adjust the volume using the TV remote if say, you plugged in a pair of headphones or even normal speakers! You literally either have to buy a sound system that has it's own volume control or buy a "headphone" amplifier with it's own volume knob that you HAVE TO GET UP OFF YOUR COUCH & adjust every time you want to adjust the volume. The simple fact would have made me give the TV 4 stars (wish I could give it 4 & a half) if the TV didn't have such an incredible price.Overall I'm very, very happy with this TV & would buy it all over again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: This Samsung 40" smart tv has an absolutely beautiful picture, and is loaded with features. It was shipped in it's original Samsung box and arrived undamaged (which is always a concern of mine when ordering this type of product over the internet). One of my friends has a Sony, and I think picture-wise the Samsung beats it hands down. The only area the Samsung falls a little short of the Sony is in audio volume. This is probably due to positioning of the speakers on the 2 sets, but the Sony is louder than the Samsung when both are set to the same volume level, even though both have 2 10 watt speakers. Despite this, if I had to do it over again I would still buy the Samsung over the Sony.

Reviews.Title: Powers on and off main board defective
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought on December 8, 2013.  Inboxes and while watching the tv started powering on and off.  Called Samsung it is board problem.  They said there was back order on part so I returned to store.  This is common problem with a lot of their tvs. Be careful. There is a national recall on their motherboards of certain tvs. Will never buy a samsung tv again ever.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the money - but has a few bugs
Reviews.Author: J. Karczynski "RTWholesale dot com"
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that the screen IS NOT a matte finish. If you have windows on the other side of the room - it is hard to watch tv during the day due to the glare. I contacted Samsung about this, and they said they no longer make matte finish screens - but this model has a "glare resistant" feature. I uploaded a picture of the glare on this page, but it seems Amazon removed it and disabled the customer pictures features - Hmmmm - I wonder why? Also - when hooking the tv up to a receiver - you HAVE to use the Any-Net setting for the sound. It is a convenient feature if it worked properly - but the volume numbers on the tv and the volume numbers on your receiver never match up. The tv will say the volume is at 50 - while your receiver says 35. My old samsung lcd was able to just use the receiver remote. Next thing is the "Smart Hub" - it is ok - but does not play some mp4 (apple) movie files if you try to connect to an external hard drive - seems the codecs are not built in for those files. When you use Game Mode for xbox games - the screen gets pretty dark and I haven't noticed it actually speeding up the game interaction.If you can get past the glare - the picture is pretty good. These tv's are way less expensive then in the past. If you can get this tv for under $800, I would say it is a good deal. I wish they would go back to making matte finish screens.

Reviews.Title: Unknown defect
Reviews.Author: Carlos De Cunha "Carlos"
Reviews.Content: After debating for a while, my husband bought himself this tv. It arrived in good time and we were anxious to investigate all the features we had heard of. The first snag we hit was getting Netflix. After multiple runs through the manual and no progress we decided to contact Samsung support, spent more than 10 minutes on the phone with a rep and still no luck. When frustration set in, we took to Google! That is when we discovered that some features- like having Netflix in the Available Apps-was restricted to the US! We live in South America.Once we got past this disappointment, we had issues playing a certain video format across the wifi. The fix for this is a file rename.Then, o boy! The biggest heartache- the tv starts to cut off. Sometimes it stays off and sometimes it restarts. The first time I noticed it was about two months after we got the tv. There is no particular pattern to it. Most times it happens within an hour of putting the tv on. After seeing this happen about 4-5 times we contacted Samsung Support again. The rep recommended a "Service". Unfortunately, we do not have a Samsung Service Center in our country. That said, he walked us through a few basic trouble shooting steps and said that if these steps didn't resolve the problem we should call back to create a "ticket". Needless to say- the issue is still there. Ever so often it would cut off.It breaks my heart to know I spent $1200+ for this tv and now I am wondering just how long it will last. And I know my husband is quite possibly more bothered than I am- hence he has left this review for me to do.

Reviews.Title: best 32" display available for playing with my PC and watching movies
Reviews.Author: insoc
Reviews.Content: I am a IPS panel snob and for years have been the owner of high quality IPS panels from Dell. IPS panels are praised for their extended high resolution and color accuracy. Yes, colors on my current IPS monitors (DELL U2713HM and DELL 2913WM) are great and beautifully represented. However I always wanted to go bigger but not overkill as I intended to keep using the bigger display as a monitor, not as a HDTV. The 30" IPS monitors are very expensive for what they provide being way less than perfect displays for gaming. Being used to play on my 2560x1440 27" monitor, only the idea of playing in a bigger (32") display at "only" 1920x1080 was an absolute NO in my mind. One day I took the chance and tried to experience what playing and watching movies (the same entertainment stuff I do with my monitors) would be about with a 32" HDTV. Of course, I needed to buy the best image quality 32" HDTV available being that I been using high quality monitors. After much research and "test driving" I chose these native 1080p HDTV which by it's price can be called a "high grade" 32" HDTV because of it's features like 1080p and the 240HZ "Clear Motion Rate". Think of the best 32" HDTV money can buy even when comparing it with the top-of-the-line Sony W 32" TV. I compared them both, side by side, and the Samsung image quality blows aways the Sony.RESULTS: Connected this HDTV to my Nvidia GTX 780 card (I have to GTX 780 in SLI) and played all kind of games: from BF3 to Grid 2, from Crysis 3 to Tomb Raider and from Hitman: Absolution to GTAIV; the results were AMAZING. Absolutely NO, I repeat, NO input lag at all. The games run fluid and not even using GAME MODE there is no detectable input lag. The colors are great, vibrant, full of life and the IMMERSIVE experience it provides over my 27" monitor is a difference of night and day. You have to experience it to know what I'm talking about: I'm never going to be back to my IPS monitors for playing or watching movies and will keep them for job related tasks.Never knew how much I was missing with not trying to take the chance and jump to the 32" size world.PIXELATION? In some working programs it's more visible than on my 27" monitor, of course. But when gaming it's not noticiable and if any the IMMERSIVE experience and no input lag makes you automatically and instantly forget if there was any pixelation at all, but let me tell you that even at the almost the same distance that I use my monitor the pixelation is not noticiable.Buying this HDTV has been one of the most positive and rewarding significant changes I have made in my playing hardware.

Reviews.Title: Smart features are bad / Motion is delayed
Reviews.Author: K. Mufti
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good. However, motion was delayed at times. Smart tv functions were awful, as I'd get a green, frozen screen whenever trying to play Netflix. When I used the web browser the screen would freeze as well. I have LG42LA6200 - it is way better guys.... much better quality.

Reviews.Title: The best TV I've ever had.
Reviews.Author: denriquez007
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for grandma. When company comes over, they say it's the best picture quality they've ever seen. This flat screen is just the right size for any room. If grandma is happy, I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the new 40 inch Samsung Smart HDTV that I purchased.  After only 2 and a half months of receiving my new TV it suddenly would not turn on anymore.  I had to schedule a repair technician to assess the issue.  I was told that the power supply needs to be replaced.  I have been without a working TV for a week already.  The part has to be ordered and another appointment has to be scheduled which will take another week.  This is unacceptable for a brand new, supposedly reliable/reputable product.  I highly do NOT recommend purchasing this product.  It is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: confused!!
Reviews.Author: Charles F. Gothro
Reviews.Content: worked for five days!!it has been in the repair shop since then!!don't understand why it wasn't replaced!!!please explain it to me!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture, not as good in software
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung TV. I purchase my first Samsung LED 5 years ago. It still have the Samsung picture quality, but I'm disappointed on the quality of software and connectivity, the software evolution pace in 5 years is not up to today's requirements. I will try to go trough all the features that I have used.Set Top Box Integration: This is a great addition that I was unaware and greatly surprise me that I can control my Comcast Set Top Box from the TV (by using the remote extender). It setup was easy and I was able to control my STB right away. It also downloads program information from the cable provider and displays the guide in a nicer way. The only drawback to this, is the "smart" does not applies here, since it always displays the guide starting from channel 1 (if you are in channer 754, you will need to scroll your guide to that channel to know what is coming next or what it is on adjacent channels).Samsung DVD & Blue Ray: It does the job to control and play BD and DVD over Samsung's proprietary interface, however, there is no way to open or close the BD & Blue Ray lid from that interface. It is a minor thing, but I consider it a requirement.WiFi and Ethernet: This is one of the big disappointments: Even it has both Ethernet and WiFi, if you want to use the iPhone remote application the TV must be connected over WiFi to your router. I had my TV connected over Ethernet in order to stream Netflix movies without interruption, but it appears that the Ethernet port is useless at the end.All Share: I have a network disk with All-Share enable. Even as the Samsung can display my pictures, they are not fitted to the screen. You have to manually zoom them in order to view them (I might required to take those pictures with higher resolution, but who cares!, let the software size the picture to the screen and let the user decide if they are not the best resolution). It is difficult to move from picture to picture and the user interface is very poor.Web Browser: It does not support Flash and Java. So what it is for? It is advertised as Full Web Browser. Disappointed.Display Share: I think it only works with Samsung PCs. I have downloaded a software on my Laptop and never get it to work.Facebook app is a crap. I tried once and the interface is poor, bad organized, not able to see friends status, not intuitive.In conclusion. It is an excellent TV, but it falls behind on the advertised additions. It is what I call "check mark features": Those features stuffed in a product just to have a check mark on product comparisons, but you end up not using them because they are just things that are poorly integrated.

Reviews.Title: The TV worked for about two weeks.
Reviews.Author: Joe Galey "Banjo"
Reviews.Content: About two weeks after I'd gotten it set up, the picture disappeared--but the sound continued.  I turned the TV off and waited about 15 minutes and then turned it back on.  The picture and sound both worked!  But in just a few minutes they BOTH went off again, and I have not been able to get them to come back on.  I'm going to call Samsung tomorrow to see if they have a clue as to what may have happened.  If they can't help, I'll have to box it up and send it back.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Robert Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I should start off by saying that I am NOT a TV/video/movie type person. This is really my first HD TV, and my first TV over 32". I bought this TV with Christmas money, and doubt I will ever buy a TV of this price ever again. Nothing wrong with the TV, Im just not much of a TV person.Having said that, I LOVE this TV. The picture is excellent, and the controls for the picture are pretty extensive. I've looked up different profiles for this TV online and tried a few different ones, and they all seem to look good to me. I mostly use this TV for OTA channels, and it works great for this, but really makes the non-HD channels stand out like a sore thumb (which obviously is not the TVs fault). I love the picture and have no complaints.The smart apps are really what make this tv shine for me. I watch ESPN, HBO GO, Netflix, Amazon Prime, MLB.tv, VUDU, and YouTube on this TV with wireless internet with no flaws. The interface is a little clumsy, but it works well for me. I also love the on-screen programming guide, which comes in handy for someone like me who does not have cable tv at home. There's a few functions that I could not get to work correctly, such as naming the different inputs on the screen, and getting a Samsung tablet to mirror on the screen, but those are minor things to me, and are definitely not deal breakers. This TV also allows you to rent movies and Skype, but I haven't tried either of those functions, and probably never will. All the other built-in apps are enough for me. The last thing that I really like is the ability to send what is on the TV to my ipad, and use my ipad as an extra screen when away from the TV. That particular app is a little buggy at times, but overall works well enough for me to keep using it. I can watch TV, change channels, and even turn off the TV from my ipad, which is pretty cool to me.There are a few things that I do not like about this TV. First of all, it does not have built-in Bluetooth, which is a big deal to me since Samsung has a great keyboard/remote control for their TVs, but it only works on Bluetooth. There currently is no workaround to get their keyboard to work on this TV. For $1000, I didn't think that Bluetooth wouldn't be to much of a problem to add, but I guess I was wrong. I looked around online and found a Logitech k400 keyboard that is supposed to work okay with this TV, and that is how I would describe it, as being just "okay."  The keyboard is kind of important to me, as it makes it much faster to type when searching for movies through netflix, amazon, etc, and also when using the built in web browser... which reminds me...The built in web browser is just horrible. It is pretty slow, and is difficult to navigate, even with the wireless keyboard. It really isn't worth using to me, especially when I can just plug in my Appletv and mirror the screen, which works much, much faster.  My only other complaint is that I can't mirror my ipad to this screen natively (without using the Appletv). I know that Samsung and Apple are competitors, and that allowing me to mirror my ipad may never occur, but a fella could hope, can't he?Overall, I really am happy with my purchase, and if I ever decide to spend this much money on a TV again, I would definitely consider buying another Samsung. Hopefully by then, they will have worked out some of the kinks in their software.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV with great picture even in off-angle viewing
Reviews.Author: GLVR
Reviews.Content: This was our first large screen HD TV. I had a Samsung 40" flat screen non-smart TV previously and really liked it so we stuck with Samsung. No problems with dead pixels, etc. upon arrival. The Amazon in-house delivery worked out great as they called a couple of hours ahead of their arrival and then brought it right into the living room and unboxed it. The screen has a super picture even in severe off-angle viewing. Just to see, I tried watching this from over 60 degrees off center and the picture was not degraded at all from what I could tell. The speakers on all of these newer TV's are not as good as what we were used to years ago and this one is no exception. They are all right, but not exceptional by any stretch. I did not realize it, but this TV has picture-in-picture capability (with a second tuning source such as a CATV box). Unfortunately, it only works with TV source feeds, not a DVD, etc. The PIP feature is difficult to get to as you have to navigate through a couple of sub-menu's to get to it. Definitely not as good as my old TV where I could easily swap the PIP with the main screen. The internet surfing is cool as we never had it before, but unless you get a keyboard/mouse it will grow old quickly using the remote to type in text/move the cursor. We don't have Netflix, etc. so I don't know how those work. The TV connected automatically to our WiFi  without problem.One problem that I found with the connections on the back is that they are placed too far toward the center of the TV. I wish they had moved the A/V RCA jacks and the 4th HDMI out to the edge more. I hung the TV on the wall and used a cantilever arm bracket that spanned 2 studs due to my situation. The 2 folding bracket arms cover the jacks when it is fully collapsed against the wall. I was able to finally get the 4th HDMI cable and the composite cables from a Wii hooked in, but they are really tight and are bending the cables at almost a 90 degree. I did not see it in the Amazon description, but this TV has 400x400 VESA holes on the back.I don't think you will be disappointed with this TV and the Amazon price point of $1599 is pretty good for a Samsung especially with free shipping and no tax.

Reviews.Title: Great price on a great TV (or almost)
Reviews.Author: Gary Ackerman
Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best price on the Samsung Smart 46: TV…no question about it.  It was shipped on time and arrived without any problem.  Attaching the stand tok two attempts but it worked out okay.  Picture quality was what one would expect from Samsung.  Now the smart part of the smart TV is slightly different.  The Wifi receiver is weak and designed to be located within 6' of your Wifi rougher.  Ours is 60' from the router and the signal must pass through several walls.  I purchased and returned two routers that couldn't deliver, and on the third try I had better results.  However, due to difficulty with Netfilx broadcasts I had to call both Netflix and Samsung.  One blamed the other for the problems.  Ultimately, Samsung had to do a remote factory reset.  We tried from the 60' distance but after 40 minutes of downloading the reset it failed.  Thus, i had to physically move the TV into the same room as the router in order for the reset to download.  It worked in 10 minutes, and Netflix seemed to be operating.  When I moved the TV back to its original location, Netflix was still having problems.  Again, I called Samsung, spoke with a supervisor, and he said, "unplug the TV and after a minute plug it in again."  I did, and we've had a smart TV ever since.  One of the Samsung techs helping me agreed that the Wifi receiver in the TV is weak, thus the need for router nearness for the smartness of the Samsung to show its stuff.

Reviews.Title: If you watch 4 hrs a day, this is the affordable TV with an outstanding picture
Reviews.Author: Rott boy
Reviews.Content: Wanted to watch the Superbowl in 1080p so the search started in Nov., 2013.  Prices still up there and the Black Friday deals were just okay.  Amazon offered a deal first week of Feb. at $1,299+ tax.  Got a local supplier who matched Amazon's price including taxes so I saved $100.  Watching the Samsung UN60F6300 is a different world compared to my 6 yr. old Sony 720p 46" LCD.  Many reviews seem to be using CNET settings.  Seems to be okay for movies but I like to view pictures sharp, detailed and bright.  After a week of fiddling around, came up with the sweet spot.  So if you like your picture quality like I do then try these:Picture Mode  DYNAMICBacklight  19Contrast  91Brightness  45Sharpness  44Color  42Tint  G50/R50Picture OptionsColor Tone  COOLDigital Noise Filter  OffMPEG Noise Filter  OffHDMI Black Level  Normal (Low if available)Film Mode  OffAuto Motion Plus  OffLED Motion Plus  Off10pt White Balance OnIts big weakness is the sound quality from its factory speakers.
