At factory settings, expect distortion to occur at lower frequencies.  Irritating till I adjusted the equalizer.  Use it only when watching news and the like.  For movies and NFL had it hooked up originally to a Bose Lifestyle 35.  To get 5.1 Surround, use the optical cable output (RCA gives out only in 2.1 Stereo).  Since the 60" occupies a large portion of our bedroom wall, having the Bose seemed to bulky for the wife, so moved it to the living room area (where a future 75" is planned) and replaced it with a Pioneer SB23W Soundbar.  This may not be a bass thundering as the Bose but its extremely clear and firm.This is my first Smart TV and first Samsung.  With watching at least 5 hrs/day, am enjoying every moment of it.  Most of the shows are via Directv and the video quality is outstanding.  Watching House of Cards via Netflix is easy and its clear enough when it streams in the 1080p Super HD mode.  Audio is also broadcast in 5.1 surround.  If this will last another 6 yrs or more, then my Sony days are gone.  There's now a new sheriff in town and Samsung has a hit with its value pricing and high quality picture.

Reviews.Title: I am very glad I bought this.
Reviews.Author: okiedan "Pro Bono Publico"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tv.  The other reviewers have done a good job of providing long detailed information.UPDATE:  I wanted to revisit my review to mention that the mirroring or airplay type link works fantastic on this tv when used with my HDX Fire 8.9 inch.  When I got my new version of the large screen fire I was dismayed to find the elimination of the hdmi out on it.  this meant that I could no longer plug my Kindle Fire into my tv to see my books and more important my magazines on my large screen tv.  When my old tv went out and I got this one I did not know fully what I was getting.  I got a lot more than I bargained for which is a good thing.I still need to use my apple tv to use airplay with my iPads, and mac computers but this tv works great with the android based Kindle.For me this is why I bought it, will keep it and am enjoying it.1. Picture quality is great.  clear distinct action and colors.2. simple to program and change settings.3. Very thin and light weight.4. Nice stand if you do not want to mount it.5. Not bad in the sound department.  You will want to try out the various modes but at setting 25 it is VERY loud and has good stereo etc.......6. Plugged a long ethernet cable into it and now I have full internet speed.  did not try the wireless since I was within 15 feet of my apple airport extreme.7. the provided functions...... over the air hd now looks like I have cable.  The information screen shows the show i am watching but also has windows to see other channels that are available.  Where I live there are around 35 hd broadcast stations.8. the remote control and features...... with this plugged into my internet and the computer inside the tv I only have to push the button marked Netflix or Amazon to see both.... So I got rid of my Roku box..

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck as far as tv's go.
Reviews.Author: Brock Films
Reviews.Content: Love the clear motion rate.  Excellent vibrant picture.This coming from a man that has a dozen flat screens in his home.  I own them all, from Sharp to Panasonic.  This is by far one of the best I own.

Reviews.Title: Very pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: Calvin B. Almquist
Reviews.Content: I love it. Smart features work perfectly and I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality when I listen to Spotify on it. It was easy to set up. Picture quality is excellent, but I expected that. Much better than I had even hoped.

Reviews.Title: CNET's calibrated picture settings--LED Clear Motion and Game Mode
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: If you cannot afford to most expensive TV on the market, then this is a fantastic mid-level choice. I'm not going to bother to say the same things that CNET has already said. Just google this TV's model number + CNET review.Most importantly, the picture settings. Again, here's CNET's fantastic calibrated settings. Scroll to the bottom to view.*--Pay close attention to what CNET says about the "LED Clear Motion" setting. Leaving it "on" reduces brightness while improving picture quality.*--Game mode. Only use game mode when playing online multiplayer. It's unnecessary for local/ single player play. Use exact same picture setting for game mode, except decrease brightness to about 8 (because LED Clear Motion will be disabled).*note--I do not take credit for the below. This is from CNET's review*" Below you'll find the settings I found best for viewing the Samsung UN55F6300 in a dim room via the HDMI input. Your settings may vary depending on source, room conditions, and personal preference. Check out the Picture settings and calibration FAQ for more information.Calibration notes: Movie mode prior to calibration was superb, nearly perfect out of the box. The mode did come relatively bright, however, so I reduced the light output accordingly and engaged the LED Clear Motion control, which dims the image quite a bit (about 30 percent). That's not a big deal however, since there's plenty of power in the backlight to compensate.The two-point grayscale ocntrols needed only very minor tweaks to bring as close as possible to perfect, and the same went for the Custom color control--as usual, Samsung's controls worked very well. In fact, it was so accurate that I saw no need to engage the 10-point grayscale control.Picture menu:Backlight: 13Contrast: 95Brightness: 45Sharpness: 0Color: 50Tint: G48/R52--Picture Size menu--Size: Screen Fit--Advanced Settings sub menu--Dynamic Contrast: OffBlack Tone: OffFlesh Tone: 0RGB Only Mode: OffColor Space: Custom (see below)White Balance: (see below)10p White Balance: Off (did not adjust; see above)Gamma: 0Expert Pattern: OffMotion Lighting: Off [grayed out]Color Space submenu:Color Space: CustomRed: Red 45, Green 1, Blue 1Green: Red 2, Green 51, Blue 2Blue: Red 0, Green 0, Blue 43Yellow: Red 50, Green 50, Blue 0Cyan: Red 0, Green 50, Blue 50Magenta: Red 49, Green 1, Blue 51White Balance submenu:R-Offset: 24G-Offset: 25B-Offset: 25R-Gain: 23G-Gain: 24B-Gain: 25--Picture options submenuColor tone: Warm2Digital Clean View: OffMPEG Noise Filter: OffHDMI black level: Normal [grayed out]Film mode: Auto 1Auto Motion Plus: Custom--Auto Motion Plus submenu:Blur reduction: 10Judder reduction: 0 "

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Batman
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great choice. Don't listen to all the people having Smart TV issues, they have wifi problems.First of all, I got an amazing price. $697 two days before black friday. Couldn't ask for a better deal. I received it two business days later, very well packaged (in a HUGE box).The TV was super easy to set up, lots of great features. It is very user-friendly.The picture quality is amazing, almost TOO good. The sound is also great with a built-in subwoofer. Only thing is, when I turn the volume up I hear a weird vibrating with the bass. Not sure if it's an interior issue or something on my entertainment center. I'll figure it out.The design of the tv is beautiful - very slim and nice looking. Light-weight too. PLENTY of connection ports on back. And some of the remote features are nice - Netflix and Amazon Prime buttons! Easy.The wireless internet feature makes my life easier. The Smart TV feature is great - TONS of apps to choose from. I use Netflix and Amazon Prime for video streaming, but there are loads of other options. The smart hub looks very nice and is really interactive.My only complaint is that the menu interaction is a little bit...delayed. Sometimes it takes a second to register your remote commands. It's a little bit annoying, but just a small issue. Maybe they can fix it in future updates.Overall, great TV! Has every feature you need at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, can be a good value at the right price, Smart TV functionality is woefully slow
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and I was able to get it at a good price on Black Friday. FYI the Smart TV functionality is VERY slow, but it does play Amazon, Pandora, and Netflix which is nice. Mounted it on my wall and it looks great.

Reviews.Title: From one star ... to FOUR!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, I purchased from Amazon one of Samsung's first "Smart Tv" (Samsung UN40D6000 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV)--and I was sorely disappointed. It lacked apps for both Amazon Prime and Internet browsing. Numerous phone calls and emails to both Samsung and Amazon never resolved my issue or even answered my questions. A Samsung rep assured me that my TV did, in fact, have a Yahoo app, which it did not. I gave the product 1 star back then--and let me add that I stand by that rating, solely because of those issues. You can't market a "Smart TV" that lacks an Internet browser! Plus, the only way I had of viewing my Amazon Prime videos was to hook up my Asus notebook to the back of the TV. That was ridiculous, to say the least. So, when the wall space of our new house demanded a new TV, I started looking at BestBuy for the new SONY ultra HD Smart TV. My husband, who is disabled, really enjoys watching television, particularly our "cloud" photos and videos of our grandkids and previous travels. The picture on that new SONY is truly amazing!! But--so is the price. At almost $4,000, I could not justify that kind of expenditure, particularly following a move. So, I decided to give Samsung another look. I had to admit that, during my two years of ownership, I have never had a technical problem, the picture was beautiful, and many of the apps were quite useful. As you might imagine, I researched my prospective purchase backwards, forwards, and sideways to make doubly sure that it came with my required apps (Amazon Prime and Internet browser). I crossed my fingers and ordered it. Lovely, crisp picture, easier controls... it is just about perfect. The only reason I can't (yet) give five stars concerns the current clumsy, slow, and unforgiving system for inputting information. It's about like texting on non-smart phones. My grandson gets out of patience watching me: "Why don't you just swype?" he asks me, impatiently. And I say, "Someday, Jay--someday..." How 'bout it, Samsung? Give me swype... and I give you a FIVE!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: JHS
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the picture or quality for the price.  Internet connectivity works as advertised.  Netflix streaming excellent with quick navigation through menus.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic, especially with a good video source
Reviews.Author: Don N.
Reviews.Content: I installed it Friday, and it was a sheer pleasure to watch Ohio State beat Michigan and Auburn beat Alabama.  Love it so far.  It's very easy to update the software once you've connected the TV to your network.  On a screen this big, it's important to have a very good source.  Blu ray is obviously amazing.  For broadcast television, be careful of your cable providers as they are notorious for over-compressing the video in order to free up bandwidth for more channels and internet.  Directv is looking very nice, and way better than my prior cable provider, whom I recently fired.

Reviews.Title: TV good, but Smart features IFFY
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: Purchased this one locally.  The TV is nice.  Good picture, viewing angle, etc.The Smart functions aren't quite what I was hoping for.  The CPU seems a bit underpowered.  Menus are sluggish and it takes apps longer to load than is comfortable.  Some apps work well, some barely work, some don't work.Amazon app - This works very well for Amazon Instant Video.  If you have Amazon Prime, this is great.  There's even a button on the remote for this app.  This is my favorite "smart" function.  Also a button for Netflix, which I haven't tried, but assume works well also.Pandora app - Works well.  Display moves to prevent burn-in.Tune-in Radio - Works a little.  Over half of the listed stations fail due to "stream error".  It turns out that the app only supports mp3 streams.  Though it lists tons of stations, only the ones that happen to be mp3 work.  There is no indication in the station listing.  You just try station after station until you find ones that don't fail due to "stream error".Web Browser - yes, there's an integrated web browser, but it's pretty clunky to use.  Maybe with a bluetooth keyboard (which I didn't try) it would be less painful.PLEX - I read that the PLEX app can be used to stream music and videos from my Mac.  Though I got the PLEX server running on the Mac end, and could access it clumsily through the browser on the TV, the Samsung TV app didn't work.  It hangs after configuration.  I've tried every trick I could find and then finally gave up.I have a Silicon Dust HDHomeRun Prime tuner.  There is supposedly an app, but it's not available for this TV.  It turns out that the app ONLY works for 2012 Samsung TVs.  Not 2013!

Reviews.Title: Great TV that I got at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Cohnny
Reviews.Content: Can't describe how much I love this T.V. I've set up my home network to be able to play movies and television shows from my server and it works like a dream! I wish I would have gotten the 50 inch but that's my fault.My only complaint is the interface and small nitpicking about how things sort/show in Samsung Link.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy
Reviews.Author: Johnny Young "Old Gezzer"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Excellent picture. Smart TV is the way to go with all the apps and web connection.

Reviews.Title: Samsung nailed it with this tv!
Reviews.Author: Ry_Bunk
Reviews.Content: Best value for an internet enabled tv I could find.  Easy and quick setup and the tv is thinner that I expected.  The internet features are much faster than my first tv with internet, you can page much faster and the menus are very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32F6300 32-Inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: bigman
Reviews.Content: this was my first flat screen tv after my 150 lb Panasonic tube tv died and nobody from panasonic could fix it because it was too old.i had been sick for the last 7 months and couldn't even go to a store but i bought it from amazon after seeing a good review from consumer reports as to picture quality which was the highest rating excellent. i use Verizon fios and the tv had a great picture for 1080i tv shows and dvd movies and hulu. it has an anti blur motion feature. i had limited funds so i got the 32 inch version was was expensive. after seeing the picture if i had the money i would have got a bigger version. the only time you see a pixel blur problem is on digital channels. 1080p and 1080i the picture is beautiful. there is a factory setting called echo sense which was turned on which gave the screen a dark color on my tivo. once i called Samsung they showed me how to shut it off and everything was great. Samsung has good service. they say the sound is only fair so i use a digital audio out cable to my amplifier. my amplifier is older no hdmi but the tv has 4 of these. basically you must sit directly in front of it.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Dimp
Reviews.Content: My first 46 Inch TV - Excellent picture quality, excellent sound. Easy to setup. Easy to use. No issues so far (knock on wood).Every time I'm watching something on the TV, I find myself saying - so damn clear!

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for a smaller room
Reviews.Author: D. Steinborn
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a medium sized LED HDTV that supported 1080P with smart features.  It is delightfully compact for a 32" screen.  This unit is light and sits a top a Zvox "sound bar."  It was easy to set up and its remote control controls both the Zvox sound bar and my TIVO unit.  The picture quality is excellent while the sound is decent (The Zvox makes a huge improvement in the sound).  Setup for the TV is easy and only takes a few minutes including the time to set up the remote so that it will control your set top box.  The setup for both Netflix and Amazon instant video service is simple.  I use the units wired ethernet port to connect to my home network and it works perfectly.  Since I have not used the WIFI networking feature of the unit I can't comment on how well that works.

Reviews.Title: Can't stop looking at it.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "tjpaingod"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, wireless internet, all my tv apps on the TV.  I only wish I could have gone bigger.  This TV looks fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Samsung the Best
Reviews.Author: docloc
Reviews.Content: All I had to do was turn this TV on and the color and sound were perfect.  The picture is like watching a live program.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: PWD69
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced an older Panasonic 32" 720P LCD that I was having problems hearing and understanding the speakers.  This Samsung has a picture that blows others out of the water along with a much improved speaker system.  This is a bedroom TV but if I was to replace our living room TV, I would not hesitate to purchase this same model only in a larger format.  Highly impressed!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV is great
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Color and sound are great.  It may be a little "too smart" for me so rating may go up as time passes.

Reviews.Title: Hmmm....nice picture, Smart not so much
Reviews.Author: Evan C Barbee
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for one week now.  I am very pleased with the picture quality which was my number one requirement.  As I've read other places, it lacks slightly with washed out blacks....they could be darker, but generally it is superb for its price.  I have adjusted settings to my liking and they work great for most instances.  I haven't played any video games or hooked up a computer to this yet, and as such have no opinion as to how it performs.*The reason for 4 stars....if not 3:I like the Smart Hub....but mostly only for its appearance.  I thought it mattered to me more than it does in use.  This TV has a dual core processor...and let me tell you, it is god awful slow.  My 2 year old Sony Blu-ray player loads apps and content MUCH faster than this thing.  I could boot a PC and launch youtube on it in the time it takes the youtube app to load and actually be "ready."  I am not kidding.  I am EXTREMELY disappointed with the Smart features.  Being one week in with this TV, it has already had 2 updates pushed from Samsung...usually I like updates...new features and all...but I question why my new TV had two updates already.  I am at a point where I am seriously contemplating returning it and getting a similar TV from another brand that has 3D as well and is slightly cheaper.  Having compared the TVs side by side at a local store, I didnt notice much of a difference in picture quality, but was sold with the Samsung name and the Smart Hub.  I was also under the impression there were Smart Hub apps I could use on my android.....guess what, wrong.  If I had a Samsung Galaxy, then yes, but not with my other brand android.Signed,upset but patient and troubleshooting/learning if I can get past my issues with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV with a small problem
Reviews.Author: turf
Reviews.Content: I think this is an excellent TV. I got it because I have a lot of chairs off center in the den where it is located and this was the best TV I found to provide a viewable picture off center, even way off center like 60 degrees to the side and 45 degrees below (it is over a high mantle). Of course, way off angle is not ideal viewing, but you can at least still see the TV instead of it blacking or whiting out at this angle like cheaper TVs do.I also like this TV since the picture quality is excellent, even during the day, in a room with a lot of windows. One thing you must do if you care about picture quality is look online on how to disable the Samsung "auto motion plus" feature. I think it is supposed to be better for fast motion video to cause less blurring, but it causes the "soap opera effect" you see a lot of people mention as a negative. I have never noticed blur on the TV without having it enabled and it is pretty dumb that it is set as the default since so many people see a Samsung TV and think it has a crummy picture due to this.I did not think I would use the smart features much since I have a PC connected to the TV, but my family watches Netflix and Amazon videos a lot on the TV and it is much more convenient to do it directly on the TV vs through the PC.The one problem I have with the TV is a stupid error message it often displays when I change the source. The only HDMI cable to the TV goes through a Sony receiver. When you change sources on the receiver, it takes a few seconds for the receiver to switch. In this time, the TV pops up a message that says "Check the device is connected properly, then try turning on the device by selecting the button below" with an STB (set top box) symbol and an OK button. This message stays on the screen for 60 seconds, blocking the content, until it either times out or you dig out the TV remote to dismiss it. It is very frustrating. I have contacted Samsung support who first wanted to know the firmware version on the TV them recommended I do a factory reset. When I asked them if that would change the delay or disable this annoying message, they said no, and admitted there was no way to disable the message. So it is something I live with but makes me rate this otherwise excellent TV 4 stars instead of 5. One thing a friend recommended was to make a macro sequence on my Harmony remote to quickly dismiss it, but I have not figured out how to do this yet.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV. Just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Kurt Pritchett
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this TV to anyone. Wish it came the the motion control remote. It does have a nice picture

Reviews.Title: Not so stylish stand...
Reviews.Author: omamed
Reviews.Content: So far so good. Wish the stand was a little more stylish, but the important part works great!  Would buy again!

Reviews.Title: Superb - Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Burton N. Brooks "lightningman"
Reviews.Content: Easy clear instructions for setup- smart TV works great- customer service assistance on some minor questions has helped out 100%

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: tedja laksmana
Reviews.Content: the picture way better than sony bravia led smart tv also the price i really love it i recommend it to all my frinds

Reviews.Title: Smart TV Smart Choice
Reviews.Author: C. Eley
Reviews.Content: After much research I landed on this Samsung and purchased from Amazon.Colors are simply stunning on the TV,enjoy working with the apps viewing Facebook,Netflix,Amazon etc.We couldn't be more pleased with our choice of TVs,Have always been a Samsung fan.I called Samsung to ask a few questions on more than one occasion and I found customer service to be easy to access and very helpful.On a side note I decided to plug in my receiver(usb) for logitech kr400wireless keyboard,mouse combo and to my surprise it works when browsing the web with built in app on TV.highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a SUPER price..
Reviews.Author: Rgs0213
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV 3 weeks ago and I couldn't be happier.. I previously had a Samsung UN55D6000 and was very happy with it but wanted something a little bigger.. The 60 inch version is perfect.. Everything works like it's supposed to and the Smart Hub is a lot nicer from the one that I had on the old TV.. Much faster response and I can finally watch Amazon Prime movies on it without having to use the Xbox.. It did take a few weeks to get the picture just right and I'll probably do a few more adjustments over the next few weeks but even at this point, the picture is super sharp.. The only negative I have noticed is that viewing angle is fairly narrow but it isn't much of an issue in the spot I have it positioned.. Haven't seen any light bleeding on this one like I had in the 55 inch which had a noticeable light coming from the bottom left corner.. Fourth Samsung I have purchased over the last 6 years and they just get better every year..EDIT 12/31/13...To fix the low sound while streaming from Netflix or Amazon:Menu - Sound - Speaker Settings - Auto Volume set to NormalThis helped 100% with the low volume while streaming movies.

Reviews.Title: No problems shipping a big TV
Reviews.Author: Brendan McCormack
Reviews.Content: Great TV, best picture going, the smart TV function a real plus!  No issues shipping the big TV, great service, it was delivered and set-up in my living room.

Reviews.Title: UNF6300 - Great Price and Quality
Reviews.Author: Sarang Sangamkar "Sarang"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my 32" Vizio ( which  was bought during Superbowl of 2007).Picture Quality : It's an LED; so ..what the heck ...must be good.Sound : This TV needs a good home theater or a good Sound bar. This is to ensure that you are not disappointed with the picture quality due the the sound.Networking: Integrates with my PC , IPAD. It play the songs / videos /pictures from your PC.By IPAD integration, I mean it can play / mirror Youtube videos from Ipad . Guess it works for Netflix as well. I tried mirroring the skype video call but it didn't work.I don't have a Samsung phone ; so I can't speak on whether it can sync the videos / Skype from your phone.All popular apps come as default + there are a bunch of apps at the samsung store.  It would be great if Samsung syncs up with google play and we can give 5 STARS to this TV.Though I have it on a TV stand , i'd love to wall mount this given that it only ~1.5 inch thick.All in All, if you need a SMART TV and if you are not a 3D person, this is it for under a GRAND.4

Reviews.Title: TV model is a lemon save yourself and read
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for 1 week. I got it on Friday 12/6/2013, set it up on Saturday 12/7/2013. I was on step 6 of setup for first time and the tv turned itself off and then back on. It would do this multiple times changing the frequency of the power cycles until it was so quick that nothing would even appear on the screen anymore. I contacted Samsung who set up a service order and said I would get a call in 24-48 hours about tech visit. I received a call about 63 hours later saying that my ticket was assigned and they provided me with my tech's name and a contact number. They said the tech would contact me within 2-3 days to schedule an appointment. The next day I received a call from the tech saying he was getting delivery of parts on 12/12/2013 and would schedule the appointment for 5pm that day. The tech arrived and the problem would not reproduce during his 20 minute visit. He lied on his paperwork about what he did, saying he had to do something while he was there to get credit for visit (service tech was sketchy, but that is a whole different issue not related to this review) This morning (12/13/2013) I had tv on for approximately 1 hour and the problem started occurring again. I grabbed my laptop to catch it on video [...]I contacted Samsung again (now I have had tv for just a couple hours shy of 1 week and have got to watch for less than 2 hours) and they had to create a new service order since previous ticket was closed. (I even contacted the sketchy tech and he said just return the TV...) They set up the new service order and told me that dreaded 24-48 hours to wait for call to schedule tech visit again... so I decided I would inform the consumer this TV is garbage, except  for the small amount of time it has worked. When it does work it is beautiful. The problem is I found a forum thread which says I am not alone. Here is the link to that forum.[...]Buyer Beware!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Brand New TV and on day 1 I have to schedule a repair
Reviews.Author: jason "sparty"
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Amazon user but have never written a review until now. I received this television today, I set it up and turned it on, After about 5 minutes of me getting use to the menu's it started power cycling on and off repeatably, I turned the tv on and off and unplugged it hoping that would reset it, but nope every time I plugged it back in, it would go through the same power cycle.  I called customer support they had me try the same thing and told me it would need to be repaired.  Doing a search online shows that is a very common problem among Samsung TV'S.  I would avoid Samsung altogether.  Go with an LG or a Sony I have never had any  problems with their tv's let alone 5 minutes after I turn it on.

Reviews.Title: My New Samsung
Reviews.Author: David Ballam
Reviews.Content: Samsung is just the best. This is my second TV from them, my first being a 46inch LCD which I know have in my bedroom. That one still works perfectly too. Samsung builds quality. The colors on the 6300 are amazing, the blacks are pretty good, and the video processing is great. I just hooked my Xbox One and it looks incredible. Highly recommend, awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV is Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: TexGardenGal
Reviews.Content: This TV is wonderful!  We have had it approximately one month and can find NOTHING we don't like about it.  The picture is exceptionally clear and the colors seem to be true.  Set up was easy.  We did not realize how bad the picture quality was on our old TV until we got this new Samsung!  We watch a lot of sports and there is no distortion when the action gets fast.  We have it sitting in an entertainment center and when the TV is turned off it just sort of disappears into the background.  We also like the very small "frame" around the screen.  I do a lot of shopping online and, after reading many reviews, we decided upon a Samsung and are not disappointed.  It was the right decision.  I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Does It Right Again
Reviews.Author: James White
Reviews.Content: Once again, I have purchased a Samsung LED HDTV, and have yet to be even a little disappointed! This Slim, Smart Hub TV is has fantastic sharpness and color, right out of the box! Easy setup and I really like to onscreen smart hub.MTF as I use the features.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with Samsung
Reviews.Author: ElZorro
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung LED.  It is awesome.  easy setup, menus are logical and easy to follow, and the picture quality is great.  Took off one star because of two reasons:  Sound is mediocre at best, which is almost normal nowadays because they expect people have other speakers attached to it.  Also, I don't like the design of the base.  It is big and takes up the entire table, and pushes the TV several inches forward.  What good is a super slim TV if it still sits 6" from the wall  because of the base?

Reviews.Title: REBOOTS all on its own at random times
Reviews.Author: Tena
Reviews.Content: I had it for a week before it started rebooting all by itself.  I called support they blamed the surge protector.  I plugged it into the wall and the reboots even got worse. The TV has been sent back and I am getting a different model.  I pulled up this model with a search reboot and it appears this is an issue with this model.  I would NOT recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Surpassed All Expectations
Reviews.Author: AJC "loquitur"
Reviews.Content: My 40" version of this TV replaced a ten-year-old Sony Bravia HD (1080i)—one of the last CRT's, it weighed a ton—and I was certain that I'd never be able to match the untroubled picture and deep natural colors of that set. But with this Samsung hooked up and calibrated according to the settings listed by U Lala earlier in this thread, I am dumbstruck and in awe at the quality of the picture I'm getting. The CNET review of this TV said it was a good buy even at a higher price, but the blacks weren't very deep, but I found them downright velvety, easily the equivalent of my old Sony, the brave dinosaur. I think only a real tech type or perhaps an artist could find fault with the quality of the picture. To me it's stunning.Here are the CNET calibrations, which differ slightly from U Lala's. I tried both and preferred the latter:[...]And here's the review by the very picky and reliable David Katzmeier that convinced me to buy this TV:[...]Thank you Samsung, Amazon, David, U Lala et al for helping me choose this perfect (for me) TV set.

Reviews.Title: Good Wi-Fi, Slim Size, and Great Picture - Do not like auto-dim feature
Reviews.Author: Totally Honest Reviewer "barb"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN40F6300 Smart TV is very slim and streamlined. There was no manual included in the package and I had to go to Samsung site to download it. The TV automatically downloaded the current update upon setup.  Picture is beautiful once you get all the adjustments set to your preference and look straight on to the screen, but is not good viewed from the side.  Wi-Fi works great with my wireless network and connected to Amazon and Netflix in a very few seconds. The TV kept dimming after a few minutes, and there was nothing in the manual regarding how to turn this off, but I learned through searching the Internet that some Samsung Smart TV's are programmed to auto-dim after a few minutes, and that the dimming begins when the brightness control is set above 50. After revising my settings, I no longer have this problem.  This TV also operates my Samsung Blu-Ray player.  For the price, this is a great TV.  I love being able to watch movies on Amazon and Netflix within seconds in high definition with just a click of the remote and have had absolutely no problems with the wireless staying connected. The TV is located in an adjacent room about 20 feet from the router. The sound coming from the speakers is ok, but could be better. The main negative is that the picture is not good when viewed at a side angle.

Reviews.Title: Great Product especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dawid Lacki
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on a price match deal and ended up paying $1099 (PM Sears). Not only is it a great deal, but the quality of the tv was superb! Not a single dead pixel, the picture looks great, and it is very slim. The Smart TV feature works great especially if you have a samsung android device since you can use your phone as a remote control! The apps on this TV are even better than a Roku and Apple TV combined! Looks like Sammy is definitely stepping up their game. This is the new 2013 model btw and it blows my 46" 2012 Sharp Aquos 3D ($1200) out of the water in terms of price/performance ratio. I own other samsung devices and have had zero problems with this company. I wish i would have bought two for the price.Samsung, you have failed to disappoint me once again ;)

Reviews.Title: Good where it counts, I think
Reviews.Author: Paolo
Reviews.Content: Purchased the 40” model on 11/16/13 at the place that sells craftsman & Kenmore…  It is very thin and very lightweight.  Assembly (if you can call it that) was a snap.  Our DirecTV HR24 model uses the HDMI, so the picture was pretty good right out of the box.  This Samy is replacing a 32” 720P 60Hz Vizio, so I went into the DTV menu and “checked the boxes” for all the other resolutions (1080P, 1080i, etc…).  The Samy remote is long and slender— a little too thin for my liking.  I like the larger DTV remote better.  Tinkered with the apps and web connection & that all seems to work fine with our wi-fi, although I don’t know how much practical use it’ll get.  The sound/speakers is lacking (true of most flat screens)...  I watched a couple of movies, TV shows and some live sports in the last couple of days to see if  there was any setting adjustment needed…  HERES THE QUESTION FOR YOU ALL,  that may have me packing this TV back up & returning it----  Is it possible that some TV movies with just simple “normal” scenes can cause “motion blur”???  Or some TV “stations”?  I watched Pirates of the Caribbean without any blur, some live Saints vs 49ers without blur… and then a Hallmark Channel (HD) Christmas movie that had terrible blur all over the place… It was very noticeable even for an old man like me…  Never noticed that with the Vizio.  Any thoughts?

Reviews.Title: SPEND THE EXTRA $100 AND GET THE 6400 MODEL
Reviews.Author: LMBrooks
Reviews.Content: This 6300 model is a good tv cause you can't go wrong with Samsung. But the 6400 model has so much more for your $, like 480 motion flow rate for quick moving objects and the 6300 has 240 motion flow rate. The 6400 has the micro-dimming feature that helps with glare, make blacks blacker and whites whiter and 6300 does not have this feature at all. Also the 6400 is 3D and the 6300 is not. The picture is absolutely beautiful and set up easy step by step directions.Please check out the 6400 model before making your final decision. I have attached a link to the 6400 model.Samsung UN55F6400 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D Slim Smart LED HDTV

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: William Schaefer
Reviews.Content: Does everything I want. The picture is beautiful, the sound very good for such a thin design, easy to setup.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Khura
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 60F6300 from brick and mortar store and have been playing with it for last two days. This TV has the most amazing picture quality I have seen.Design: very beautifully designed TV, makes living room more elegant! It's slim and does not create clutter of wires in the back side. TV comes with a wire managing clip that can be stuck on back panel.Video: To get the best picture quality it's important to chooe right picture mode. Just finished watching French Open semi finals on this TV and picture quality was simply stunning. For sports choose picture mode as dynamic and in picture option change auto motion plus to smooth. For movies choose movie mode and make sure to turn off auto motion plus otherwise we get soap opera effects and it kills movie viewing experience. Once these setting are done, modes can be changed quickly by clicking "Tools" button. As noticed by other users game mode is difficult to find, played a couple of games on PS3 and picture quality remains amazing!Audio: sound is good for flat panel. I use 7.2 channel receiver connected to ARC HDMI port. Getting good sound field for OTA DTV.Smart Feature: browsing smart feature is fast and smooth. Remote work decently while browsing but putting words using on screen keyboard is painful. Rather than using external keyboard I have downloaded samsung remote app for ipad and Galaxy S3 and this makes working with with smart apps really cool. Samsung remote app for ipad is greatl and I would recommend it to be tried at least once if you have an ipad. Using Galaxy S3 phone with TV works like charms. Allshare feature is easy to use and you can share screen of phone on the TV, it's a really cool feature showing pictures n videos on phone to friends. I plugged in a regular logitch wireless keyboard n mouse dongle to the TV and I am able to use it without any issues. I tired 3 different types of webcam but tv does not recognise anything other than samsung made webcam. Best part is TV plays almost every type of videos thru external hard drive/pen drive. This TV has the biggest codecs cache I have seen so far playing videos.Netflix, Hulu apps are fast. Using skype on TV with samsung webcam is fun. I wish they supported standard webcam.Network Connection: as soon as I connected the TV I updated the firmware. I have no issues with wifi at all. Connection is strong and does not break. Wifi generally does not provide enough throughput and is susuptible to interference, if connecting with Ethernet is an option we should choose it over the wifi specially if streaming content.In brief, it's worth spending money on this TV, I would highly recommend it to a friend. This is the best TV I had so far!

Reviews.Title: Horrible clouding and backlight bleeding
Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: I bought both UN75F6400CF and UN75F6300A from Costco.  I am returning the UN75F6300A.  The UN75F6300A has horrible clouding in several spots that are visible even with lights on in the room.  And it's got terrible backlight bleeding along the bottom edge of the screen, and the lower left corner of the screen looks as though someone punctured the corner with a pin because the light shines through like a miniature spotlight.  Black looks grey.  Also the stand of the UN75F6300A is very flimsy.  My UN75F6300A leans backwards about 10 to 15 degrees.  And when you clean the screen with light pressure, the TV wobbles back and forth.  The UN75F6300A looks and feels very cheap.  In comparison, the UN75F6400CF looks and feels much sleeker.  It has some clouding but it's much less visible.  My UN75F6400CF has no backlight bleeding from the edges or the corners.  Black looks good.  And its stand is nice and strong.  I guess you get what you pay for.  If you are debating between UN75F6300 and UN75F6400, my advice is pay a little more and get the UN75F6400.  If you plan to keep the TV for many years, then $600 more for the UN75F6400 should be worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: Screen glare and after 3 months it does not power on.
Reviews.Author: BitCounter
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace an older Samsung that worked great for years. Don't believe the writing on the box, this TV is not that smart. Seems to be trying to do too many things at one time and is not easy to drive as the older model. Attaching a USB drive to the unit does work but the TV does not auto wake up the USB drive. I have to unplug and plug the drive back in for the TV to recognize it. The TV seems to have a mind of its own. It would change functions randomly. IE: Netflix would switch to regular TV. As far as the glare, I wish I had thought of checking the glare while at the store. The finish on this TV screen shines the room lights right back at you. I'm taking the time to write this after the TV no longer powers on after a half hour of seeming to be possessed and powering down then up then changing channels. I called Samsung. We did:  The 'unplug it and see if that fixes anything.' The 'Press the on button from behind' (I didn't even know that button was there). While 'off' I can see the TV on the network. Guess it is only in a coma. Samsung repair service is to call and schedule an appointment to come work on it. Any physical damage voids warranty. I'm to have it in an area where they can work on it. Sure hope they like my living room carpet as their repair area.Update: Repairman came two days later. Replaced the part in error. TV is working again.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV, but Samsung service STINKS!
Reviews.Author: Bob Areddy
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I think the picture quality and function of the TV are excellent.  After calibration, it looks 9/10 to me.  I turn off all of the "auto" junk in the menus, then downloaded free calibration videos (they are freeware ones out there), and calibrated white/black/tint/color levels.  Almost impossible to calibrate correctly with the auto settings are turned on.After about 2-3 months the TV would occasionally reboot.  I figured it was a software problem and it'll be fixed in the next upgrade, but the problem kept getting worse, until the unit would just reboot endlessly.  So I called Samsung.Their support STINKS.  If you tell someone you'll respond within 24 hours, then respond within 24 hours.  If you tell someone you'll call them back, then call them back.  It's amazing how many companies don't do what they'll say.  Anyway, I fill out there support form, took a video of the problem and uploaded with the form (which is a great idea, got to give them credit for that), and explained in DETAILS the problem.3 days later they shoot me an email with 4 troubleshooting steps (which are brainless) AND close my ticket without a resolution!So I do their troubleshooting... reset the TV, update the firmware (it was already updated), unplug the TV for 5 minutes.  Stuff you know isn't going to matter.  Of course, the problem isn't fixed.Now I have to go back through their online system, 3 days go by, nobody calls me, so I call them.  Tech walks me through 30 minutes of troubleshooting, even though I referenced the original ticket which explained this was already all done.  She finally tells me they'll have to send service out.  Yeah, no kidding!Come on Samsung, I know you can do better. It's *not* *that* *hard*.I'll give props to the local service company, Gibson TV, in Roseville Michigan.  The girl there e-mailed me the very following morning that Samsung opened a service ticket, said she already ordered the part based on my description of the issue, because it's a common problem (after Samsung denied it was a common problem).  The part came in in a couple of days, Gibson TV called me back to set up the service call.  They were professional, ON TIME, and fixed the TV in about 15 minutes.  The repairman said it was a common problem.

Reviews.Title: Pretty smart tv
Reviews.Author: Shailendra Hegde
Reviews.Content: I have used this for 4 months and I have a good idea of the pluses and the minuses. The picture and sound quality are top class. The app feature for smart tv is very handy. I do see an issue with wifi connectivity though. I use Netflix extensively over Comcast network. May be it's the connectivity in the area where I live but the connection drops once in a while. The annoying thing however is that sometimes the TV does not reconnect to the wifi automatically when the connection is back up and running. It requires me to exit the app and reenter the wifi password. The process of reentering password using the remote is not very easy and that's my only grouse with the TV. I hope Comcast and Samsung sort this issue out. Otherwise, it's a highly recommended TV

Reviews.Title: TV is great - Smart Features are AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tech guru so I won't wax intellectual about the ins and outs of the TV's features. However, I am pretty versed at how to use tech devices. I could have save SO MUCH $$ by just buying the regular version of this tv without the smart features. The apps are horrible (especially the Amazon app). By horrible I mean they are slow, poorly designed and really really buggy. It has gotten to the point where we have had to reset the smart hub so many times that the darn thing won't even set up anymore. After countless calls with Samsung we have decided to buy another Roku and bypass dealing with the situation anymore. Learn the lesson from me - don't shell out the extra $$ for smart features. Not worth it!

Reviews.Title: Poor product + Poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Red Devil
Reviews.Content: First time :Okay, so I was very excited when I received the product. Opened the box and found the one of the screws has some threading missing. As a result of it, no matter what i do, the screw just won't go in. As a result of this, i can't assemble the stand.So, I called the Amazon customer service and got a brand new TV as a replacement immediately (I still have the defective piece at my home, hopefully UPS will come and pick it up soon).Second time :This time, there is no issue with the screws and I was able to assemble the TV properly. Now comes the real issue....As i started watching movies on Netflix and Amazon instant video, i realized that there is a big black patch on TV on the right hand side. So, I call the Amazon customer service, they made me unplug the wire and some basic stuff, the issue still happened. The customer service from amazon then connected me to Samsung customer service.This is where all hell broke loose..I spoke to samsung customer service for 2.5 hours (ridiculous) !!!Those guys accessed my TV remotely and took snapshots of the issue. They then escalated the problem to their "Research and Development" and told me that the research guys will get back to me in couple of days and see if they can resolve the issue or not.My appreciation to AMAZON for sending me two defective pieces in a row !!!!!I am not sure if I would buy another TV from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Black is a little off; Crispness is better than what we had
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Wagner
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a 50" Samsung plasma with a TON of burn in on it... so this was definitely better.  It was very easy to mount on a stand we already owned.  It was pretty easy to set up too.  The remote is easy to use and offers a lot of options.  I haven't entirely figure out the "smart" part of the tv, but it keeps telling us SpongeBob is on, which my son likes, so.....  ;-)  We did notice, in "dynamic" mode, the blacks are either very black (which I liked), or fade in and out of black & hard to see on the whole screen (which was irritating).  To fix it, we just went back to "standard" mode.  Overall, pleased, so far.

Reviews.Title: Great in the bedroom!
Reviews.Author: Ben S.
Reviews.Content: I love this television and it is the perfect size for the bedroom. Fits nicely on the dresser and is big enough to watch movies in bed and small enough that it doesn't seem out of place. The picture quality is fantastic and I love the "Picture Off" feature where you can turn the screen off, but can still continue listening to the audio from the television. I use the "Picture Off" and the Sleep Timer when I go to sleep so I can listen to music as I drift off to La-La Land. The built-in Wi-Fi capability is handy, and the 4 HDMI inputs are very convenient. All in all, I am VERY happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Bart O'Brien
Reviews.Content: This television far out surpasses my last Samsung, which has been moved to the play room. Smart TV is definitely the way to go if you are shopping for a TV, they are worth the money. Easy set up, it was a breeze to connect it to all components. Setting the TV to your visual and audio preferences was simple as well. Now I'm sitting back enjoying this great TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV !
Reviews.Author: Hristo Danchev
Reviews.Content: 6 months in and cannot be happier with my Samsung TV ! It's slim, easy to set up and updates its apps regularly ! Recommended !

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV
Reviews.Author: Sandesh Sreenivas
Reviews.Content: I CANNOT EVEN GET STARTED ON HOW MUCH I LOVE THIS TV.  Was on sale for $1399 I think plus 2% off from amazon and free shipping.  Cant beat it.  Love the smart technology as well!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv for the price!
Reviews.Author: Robleo Porter
Reviews.Content: I wanted to wait a few weeks to a month to give it a final verdict since I bought a ps4 along with it. Have to say this tv delivers. You can see everything very clear and the sound is not to shabby for a tv. Hoping to upgrade to surround sound pretty soon. I popped in a couple of blu-rays (Marvel: Avengers, The Dark Knight Rises, and Transformers: Dark Side Of the Moon just to name a few) to see the picture quality and boy was I blown away at how clear and colorful the movies' were. All in all I love this TV and will buy a bigger one later on.

Reviews.Title: So far -excellent
Reviews.Author: Katrine Kretser
Reviews.Content: Met the standards and expectations advertised. After extensive evaluations of a number of brands the features offered on this model appeared to outweigh the other brands.

Reviews.Title: 6300 are Not user firendly Internet capable
Reviews.Author: ai chan1
Reviews.Content: The TV is great but if you plan on using the internet browser ,  its completely useless because there is no compatible wireless accesories , the keyboard. So Do not buy this model, the 6300. The companty are sloly phasing this outI will not  say much about the other feature becuase everything else is good.I thought I researched this well before I bought it, but I was mistaken . .I will most like trasfer this TV set to the second bedroom and buy a better more universal TV set.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Alexander Vigdorovich
Reviews.Content: The TV works well. The only issue I experienced was the incompatibility of the HDMI signal arriving from the Comcast digital converter. It appears to be a software issue. I fixed it by installing a 1 to 2 switch between the converter and the TV. The switch refreshes the signal, and the problem went away.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: trackstar
Reviews.Content: It's the best tv I have ever bought it is perfect for gaming and watching Netflix. It has really good color

Reviews.Title: Good picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: Chiro
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very good picture, but the sound is disappointing. The slim design seems to prohibit good speaker direction. I needed to resort to a ZVOX external sound system to have the sound equal the image quality.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Kelly J. Walnofer
Reviews.Content: The picture is perfect. There are so many options to this tv. The interactive features make it more like a computer. Loving our SMART tv.

Reviews.Title: Love the set, but not properly screwed...
Reviews.Author: Shawn M. Winnie
Reviews.Content: ...Machine screwed, that is.On initial impression, the set has exceeded our expectations. Five stars for the TV; dropping a star off for Samsung's failure to include the required screws to assemble the base. (If you're going to VESA mount this to the wall, go crazy - it's a great set.)If you're not wall-mounting, the TV attaches to a mounting plate which attaches to a slim base. The plate-to-base connection requires four machine screws that - at least in my box - weren't included. The plate-to-TV connection is three more screws.According to the quick setup guide, these are supposed to be M4x12 screws. After a trip to Home Depot, I discovered that M4x12 screws don't actually work on the plate-to-base connection. I jury-rigged an SAE size 6 nut & bolt combination which seems good enough for the base and the M4x12 screws did work to mate up the plate-to-TV.Reviews here and elsewhere suggest that some customers are getting the required screws, though I note that they aren't on the otherwise complete parts list.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60F600 60-Inch 1080 120hz Slim Smart LED HDTV 2013 Model
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I have been buying Samsung TV's quite a while. Bought this for my brothers family. I have 4 in my home. These are absolutely the best TV's you can buy. And this was a great price. Only way to get a better picture is get a higher megahertz. Other than that, this TV is awesome. But a 120HZ is one fabulous picture with a Samsung true LED.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Beatrice
Reviews.Content: I do love it - it's big enough to see the scores while watching the Olympics and the picture is great.  It's easy to connect with Amazon.com and there are so many movies I can watch for free with a one button click.

Reviews.Title: Great Price and Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Jewelle Ogle
Reviews.Content: I really did my research before I bought this TV, I've been looking for about a year.  This TV came super fast, I set up the delivery date and they were here on time.  TV was very easy to set up.  The sound is not too great, but this is something I come to expect with the slim HDTV's.  I have my sound bar so that fixed that issue. I love this TV, the picture quality is great.  When you're watching a movie you feel like you're in a movie theater.  Your viewing experience is the best.  I love all the Apps, especially Netflix and Pandora.  Amazon had the best price, so I'm happy I decided to buy this TV from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Delivery was better than if purchased locally.
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Great picture.Has the featues that I wanted.My speakers had two wires that I needed to plug into the audio.I got help from samsung.com and resolved my issue.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation, great picture, beautiful design
Reviews.Author: Carlos Garcia CCS-400097
Reviews.Content: I received our new UN32F6300 LED TV yesterday morning, and following the instructions on the quick start guide, safely took it out of the box, assembled the stand (4 provided screws), attached it to the  screen (3 provided screws), and used 3 connections: AC power to a surge protected outlet; HDMI to our AVR and RCA Composite Video (yellow) to our AVR (yes, our DirecTV box is not HD, and has analog outputs) it was all set and ready for configuration. Which is also very straight forward using the menu from the provided remote. It is WiFi connected to our home network and through it to the internet, and this was perhaps the longer process for having to enter the WiFi data (SSID, security type and password) using the scroll button in the remote to work with the on screen keyboard. The configuration process is actually very friendly an intuitive, and uses graphics in the source and connecting ports configuration, that look very much like what you have on the back and side of the TV as connection ports, so it's difficult to make a wrong choice.During the setup process being connected to the internet, it detected a new firmware update and I let it perform the upgrade (it takes a little while, from 20 to 30 minutes). That went without incidents, and the configuration parameters didn't change in my case.By early afternoon we were already watching content from the internet (crackle, Netflix, and some other stuff available through the menu). We also watched an old DVD movie (1080p @ 60Hz) and the image was very crisp, we haven't yet bought any Blu-Ray movie (1080p @120Hz) so I'll update on that some other time. The analog signal coming trough the AVR from the DirecTV box is very good for a Standard Digital TV signal.So far, we are very happy with our purchase and If anything changes, I'll adjust my review. But for now I would definitively recommend this product to anyone with a small entertainment space (ours is 130 square feet)', that doesn't need a larger screen, but still want a great quality pictures from Satellite TV as well as BD and/or DVD. We don't play video games, so I wouldn't dare to make any comments on that aspect.

Reviews.Title: as advertised
Reviews.Author: Desirea Miller
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear picture!  Love the Smart TV and easy access to favorite sites on the remote.  Light, easy to use, and exactly what I was looking for!

Reviews.Title: A+
Reviews.Author: Jeremy E
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Only marginal issue is delay between input and signal relay to U-verse box. Makes DVR usage difficult.Refresh is good on U-Verse and Bluray, no apparent delays. Pandora, Netflix, and HBO go apps all load quickly and play without buffering. VUDU loads slowly, but plays without buffering.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture - no complaints
Reviews.Author: R. Krupak
Reviews.Content: I bought this LED tv for my bedroom and I am very pleased with the picture and SMART features. Samsung really seems to have solved the issue of blurring during fast scenes as I noticed no issues at all with watching sports. I am going to purchase another Samsung Smart TV, in a larger size for my living room as I really love the tv.

Reviews.Title: Everything works great
Reviews.Author: donna eilers
Reviews.Content: So far love everything about this tv.The smart features work really well and are fairly hassle free (some issues with logging into Netflix, but it turns out it was their servers fault, not the tv's). Have had it running for about 2 weeks now. I use my tv primarily as a computer monitor, and Samsung does a great job with this. Simply name one of your hdmi ports as computer in the source selection screen and it auto detects your computer, adjust resolution and picture, and sets color and contrast. I ended up changing some of the settings as it was too bright when browsing the internet, but other than that works flawlessly. I will try and update in a couple of months, then again at one year.

Reviews.Title: So Far - Excellent
Reviews.Author: Blew
Reviews.Content: I've only had this 40 inch for a week now (last wk of January '14) and I'm very pleased with it. Great picture, sound, light weight (only 20 lbs), slim and super easy set up. After a couple months I will add to this review to see what I think then.

Reviews.Title: Rather disappointed
Reviews.Author: Laila Karme "lailak"
Reviews.Content: The picture is crisp and nice however the screen flickers which is very annoying. I had the cable tech make the connections and have checked and double checked all the connections, all of which are secure. I have no idea what is the cause of this ongoing flicker which occurs with all the channels.

Reviews.Title: It's Just Great!
Reviews.Author: Bill Cody
Reviews.Content: This is not a technical review as I have no way to judge that, but I can say I rated this a 5 star because I have not come across anything I don't like.This is our first digital TV which replaced a 17 year old still running 36" tube one. It worked great out of the box, easy to setup and found my wifi network immediately. It even did a software update.The picture quality is great with no detectable distortion when viewing from a reasonable angle to the side. The picture adjustments allow all sorts of combinations to suit, and one of the best features is the sound modulation which pretty much eliminates those obnoxiously load commercials everyone hates - no more diving for the remote. The sound level control also allows very fine adjustments.Connections for devices seem to provide everything you'll need if I knew what they were all for. All I have is a Wii and an old DVD player which have the composite and component connections. I'll have to get a blue ray DVD with HDMI connection if I want to connect the Wii and the DVD at the same time as there is only room for one of those with provided connections.Another great plus is the reception we're now getting from our over-the-air antenna (no cable for us). With the old set and a digital to analog converter box we were constantly rotating the roof mount power antenna for best reception, or sometimes any reception at all on some stations depending on weather. We have not had to adjust the antenna at all since connecting this TV.The on screen program guide is much more complete than what the old analog TV gave us - more shows, more channels with more times, just a little slow to load sometimes.The speakers seem OK but I've ordered a surround sound bar and can't wait to watch a movie with it.We've waited a long time to catch up to technology and am glad we waited for this set. Samsung seems to have thought of everything, at least for a come lately tech adoption basics guy.Edit: I forgot to include the remote in my review.It's easy to use with a quality feel and large buttons in the right logical location. It will even act as a limited universal as there is a wired IR extender which will operate another device - for me the DVD player.Edit2: I have downgraded my rating to four stars due to problems hooking up speakers. This TV has digital optical (Toslink) and analog RCA mini jack but does not have digital coax. This reduces your options for speaker connection. Make sure you source your speakers before buying this TV to make sure you can get the best compatible hookup.

Reviews.Title: You Can't Beat Samsung!!
Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying that I bought the Sony 60 inch 3D TV. I did not like it so I took if back to the store. I did a lot of research. I read all these reviews and decided to go with the Samsung 85 Inch. Best decision I made. The TV is great and the Smart Hub works perfectly. Buy one you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Dow Fredrickson
Reviews.Content: I bought this just before Christmas because our Vizio has a row of pixels that aren't working. I wanted/needed a Smart TV this time as the older one wasn't. I have other Samsung products that I am pleased with, so I thought I may as well continue on with the trend. Great choice. The picture is far better that the Vizio had when it was new. The remote is intuitive. And while I've read that the sound isn't the best, for my use it's perfect. The only issue that I had is that I had to get a new wall mount as the one I had wasn't large enough for this TV. My Vizio was a 42" while this unit is 46" and apparently the mounting hole patterns on the TV's change according to the size grids, with 42" being the top size on the mount I had previously. Overall, I couldn't be more pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Truly amazing
Reviews.Author: Stephen J. Neitzke
Reviews.Content: Being your average end user. I am giving you a review on this model as I see it.  I am replacing a Samsung 46 inch LCD that was purchased 6 years ago.  I am really impressed by this TV.  The images blow me away.  Ha, I even find myself watching commercials. I am rediscovering my movie collection in a whole new light.  I am getting so much more from watching a movie I own and have seen before and picking lots of details I'd never seen before.  I am truly happy with this TV and have to say it rocks.  If you just relax and watch the set and not overthink everything you will be amazed.  It's so easy to get wrapped up in all the technology.  The settings are very easy to navigate and didn't take much for me to tweak the screen for the mind blowing experience I see with this.  So glad I made this purchase and glad I got the 60 inch.  Thanks Samsung!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Kiddk25
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace our Toshiba 56" DLP projection TV (which we had for 6 years and still had a great picture). We wanted something slim that we can hang on the wall. This TV is amazing. The picture quality is unbelievable. And the SMART functions are pretty awesome - we can navigate over to Netflix and watch that easy as can be. Numerous apps to check out as well. Also like the screen mirroring feature if we have something on our Ipad we can bring it up on the TV. Very nice TV. Set up was easy, white glove delivery - they worked with our time schedule to make sure they delivered it when we would be home. Overall highly recommend this TV. We have had some difficulty getting the remote to work with our DVR player but hopefully tech support will walk us thru that.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Amanda Bazan
Reviews.Content: I am no electronics expert, so keep that in mind. But I have had the TV for about a month and have no complaints. It is slim, light and easy to set up. The picture quality is very nice, though I played around with the out of the box settings a bit to optimize it for the room that it is in. The stand is a little funky, but I'm planning on mounting it eventually.The "Smart TV" stuff is fairly easy to use. I've seen people complain about the quality of the streaming video, but I really think that has more to do with the in-home internet set-up they have because I've had very few issues other than the occasional delay in downloading while watching a movie. But that happens on all of my devices occasionally (Laptop, iPad, etc.).Overall, I am very pleased. Though the real test for any of these devices seems to be "how is it working a year from now?" So maybe I'll have more to say down the road.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" Smart TV 120Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: D.A.
Reviews.Content: Love it!  This is our first HDTV, and we weren't aware of the "soap opera" effect.  After researching this, we were able to switch it back to "movie" view.  This is all personal preference, and we know the industry is headed in this direction, so we'd best get used to it.  However, for now, we are quite satisfied being able to watch it in a format we are used to!  Great TV!

Reviews.Title: Terrific picture!
Reviews.Author: E. Nadolny
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture and I was excited to go from a 32" model to 40".  However, the "instructions" for operation are not as straightforward as I would like and I'm still trying to figure out how the remote interacts with my other two remotes.  (LOL!)

Reviews.Title: I'm no expert
Reviews.Author: Eugene Tsimerman
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert, and this is my first flat screen television, but I took a long time deciding on what to purchase, did a lot of research, went to many Best Buys and PC Richards and Sons, and eventually pulled the trigger on this model.It's user friendly.  It was easy to connect to netflix, amazon prime, youtube, etc.  I guess the only set back I'm finding is that I wish it had a keyboard for easier searching.  Beyond that, for the price, you won't find a better TV in it's class.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Laura A Mullen
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Excellent picture quality and the SMART apps work great. I highly recommend this TV for someone looking for an upgrade from the baseline TV's sold at most retail outlets.

Reviews.Title: great tv at a wonderful price
Reviews.Author: capt
Reviews.Content: not the easiest to set up, but after that great picture, easy to operate, service is the best in the business.  I must admit I am not an expert at setting up the new style TV's.  Most of the appliances in my home are Samsung because of their quality, dependability, service and warrantee.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality but
Reviews.Author: vinay vasu sangishetty
Reviews.Content: Samsung could have provided a keyboard on back of the remote or some other option. its very painful to browse or search on the internet using this smart tv. otherwise, the picture and sound quality is really good.

Reviews.Title: Sound and Picture Quality needs improvement
Reviews.Author: IFE's dream
Reviews.Content: The reviews mention the problem with adjusting the picture quality.. they are correct. It took several days to get the picture adjusted to the quality I desired.  I didn't like the four modes that come on the TV.The sound quality is horrible...I will have to purchase a sound board to get the quality I desire. A few times I had the TV at 80 so that I could hear a movie playing on Netflix.The apps on the TV are very limited not as much as I would like. Since I turned the TV on a week away, I have yet to determine how to add the apps I want.The Web Browser is ok. Able to play games off the web on TV....the graphic is ok.Set-up was easy.  Adding Devices was very easy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Richard Semilla
Reviews.Content: Awesome Smart TV. Picture is very clear. The internet function in Netflix and Amazon is working properly. The tv is so huge.

Reviews.Title: highly satisfied buy !!
Reviews.Author: deepak
Reviews.Content: Every person I asked recommended me to go for samsung tv...Therefore I searched the best rated samsung tv for budget price...I am glad I bought it...picture quality is very pleasing...colors are vibrant...sound is better than other tv s in competation...design is sleek and atttactive...

Reviews.Title: First smart tv
Reviews.Author: S. Wright
Reviews.Content: This is the first smart tv I purchased and am very satisfied so far.  I don't watch TV...it was for my wife.  From what I've seen, it has very good color and sound, and the HD shows come in very well.  The smart tv feature allows all kinds of programing options if you subscribe (like Netflix).  It also has a plethora of other apps you can use.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and great picture.
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Carlson "Sengekontacket"
Reviews.Content: The installation program was simple, direct and easy.  I only get two to three bars of wifi, but can stream Netflix and other apps without a hitch.  I did have have a problem with Amazon, but I had the same problem at my summer house with another service.i think that is Amazon rather that Samsung.  I tried a wifi booster, but it did not work.  This device actually gives me more than I need.  If you get a good price, it is a fine smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Very nice smart tv interface.
Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: No fluff, just what you need. Doesn't take forever to get to what you need. Picture is great... It's a samsung after all, but the simple, quick, smart interface is the deal clencher

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Diamondguy
Reviews.Content: Best picture I have seen.  Easy to use even for techno idiots like me!!  No freezing picture issues,  Great blacks and whites and incredible color and brightness.  Amazon Prime white glove delivery was fantastic.  Delivered on schedule, brought in to the house, set up and made sure it was working before they left.  Getting ready to by the smaller one for the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Great Service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Darren G. Openshaw
Reviews.Content: We ordered this TV from Amazon a few weeks ago, and are quite pleased.  Out of the box you will need to make sure the latest firmware is downloaded, and also calibrate the settings a bit. (There are other reviews here which detail some nice picture settings, in addition to some Samsung user forums you can find on the web)  Until you update the firmware, the picture doesn't pop, but once you do, it looks great.  We like the 120 hz for sports and fast action scenes.  The speakers aren't great, but we also purchased the vizio 2.1 sound bar with wireless sub, and it fills the room now with surround sound.  The smart features are nice, however I mainly plan on using the Netflix app.  I don't envision updating my twitter status or checking facebook from the tv.  Unless you have a wireless keyboard this process could be tedious.  We caught this 50" on a great "Black Friday" deal for 799.00 and felt great about that price.  Amazon had free shipping, and it arrived in 2 days.  Excellent experience overall.

Reviews.Title: Greatest TV EVER
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Best quality and sound by far. No other tv comes close to comparison. Playing blurays and movies on it gave it a crisp picture while playing netflixs and Hulu on it gave them a clean and clear picture too. Playing my Xbox on it also was the greatest thing, the graphics were phenomenal. My recommendation, BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Nice slim TV with good picture quality
Reviews.Author: VG
Reviews.Content: The tv has great picture quality, alot of hdmi inputs, nice design, and the smart TV features actually work well. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Marco Fontecchio
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Perfect size for my room and the thin frame makes it look that much better. I had some initial set up issues using HDMI 1 but quickly figured it out through forums on using connections through home theater and amp. The short answer is to use HDMI 2, but other than that, the TV is well worth the price.  Coming from a Samsung plasma, I was skeptical about LED showing true black and high motion, but I'm definitely happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've owned
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Kaup
Reviews.Content: Bought this from Amazon on Black Friday for $650.  So far it's the best TV I've ever owned (I'm a 30 yr old male, who's had many different TV's throughout college and grad school and watches a lot of sports).  Setup was easy right out of the box.  I have the TV on a table though, not mounted so I can't speak to how easy/difficult it may be to mount.  The TV instantly recognized my wireless network and walked me through customizing everything.  It has a ton of apps but right now I primarily only use Netflix and Pandora.  Both have been working very well.  One of my favorite aspects is that the Samsung remote fully controls not only the TV but also my Verizon Fios set top box.  No more shuffling between remotes.  Verizon "On Demand" as well the dvr functions can be accessed fully from the Samsung remote.  A small benefit, but one I definitely appreciate.  I'm still working on finding the correct calibration.  I have the TV in a room with a lot of natural sunlight, and most of the calibrations I've seen online have been for dimmer viewing settings.I would definitely recommend this TV.  I've owned good TV's from Sony and LG but Samsung is still the standard in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: B_slo
Reviews.Content: Wifi sucks. Looses connectivity every five minutes or so. Better off hooking up by Ethernet directly to router. But other than TV works great. Also make sure you up date it when you get it or you won't have the apps built in. They only appear in the smart hub after you update the software. Again my only complaint was the wifi

Reviews.Title: Great picture, lots of features
Reviews.Author: Fry daddy
Reviews.Content: I love the picture and sound.  I'm still learning the smart features, the  TV may be smarter than I am.  But it connected perfectly with my home wifi, much better than my old TVs connection through a blue ray player.  Netflix, Youtube, all that stuff works great.  Picture adjustments are easy to make but I turned off the auto adjust, it kept making the picture dim for no apparent reason.  Very nice TV, happy with it watching hockey, which is my ultimate test.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable picture
Reviews.Author: J. Edward Dalton Sr. "Eddie"
Reviews.Content: WOW what a great TV. It was very easy to setup and has a knockout picture. Delivery was a ;little messed up. I received an email to schedule the delivery date and changed the date for 2 days later. Deliver man never received the change date. So I get a call on the original day to setup a time and told him I had changed it to 2 days later. He said no problem he just wasn't notified. 2 days later it was delivered. It has so many features I am still learning about all this set can do. I have it setup with my home theater system and it's just like being in the movie theater.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Smart TV (perfect for movie and gamer fanatics alike)
Reviews.Author: Jason Woronicz
Reviews.Content: This is such a great smart tv, I am extremely happy with my purchase.  The only assembly required is attaching the stand which is done so with 4 screws that are included, and took all of 2 minutes to do.  Unpacking the contents is equally easy to do, and while the instructions say you should use 2 people to take out of the box and setup, I was able to do so by myself.The picture quality has to be seen to be believed.  My wife who loves the classic black and white movies, could not believe how fluid the picture and how clear everything was.  In fact the day I set it up, I was watching a tv commercial, and was just mesmerized by how good the picture quality was.  The picture quality gives a very life like in motion effect to everything which is as I said, has to be seen to be believed just how good it is.  I play a lot of games and watch a lot of sports, and both of those things are equally as impressive as tv and movies.About the apps, wow is all I can say.  They all load right up quickly, and 2 of the more used ones by my wife (Netflix and Amazon) have their own button on the remote.  My wife and I watch a lot of Netflix and Amazon Prime video as well as Hulu Plus, and all of them run flawlessly on this tv.  I want to clarify that the Amazon video is in fact the "REAL" prime video player and not the regular amazon video player so Prime members like myself are obviously very happy with this.The inputs on the back of the tv are well laid out and can be easily accessed.  There are numerous HDMI inputs, and USB inputs as well as a composite video input and and optical audio port.  The audio on the tv is nothing mind blowingly awesome, but it is good.
