Smart hub gives you lots of online content, ability to stream from internet or networked storage, or you can play content off of usb sticks or hard drives (three inputs). Also has a built in converter for Directv, you don't need a converter box (but you still pay for it as one so no free lunch). Will incorporate on screen guide into the home screen which is nice. Not the top end but a very suitable choice for someone wanting to upgrade their tv.

Reviews.Title: Would I recommend this TV!?!?!?
Reviews.Author: toecutter
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture, and wifi features!Yeah I would!!!!!! So go and throw your old Tv out and order one if these bad boys!!!!

Reviews.Title: SMART features are not great
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: It is has a decent display with high quality picture (IMHO), but SMART features is something which is too far from being ready for comfortable use by consumers:1) Smart hub - folder sharing from my computer is extremely unstable... sometimes it works, some times it doesn't. I gave up - using HDMI cable2) Youtube integration is simply NOT even beta quality: it takes endless time to load even the first screen of the application, then navigation through menu items is just not made for using it... if you think you saw SLOW applications, then take a look at this one - it will be even slower than what you can remember. Device pairing is a separate story - if you have 15 minutes transfer video you from your phone to this "smart" TV through endless youtube application crashes on TV, then fine... I gave up after number of attempts involving 2 different phones and two different computers... just forget it.Bottom line: to watch from hard drive - use HDMI cable (back to the pre-smart era), to watch youtube - use computer with hdmi cable...But picture is great!

Reviews.Title: A must have for any man cave!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Bennetsen
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture quality! I compared this 6300 with the 6400 and went with the. 6300 due only to price. The 240 CMR and 120hz are outstanding additions. Amazing blacks and whites and bright natural colors!

Reviews.Title: Nice smart TV
Reviews.Author: Carl W.
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart TV. It is nice to be able to go on the internet and still do picture in picture to listen to a TV program at the same time and I like to play videos on youtube for my son. While many TV's now offer the smart TV feature I wanted to go with Samsung as a brand I trust. The picture quality is good with the 120hz refresh rate. If you are in the market for a new TV I recommend getting a smart TV and if you don't mind paying at the higher end price range I would go with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: great TV for price
Reviews.Author: kiwikids
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price - we originally purchased a Vizio smart TV but the sound was horrible and the internet connection kept timing out.Went with the samsung abd the internet connection works great, smart hub is cool and picture and sound are great

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Peter J. Bamber
Reviews.Content: Sure there are better big TV's out there with more features 3dDetc but for the money and picture quality this TV cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: Love it but wish it had come with the camera.
Reviews.Author: Ryan Carlow
Reviews.Content: Smart Hub is great, TV is great. It can't find my local cable provider for the digital cable guide though... and has no camera which for some reason thought it did. Great other than that.

Reviews.Title: Love it with one exception
Reviews.Author: Oyauma Garrison
Reviews.Content: I'm a Samsung fan.  Great TV, excellent picture.  The only downfall is that it does not come with very detailed or "good enough" instructions on how to link to your home computer to watch home videos.  It took me several tries but I finally did it.

Reviews.Title: Quality and classy smart tv.
Reviews.Author: Surujkumarie Balkissoon
Reviews.Content: Quality exceeded my expectation. Great product for the price. Classy look and lots of compliments. I would highly recommended this TV. I bought it during Black Friday and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: A lot for the money
Reviews.Author: Erick
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up on Cyber Monday for 1/2 off! I have always had a great experience with Samsung products and the Samsung UN60F6300 60-Inch does not disappoint. The review I read before also helped. I'm not an expert but I'm very satisfied with the color,  clarity and quality of the picture.The delivery service included with the unit was very good. Do remind anyone entering your home to be careful not to track in road soil. Overall the "White Glove" set-up service was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN75F6300 75-Inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: A Phillies' Fan "Phillies40"
Reviews.Content: We just exchanged our Sharp 847 70 inches with this Samsung 6300 75 inches TV last night and we got it right before the snow storm!We stay comfortably and warm  watching Netflex all night and we love it so far.  The TV is Huge but lighter than the smaller Sharp 70 TV!  It is bright, the remote took me sometime to get used to.  The apps are easy to find and quick to load.So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Like the TV but not great!!!
Reviews.Author: PANI RAJA KUMAR CHINDUKURU
Reviews.Content: TV clarity is very good and slim too as mentioned in the product description.Sound coming from the TV is very low, looks like need to have additional speakers to enjoy the TV to the full extent.I would expect little tool that helps us to assemble the TV (with the given stand).

Reviews.Title: You must have
Reviews.Author: Louis Walker
Reviews.Content: Great smart tv with awesome colors. Only thing that you can't mount tv close to the wall if you're going to use the IR Infrared Remote on the back of the tv to control your cable box.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Cherie LeBlanc
Reviews.Content: This TV is very good for the price, being a smart TV I am able to downgrade my cable service and use the internet services like Amazon and Netflx to watch movies.

Reviews.Title: Impressed by SmartHub features
Reviews.Author: MEDISIN
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality as you would expect from Samsung.  Very low power consumption.  Plugged it in, connected to LAN via RJ-45 and voila!  Installed updates for the first 5 minutes then connected to Netflix, and Prime accounts.  Video loads very fast and plays flawless.  Found my Plex media server and was streaming 1080p content in no time.  We also purchased a Logitech wireless keyboard (K400) to make searching easier.  Love the DirecTV RVU feature so we don't have to have any boxes attached.  Makes for a very clean install.

Reviews.Title: As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Wayne F.
Reviews.Content: Very good value. Picture and features are very good. I would buy it again. Very easy assembly and set up.

Reviews.Title: Awesome flat screen.
Reviews.Author: Webster
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great. Incredible white balance across the whole screen!  I put on a test screen that turns the whole screen to white and I kid you not, I couldn't see any changes in the shade of white across the whole screen. Amazing if you all me. I've had 3 different flat screen TV's and 5 mid/high end monitors and none of them have come even close to the consistency of this panel. The colors are very good as well. Excellent black levels too. Also a very nice feature is that this TV will play most video files I've thrown at it.  Just put your avi. mkv. or mp4. file on a thumb drive and go into the TV's media browser and play away, it gives you decent control options i.e. fast forward, pass, rewind etc. on the remote. Great TV. Worth the normal retail, so if you can get it on sale it becomes an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: My Thoughts
Reviews.Author: William Walker
Reviews.Content: The TV stand looks it was reclaimed from the garbage dump.Picture is to narrow at times and to wide at times.I would not recommend anyone to buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Not so great PIP
Reviews.Author: Al Feasby
Reviews.Content: PIP feature does not work with AV.  No button on remote. No swap. You must be in HDMI.or component for PIP to be activated though the menu ( push about 6 buttons to get to PIP). Like to keep track of my surveillance cameras on PIP. Not going to work well with this setup. Expected the PIP to work like my old 40" Samsung, but doesn't.  The only reason I bought the smart TV was for the PIP. As always Samsung has a great picture,and that is why I gave it a 4 rating.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV or DUMB TV?
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Samsung 55-inch Smart LED TV.  I really love the picture but they should change the name from smart TV to dumb TV.  It is very slow and sometimes doesn't work at all.  I finally bought a ROKU and stopped using the build in "Smart" features. If I had to do it over again I would buy the same TV without the SMART features, and spend the money on a ROKU.

Reviews.Title: Defective crashing/power cycling TV after 3 months
Reviews.Author: Peter Holdridge
Reviews.Content: Oh Samsung...why did you ship this to stores when it would crash and power cycle after only 3 months out of the box? I even managed to update the firmware and it worked for another 15 minutes before crashing again... I am questioning how the replacement will do if Samsung is willing to ship defective products out like this and train their representatives to say that the crashed happened because I didn't update my firmware? How can you expect me to believe that bull crap? A TV crashes just because you didn't update the firmware? How is that a reason for a TV to decide one day to stop working? Why did this get shipped in the first place? Firmware is supposed to fix bugs, not catastrophic failures.Will my replacement last for 6 months before it too decides to blow up? I only have 1 year of warranty and it appears I am already having to use it. Will I end up with a hunk of junk after 13 months of ownership?

Reviews.Title: Great television...with one major flaw
Reviews.Author: Reviewer 1900 "Reviewer 1900"
Reviews.Content: Great Samsung quality but  Missing VGA connector. Need adapter to setup to PC. Otherwise great television  and super thin too.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Picture
Reviews.Author: christopher kusznir
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the highest quality TV I've ever owned.  The picture is fantastic, and the standard tv speakers produce better sound than a lot of stereo's.  Couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love love love this tv
Reviews.Author: Cincymom "Love my kiddos"
Reviews.Content: TV is perfect for our bedroom. Picture is very clear and speakers are great and loud. Love the smart features

Reviews.Title: Awesome Samsung 55-inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: William Bertsche
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV at a great price! The picture is amazing and the smart features work great! Delivery was quick and the set-up of the television was easy.

Reviews.Title: Its nice and bright!
Reviews.Author: Dingledoink "Dingledoink"
Reviews.Content: Crisp, clear picture. Nice and light too and thus easy to mount. It's a win! I'd say YES to buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: warchildnyc
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th Samsung TV in the last decade...the other 3 are still going strong.  The picture is stunning, even better than the 46-inch LED we have in our other home.  Only drawback is that the sound is weak, but we run the sound through a receiver anyway.  A sound bar would solve the issue for most people.  Also, I saw some complaints in other reviews regarding the applications loading slowly.  I have not experienced any unreasonable delays with Netflix, Hulu or Pandora, but have not used a ton of the applications yet.

Reviews.Title: Really happy
Reviews.Author: YoAdrienne
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this TV. It's I'd big and the picture quality is fantastic. It's clear and crisp. I wall mounted it and it was no trouble. I would purchase this TV again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: AR
Reviews.Content: I have been using it for about a month now and so far so good. The colors true and vivid.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV - bad delivery
Reviews.Author: Kaitlin Fluet
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for about a month now.  It's fantastic - the picture is outstanding.  Smart features are good, however the web-browser app could use a little work.  You really can't use the web browser app to watch streamed TV shows.  Also, there is no red/white out for sound, so if you have an older surround sound system without a digital audio/toslink port, you'll need to purchase a separate adapter.  I purchased the TV from Amazon with the white glove delivery service.  You'll get a delivery window of 3 hours, however be prepared to sit around all day - my delivery was 2 hours late.  If you can get a big box store to match Amazon's price you might be better off.

Reviews.Title: 55in Smart TV
Reviews.Author: P. Granger "Cape Cod Maven"
Reviews.Content: This product came on time, the delivery people couldn't have been nicer asking me where I wanted it etc.  I had it installed on the wall and it hooked up to my receiver and cable box easily.  The picture is crisp and the colors are true.  I have used Amazon.com for movies, checked the internet(won't be using that much) and find the TV very easy to navigate.  There was no manual which surprised me but find I don't really need one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: 101proof
Reviews.Content: You gotta love samsung, I dont think there is a tv in this price range (749.99) that even compares. And trust me I looked at multiple stores and online.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV better than expected, especially with Amazon Prime.
Reviews.Author: John Schroy
Reviews.Content: My 60 inch HDTV arrived on time, delivered and unboxed directly in the right room. Only complaint was that the base almost doesn't fit on the stand also bought from Amazon. Make sure you get a really wide stand for this model. Learned how to work it in about a day, Image fine, without special adjustments. Sound OK, but then I'm partly deaf. Real surprise was the HDTV ... not the motion sensor stuff (not hooked up on this model) but the huge supply of free movies, tv shows, documentaries that come with Amazon Prime. For me, its a whole new way to watch TV. Except for the news, hardly use the old channel bound TV anymore. My wife loves murder mysteries and we can watch Pierot and Marple for months for free, whenever we want to. Amazon Prime is really what makes this set shine. Universal control works fine, even without fancy touch pad or keyboard. Hooked into my Apple WiFi in about 2 minutes. I did have to pay $70 to get two men to set the set up, since it is so big and getting the stand attached in not for the timid. Anyway, five stars.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, a little expensive
Reviews.Author: Trent Baptiste
Reviews.Content: I bought 40" size of this TV from the local Best Buy for a great deal ($699 plus an extra $100 for tax and warranty), and it hasn't yet disappointed. The night I got it, it took about 10 minutes to get set up in the living room, and was able to watch the NBA playoffs in HD within half an hour after updating the TV. I ran a side by side comparison with this TV and a Panasonic plasma 720p TV (quite old, perhaps c. 2003) and the difference was amazing. The Samsung TV was so incredibly vibrant that I had to turn down the brightness a little so as to hopefully not burn out the TV in the long run.I am a gamer, so having a TV that isn't able to keep up with the action wasn't going to cut it. This TV with its 240 CMR is more than capable of capture all the fast paced action. In particular, I hooked up my PS3 to the TV and threw in Black Ops 2. The picture was flawless. And surprisingly, the internal speakers were able to give me a subtle sense of sounds coming from left or right, almost as if it had surround sound built in (foolish I know).The only thing that concerns me is trying to display the screen from my 2011 Macbook Pro onto the TV. I purchased a HDMI to Mini Display Port adapter from Amazon and when I initially plugged in my computer to the TV, the picture on the TV appeared almost like static. I could still read text on the TV and it was still fairly clear, but when I tried to watch Star Trek, the static was too much to overlook. Of course I tried several different resolution settings, but nothing worked. So I tried to use a different HDMI cable, and after 2 more cables, it was finally a perfect picture. Dunno if the problem was the HDMI cable, the TV, or the Macbook, but the problem is solved now. I just don't understand why a different HDMI cable produced a different picture...As for the smart features on the TV, I have yet to stream Netflix or anything like that, but when I tried to watch Family Guy on Hulu, the video just wouldn't buffer. It may be my internet, but I was able to easily stream Hulu on my Macbook...so the processing power is something to investigate.Overall, if you're in the market for a high quality TV with premium picture and above average sound, then this TV is worth the extra money. You'll be spending the next 5 years at least with this kind of product, so throwing a little extra money toward the purchase is worth it. Although a Vizio brand is far cheaper, Samsung's product is first class in my opinion. Definitely spend the extra money so you'll be happy for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Looks great, but that doesn't make up for its other shortcomings
Reviews.Author: CK3
Reviews.Content: Up until last month I have had a 32 inch tube TV and felt it was time to treat myself.  I have used dual Samsung LED monitors on my PC and was happy with their quality, so choosing Samsung based on that and their Smart Hub seemed logical.  So far I am only marginally pleased with my purchase and had to go through some lengthy customer service hoops to get an issue resolved.Pros:- Looks great, no blur, or ghosting, crisp, & bright if you change the settings yourself.  What I expected from a Samsung LED.- Smart hub has a good look and feel, but that is it.- Samsung Customer support was helpful.Cons:- Slooooooow.  The Smart hub is slow.  Streaming apps are so very slow, like trying to navigate in slow motion.  It can take up to a minute to get Netflix, Amazon, or YouTube streaming loaded. (first world problems)- Crashes.  1/3 of the time, after waiting a minute to load Netflix, it will crash, please try again... a few tries.  (I am up to date with the latest firmware and apps.)- Loses network connectivity constantly.  My TV is mounted on the wall with my wireless router in the room behind it, 10 ft away, with just one wall.  I'll try to load Amazon or other Apps (wait a minute, crash, Oh no! network connectivity lost!)  Then you have to click retry 5 or 6 times to re-establish wireless connection.  Everything else in my house is wireless with full bars and no issues like this.- Not much room to plug in Digital Audio cable when wall mounted.- Random green/purple screen when streaming.  Usually when using YouTube, but sometimes Netflix or Amazon, I will start to play a video and the screen immediately goes all green and purple blocking, about 5% of the time.  The affect the TV until it is turned off completely and then back on again.  Annoying, and possibly another lengthy customer service process.- TV Sensor issue.  My TV came with a faulty controller sensor where the TV controller works, but only 40% of the time would the TV read the signals.  Meaning I could turn on the TV with remote, but 5min later I couldn't change channels, I would not be able to use the remote for hours (getting up and using the TV buttons).  Then hours later the sensor would function again.  The sensor was eventually replaced after a few weeks and has worked now for the past few days (a good sign).I contacted Samsung customer support and was mostly pleased with my experience.  My call was answered promptly, the techs were clear, and while we had to run through the troubleshooting scripts a few times, as expected, they escalated my issue until it was resolved.I think Samsung has some work to do making their Smart Hub and applications used with it faster, and they have some quality control issue to work out too.At this point I am not recommending this Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture...Terrible sound!
Reviews.Author: Peggy Osley
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, but the sound quality is terrible.  We have tried making adjustments with the sound, but they all sound bad.  We thought we were getting a good set at a good price, but we now know that we will have to spend quite a bit more to get external speakers or sound bar to get the quality sound we want.

Reviews.Title: Won't support Flash player
Reviews.Author: ec
Reviews.Content: Can't believe no reviews mention Samsung not supporting an update of Flash player. We specifically bought the *smart* tv so we could watch Amazon prime streaming videos & Xfinity On Demand & other online videos that we could previously only watch on our computers. Tv came w/Flash 10. & can't be updated & now when we try to watch ANY videos that require Flash, we can't.Rip Off. Should've spent less on a regular tv & bought a Roku.

Reviews.Title: Don't trust Amazon Warehouse!
Reviews.Author: Zugzwang71
Reviews.Content: Got this set with the item description saying it was in "Pristine" condition, even called Amazon to confirm. When it arrived, it looked like someone had hit the lower right corner bevel off with a hammer!Amazon offered me 20% back or a refund. (as if I should be grateful for a refund with a deceptive item description to begin with.)I've repeatedly said that I don't want a New tv, I only wanted what I paid for, apparently this is beyond them.Furthermore they said Warehouse Deals is a 3rd party reseller, YET they have the name AND logo of Amazon right above it, yet they (Amazon) say they are not responsible!Deceptive all around.This was a birthday present, thanks for nothing. Just send me what I paid for, and everything will be fine.

Reviews.Title: Lag picture with ghosting
Reviews.Author: T. Truesdell
Reviews.Content: The only plus to this TV is it wasn't difficult to return to Best Buy.  The jutter was horrible.  I tried all of the adjustments I could find online and nothing helped - watching sports or Top Gear was like watching an anime movie.  That said, I returned the set and bought a Sony 65" W85 which is fantastic out of the box.  Guess it is worth spending extra.  I'm not anti-Samsung.  I'm typing this on a Samsung laptop, have a Galaxy Tab, and a S4 - all work fantastically.  It's just this TV didn't work for me.

Reviews.Title: All this time I thought I was watching HD tv!!!
Reviews.Author: G2
Reviews.Content: I am still getting used to watching this TV... I had read a lot of good reviews on it, but I really did not expect to get such a Clear image.I owned a 61" Samsung DLP before this and I loved that TV, but the colors were starting to go on me after probably over 9 years of usage. I had jumped on the HD waggon just about when they came out... So needless to say I had paid a high price for it or about 4500...I just cannot believe how much the technology has moved in that period. It is just amazing that at almost 1/3 of the cost I could get such an amazing image!!! This thing is just stunning... We all have to learn how to watch TV again, the image is so clear...It looks like you are right in the action and the people in the movie are right there. It takes some getting used to watching movies espespecially since you kind of loose that movie feel I used to know. It almost looks like you are looking at a live shoot or a good TV documentary. You see every defect and all the details in real life.There is no way you can go back to watch regular television anymore... This thing is just beautiful....

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Batman#49
Reviews.Content: Well the TV is awesome, quality of the picture is great.  My complaint is that the TV requires more internet speed than my provider supplies, so watching Netflix with wifi connection is a disaster.  So I don't get the benefits of the Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre at best
Reviews.Author: Marchello Folino
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after my LG had bit the dust thinking that a Smart TV would be the way to go. Upon searching I was led away from the Vizio and advised that the Samsung quality was unsurpassed. After less than a month I realized that this was not the imaculate product that I was imagining.The smart portion of the TV has some major flaws; It has a feature that turns on the cable box with the TV remote and controls it as well, which doesn't function very well. Multiple times when entering the Smart TV menu and starting a show off of HULU the volume will not work and the only solution is to restart the TV. Lastly, the volume while streaming shows is significantly lower than when operating from the cable box. This results in going from a streaming show exiting to cable and the volume blasting your face off, which you can imagine sucks pretty bad...But, what ever do what you do cause your going to do it anyway...

Reviews.Title: Looks like someone took a hammer to it.
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on time for a scheduled delivery and the installation guys were very nice and quick. BUT when they took it out of the box, I saw something weird on the screen. I wasn't close enough to it to really see because the guys were just pulling it out of the box, but it looked to me like a protective film that comes on tablet screens, you know, when it's a little wrinkled in some places because it was put on in a hurry. Just looked like lines and creases in the film. I figured this TV just has that fim on it. But when they turned it on...I realized the screen was completely busted and wasn't working. Just shattered. Side comment, it was 60 degrees outside, so it couldn't have been change of temperature damage. The screen looked like it got hit with a sharp object a few times. The thing is, the box looked pristine. The TV obviously couldn't have been damaged during transit. Someone clearly put a damaged TV in the box and shipped it to me. Not cool. The guys sent the TV back and I had to call for an exchange. Now waiting on a new TV, different model. I'm not saying I wouldn't buy again, because clearly I did, but just heads up to all, this can and does happen. If you get a damaged model, do not sign that you accept on the delivery document. Don't sign anything until you see that the product is perfect. I gave 2 stars because the delivery was right on the dot.

Reviews.Title: Turining on the TV is a pain.
Reviews.Author: David Hartke
Reviews.Content: I have the UN60F6350A Costco version of this TV but functionally they are the same.  The picture quality on this TV is excellent!  So why the 3 stars?  When you turn on this TV you have to go thru a two step process to get a full screen.  Initially just after you turn the TV on it comes up with a bunch of apps that you can select.  THEN, after waiting a few seconds, in order to get a full screen, one has to hit the "smart hub" button.  Now, you say, big deal, but why must I have to do this every time I turn on the TV?  How about changing the software so you can bypass this step?  I would just like a dumb TV like every other TV on the planet.  The other big gripe is the manual is an E-Manual, consisting of 163 pages with no index.  Yes, you say, just use the find function.  Another big pain.  Then, to make matters worse, this manual applies to every TV Samsung makes so you have to wade thru a bunch of stuff you either don't have or don't care about!  AND, they don't tell you the little secret about having to hit the "smart hub" button to get a full screen.  You just have to discover this "feature".

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smart TV
Reviews.Author: David G. Burns "Amateur "Plantgrower""
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV.  And it is as advertised "smart".  Bought a Blueray DVD player and a samsung speaker bar and they work fine with it.  Very pleased.  I don't love any material object or I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Super quality TV
Reviews.Author: D.Farls
Reviews.Content: Samsung Smart TV's are the best in terms of value, quality and features.  Smart TV allows the TV to connect to a wireless network to stream content from various sources.  I am slowly upgrading all the TVs in the house to be Samsung Smart TVs.  This TV is more like a computer with all the features it offers.

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately it was dead on arrival.
Reviews.Author: J. McGettigan
Reviews.Content: As usual with Amazon, the delivery process was executed flawlessly, but unfortunately the TV was dead on arrival.  The package was delivered in a box that was in perfect condition and the delivery person unpacked the TV without any issues and connected the TV to its stand.  The TV looked great and showed no physical damage, but when it was powered on for the first time it was stunningly apparent that something was really wrong with the internals.  There were narrow, colored vertical lines from top to bottom on the left side of the screen, part of the setup screen could be seen on the right side of the screen but even that was "scratchy" looking and not all there, but the worst part was this sort of crazy white-gray section that looked like a work of abstract art and took up about half the screen in the middle of the screen.  It looked like someone had punched the screen near the bottom, just left of center, and that the damage went out from that point, but not in a linear fashion in the least.  And again, until it was powered on, the TV looked perfect.  Clearly the TV was already damaged prior to being packaged and shipped, and this really doesn't say good things about Samsung's quality control.The bottom line was a disappointed customer, a refused delivery, a cancelled Amazon order, and a restart of the TV search process.  The TV was back ordered so I've decided to move on and will switch to buying a TV locally instead of via Amazon.  The great Amazon price is just not worth the hassle in this purchasing situation.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV, but hate when people get the refresh rate wrong!
Reviews.Author: D.J.
Reviews.Content: I have this TV and all over the net they say this TV has a 120hz refresh rate. However when you call who makes the TV, Samsung you'll learn the truth. Another way you can find out about the refresh rate is reading this review. Ok, so the clear motion rate is about the same as hz when discussing the actual speed of the TV's refresh rate. The clear motion rate for this TV is between 240-480, so it at least has a refresh rate of 240hz. Next, comes the 480, the 480 is the max level your TV can handle. Theirs a little problem though, nothing can even reach that level of clarity. HD Top of the line 3D Blue-ray players don't even come close, their actually limited to what ever movie your watching. This is kind of like how they can make old movies a little clearer by adding dark's or brightening certain colors to make the old movie clear, on a new Blu-ray. Back to the point, the top movies in 3D are operating in full HD 1080p and in some cases slightly higher. What this means to you is that even the clearest newest 3D or 2D Blue-ray movies, on top of the line "Smart" 3D Blue-ray players, can not produce over 140hz, however this TV has the same ability when referring to how they make old movies clearer. It takes the 140hz and improves it to near 240hz. The 480hz is simply their so when they improve video quality, you will still be ready you'll be good to 480hz. That's when the technology catches up though. I would also buy this model over the newer one, its near the same price yet Samsung realized they were over doing it and cut cost and the clear motion rate to 240hz MAX. So you'll still be getting the highest that technology has now but when they start making movies that will actually take advantage of the 480hz the new model will not be able to handle it but this modes will.(UN32ES6500F)Sorry about making this so long i just wanted people to know what they were buying.

Reviews.Title: TV is NOT smart!
Reviews.Author: J. Payne "Jbighitter"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, but the smart TV functionality doesn't work.  I had to attach a ROKU box to get the apps.  I would buy the non-smart TV,  It has the same picture quality (we have one), cost $400 less, and doesn't waste your time.  Samsung has real problems with their smart TV's.  I'm sorry I bought one.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy From Amazon!
Reviews.Author: PhiQuanTu
Reviews.Content: Even local stores has it $300 lower than Amazon. That's 30% lower!!! Although they have this "Lowest Price Guarantee"...THERE'S A CATCH FOR THAT! When asked to price-match to Best Buy or MicroCenter, they simply say they don't match it. End of Story.Amazon is no longer the place to grab stuffs....HDTV are wayyyyy overpriced on this site. If you're looking for a deal, check out deal sites regularly to score one from a local chain store.

Reviews.Title: Faulty Product
Reviews.Author: Praveen
Reviews.Content: I was sold a faulty TV, that too after 2 weeks delay from Max delivery date. There is no step taken to replace my product.

Reviews.Title: Flawed Product- Don't Buy It!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Kahn
Reviews.Content: Do NOT Buy this TV.  I purchased mine this summer, and it stopped working properly within 2 weeks.  It was determined to be a lemon, and I had it replaced with the same model (the store took it back/replaced it).  4 months later, my new TV stopped functioning properly-- same problem!  The TV is flawed!  Samsung customer service is absolutely horrible.  Everyone is in India- no one speaks English.  You are forced into a continuous, ridiculous loop of futile troubleshooting.  They refuse to replace my TV- It's taking 2 weeks to service.  The picture on this TV is sharp- it's lovely to watch --- while it' works-- but, don't spend this kind of money on a product that can/will malfunction at any moment-- and that Samsung won't stand by.  2 $1400 TVs with the same problem in 4 months???? C'mon!  My Sony TV works great & without issue for 4 years.  I will never buy a Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: The is not Smart TV but Slow TV
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: The picture and such is OK.  The real sanfu is the Smart component.  Save yourself $300 and get anything that is not Smart.  You have to enter all the commands via the hunt and peck remote.  There is no way to hook up a keyboard to this.  You may be able to use a keyboard for some things but not You Tube or Net Flex.If you want to determine who has the best TV - call their customer support.  Samsung's customer support is a joke.TV might be OK but the Smart aspect is bad.  You will be stuck with this.  It is not like the other pug ins that will be upgrading.  If Samsung ever up grades it Smart component they will want you to buy a new TV.Smart = Dumb

Reviews.Title: Current Reviews
Reviews.Author: KYUNG JUN LEE
Reviews.Content: Safe delivery and well delivered without bad pixel spots like it.Clear acrylic adhesive border, just a part of the upper panel is excited.The part of the picture, but not quality problems, and the manufacture or sale of SamsungI hope these benefits in mind.The overall state and watch the screen, the picture quality is very satisfied.Generally very satisfied ^ ^

Reviews.Title: The best TV ever!
Reviews.Author: The Buyer
Reviews.Content: This TV was so light weight and easy to install.  It was so smart it did all the work.  The pitcher and color a awesome.  We loved this product so much that we purchased a second one for our bedroom.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: ABAYOMI OLADIMEJI SELESI
Reviews.Content: Perfect start up for new entries into the smart TV world. sleek design, Samsung is still the best out there for smart TV apps, decent speed on the processor. all round a great bang for your buck. Very little redundancies on this TV everything seems to come in handy.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased. No complaints.
Reviews.Author: Lateef H. Logan
Reviews.Content: Chose 4 stars instead of 5, only because the msg that has started floating across the screen regarding Paid Samsung Apps being disbanded the end of March. Other than that, excellent picture quality. Excellent Sound quality (and thats without a sound bar or external speakers. Using this in my bedroom, so it look pretty massive sitting atop my dresser (until i find a proper mount to put it up on the wall.) Programs, apps (Netflix, Amazon instant video, Youtube) are preinstalled and look amazing. If you are considering this set and have any questions, dont hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: bstempka
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic alternative LED TV. Great picture, clarity and the smart tv features are excellent. For the price you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Edna J. Toy
Reviews.Content: Bought this 46" Samsung Smart TV based on a study of reviews found all over the internet.  It was easy to set up and the picture and functions are outstanding.  I did buy a wireless keyboard and mouse to replace the tedious remote typing when using the internet.  Amazon Support was great, very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: typex12
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a 32" Sony for this TV and have loved it since we got it.  Its very easy to set up out of the box and very lightweight.  The only reasons I didn't give 5 stars is because there is a bit of a glare on the screen(which we knew from reading previous reviews) and the fact the stand does not allow any sort of tilt.  Other than that we are thrilled with this product.

Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Content: i love my tv always in bed watching it love everything it got to offer would not trade it love samsung products

Reviews.Title: Perfect tv

Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing! It looks beautiful and the smart interface makes it all I could ever want in a tv

Reviews.Title: good good

Reviews.Content: good good that's very good but long time waiting.. so sad Samsung UN55F6300 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV (2013 Model) but nice!!!

Reviews.Content: I bought a good smart TV at reasonable price.Because Samsung does not sell this model in KoreaI have no choice to buy it in Amazon and pay some cost in transfer & taxSamsung  only sell some luxury model in expensive price in Korea.Any way.Samsung  65' TV is gorgeous and fantasticAlthough this model does not support 3D, it's OK for me  because TV price is really good for this kind of good TV.

Reviews.Title: not bad

Reviews.Content: It was not bad but i'd like to buy 70 inches one next time at more reasonable price. thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Sound Quality OK
Reviews.Author: Jack Gerbs
Reviews.Content: This is what I was looking for.  Overall I am very happy with the TV.  I wish the sound quality was a little better but for the price I'll give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: margo g mize
Reviews.Content: Great picture, clear great sound. I would purchase another tv like this, if I needed a tv. Love the large screen!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 55" thin screen
Reviews.Author: Packwaukee Dave
Reviews.Content: Great picture,easy to set up. Price was reduced a week after , Amazon credited me the difference. I haven't tried to use the streaming video as yet.

Reviews.Title: Not the best TV I've owned, but not a bad one
Reviews.Author: Megzin
Reviews.Content: I've always trusted Samsung to come out with reliable electronics. Top notch.It is very light! One person can take it out of the box and set it up without much trouble.It's my first SmartTV and I've grown to love the Apps.  What's better than catching the latest LCS games on Twitch at 50 inches?I was a tad disappointed with this TV, however.  Not only do we already have a dead pixel in the center of the screen 2 months after purchasing it, but there's no way to add favorite channels to the remote.Otherwise, it works well, looks great in comparison to my other Samsung TVs, and owning an energy efficient TV is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: DLNA madness
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: First of all, I got this TV to replace an existing Samsung 32 inch Smart-TV.  As its predecessor, I connected this to my wireless network.  Streaming over wireless was jittery on large files -- I run Mezzmo DLNA server and serve up MKV files without transcoding.  Normally this works great.  In fact, it worked great on the 32" but not so much on this 46"er.  I don't believe the wireless is all that great, but it did work fine on smaller AVI files.  Anyway, I ran an Ethernet cable to it, and it streamed just fine.  For a while.  After some time, it wouldn't see my DLNA server.  Sometimes it would and it would work fine, but then would drop off as soon as whatever show I was watching ended.  Very odd and sporadic behavior.  I have a lot of things connected in my network, both wirelessly and wired(ly).  After running packet traces, changing NIC drivers on my server, disconnecting Sonos, I said hell with it and disconnected everything but the TV and my server.  Worked like a champ.  Oh good, didn't have to send the TV back.  Then I added devices one by one.  Security cameras.  Sonos.  Nest.  But then I connected my WIFI (Unifi is the BEST), and it stopped working.  SOB.  I checked the Ethernet lines running to the AP's.  All good.  Disconnected the WIFI and TV started working again.  Reconnect, and ugh.  Stopped.  At least I narrowed it down to the AP's or something that was connecting to them.  With Unifi, you have the ability to block devices based on their MAC.  I blocked everything, and turned them on one by one, each time checking the TV to make sure it could see Mezzmo, until I had only one device left blocked. There was one MAC address that I didn't recognize with an odd vendor ID:0C:89:10.  Looked it up and came back as invalid. Then checked [...] and SOB, it belongs to Samsung!  My TV, which was connected via Ethernet was simultaneously connecting via wireless and fraking everything up.  Sorry Samsung, you should lose more than a star for that one, but overall the TV is excellent.

Reviews.Title: First Rate Amazon Service & Excellent Samsung 75" LED TV
Reviews.Author: Bernard
Reviews.Content: Stellar service by Amazon on my order. They price matched a national brick and mortar retailer who had substantially discounted the 75" Samsung on a two-day promotional sale. I was quite impressed by the Amazon customer service rep who assisted me in this regard; she was very helpful and prompt with her follow-up. My order was placed 12/25/13, and the item was delivered to my residence on 12/31/13 per Amazon's Free Enhanced Delivery Service--a welcome perk, especially since the large and heavy TV carton had to be carried down one flight of stairs to our basement home theater room.Hooked it up to new home theater components and enjoyed the outstanding HD picture quality that this large screen brings to all video sources--cable, blu-ray, and Netflix. I'm a "happy camper," as is my wife. We had an old Mitsubishi big screen CRT projection TV previously, and the new Samsung just blows it out of the water.  I haven't yet spent much time experimenting with the picture calibration settings; I just selected the default Movie mode and so far that provides optimum viewing results. I do plan to do more calibration experimenting so as to improve the picture even further.The accompanying Samsung remote control is OK, although I would've preferred a universal or learning remote capability that could operate all my components. It's a bit of a pain to have to use multiple remotes to access the various video sources. That's a sore point with my wife.Smart TV network/video steaming connections seem to work OK. And since placing the new Samsung in service, I've easily updated the firmware twice using the internet. As mentioned above, the TV is located in our basement home theater family room, and the router is upstairs in my home office. I have noted some occasional issues with losing the Netflix connection on the Samsung. That could be due to the distance from the router; plus my router is an old (but reliable) Linksys WRT-54G. So I may have to consider updating my router (as well as my cable modem, which only has DOCSIS 2.0 speeds). It should be noted that I previously used a Roku player with my old TV set in the basement, and I rarely encountered Netflix connection issues (but that was with SD video streaming, not HD).Overall, based on the service rendered by Amazon and our overall satisfaction to date with our new Samsung TV, I have no reservation giving a full 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: saundra davies
Reviews.Content: This is the first smart tv that I have purchased, and at first I found it was smarter than me, but now I have learned how to use the many find features and am amazed what it can do.

Reviews.Title: good item..
Reviews.Author: JUN UK
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory tv screen is too large and clean.Weak part of the sound bar sound purchasingEnjoy great sound quality when connected to tv can be

Reviews.Title: A Mixed Bag.
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I've had this 55 inch F6300 model for two weeks now. I love the picture that the panel can display. Colors are very natural and not too saturated out of the box, and while the brightness is good, it isn't great. I will say though, that I don't think it's necessarily a bad thing it isn't overly bright like my standard LG LCD set I've had for a few years now, because on this Samsung I notice better blacks and shadow detail. Nothing is crushed in terms of color or detail. Viewing angles are okay at best, but stray too far from the center and colors immediately wash out, leaving you to notice backlight seeping through the picture. This set is in my bedroom, so that isn't an issue for me as I'm always front and center with this set. I'm no expert of course, but my eyes have been looking at these screens for years just as much as I've tinkered with them. Maybe I'm wrong on some things--who knows?As for the Smart features, at first when I began the initial setup everything felt like it needed to be broken in, minus the Netflix and Pandora app. YouTube was RIDICULOUSLY slow to load and bring up in general, so I gave up on it. This was all while the television was running on the firmware update version 1118. Though what was odd enough is that a day or two after the update, YouTube and everything else began to run perfectly fine. Perhaps the tv had been doing some background processing at the time I wasn't aware of.Now, for the slight problem I've been experiencing with this tv. While I've come to absolutely love the smart features and everything else it entails, on my set there seems to be something happening with the display I just can't tell if it's normal, or a software glitch that happens on occasion. Randomly during any given time of the day (at least 2 to 6 times a day) the televisions screen will "SHAKE" for a second before returning to normal. It's as if the entire picture stutters for a brief moment. It usually happens anywhere between 1 to 3 hours of usage, but your eyes have to be glued to the tv to notice this 'glitch.' I'm aware of the motion flow technology and this problem has occurred in every setting, be it Off, Clear, Standard, Smooth, or Custom. I'm also aware of the halo effect due to the 120hz technology as well as digital artifacts and such, and these have absolutely nothing to do with my problem. Every picture setting on my set is the same in terms of backlight level, brightness, contrast, etc.I've been to multiple retailers asking technicians if they know of the problem, but they all give me the same blank stare as if it's unheard of. I can't even seem to find any information online about this particular problem, so if anyone knows what may be the issue, if it's hardware or software related, I would greatly appreciate the info. Thank You.I've also upgraded the firmware to version 1120 which was released on January 26, but the same issue still remains and the picture shakes at times.[Edit: 2-16-14]After much debate, I simply decided to return the TV where I purchased it from, which was Best Buy. I decided to try it again so I received another new 55 inch F6300 model, though this time I had Best Buy do a price match with a local store called Micro Center. Micro Center had the same TV for $850, so in the end not only did I receive another brand new F6300, but I took over $250 back from what I originally paid. The TV thus far hasn't given me any problems like the other one had, but time will tell if it holds up I suppose.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Paul Riewald
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Smart TV has outstanding picture quality and easy set-up for remote and wireless connection.  Great for sporting events.  Still learning how to use SMART features.Paul R.Gallatin, TN

Reviews.Title: Totally delivers on picture...leaves you wanting on sound.
Reviews.Author: S. Wilson "Exceptionally tough critic"
Reviews.Content: We were ready to upgrade our main living room TV and after a lot of research, I settled in on the Samsung for its overall picture performance.  It totally delivers on that although it did require a bit of tweaking on the settings out of the box.  Initially, there is an energy saver mode that is switched on and it dramatically reduces the contrast of the picture.  Once that was turned off, the picture was bright and crystal clear.  The difference in quality between this TV and our 3 year old Samsung is night and day so making the purchase was very satisying.I had read several mixed reviews that talked about the sound quality of the set and I've got to concur.  The quality is very mixed.  I fiddled and fiddled for a long time with the settings to try and get it right for TV shows versus sports versus movies and I never felt like I got it completely right.  We did not put the TV on an open wall mount and that might have something to do with the sound quality.  It sits within an entertainment system and I think that degrades the sound.  However, many folks suggested investing in a high quality sound bar and I'm currently researching that as a work around on the sound issues.  Will have to update that later.Long story short, this is a high quality TV and simple to set up right out the box.  All the SmartTV apps have worked flawlessly.  Minus a few demerits for sound quality, I would absolutely recommend this TV as a strong value for the price.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Bree Henderson
Reviews.Content: Great price and love the qauilty of the tv. It looks amazing in my newly remodled living room. yay yay

Reviews.Title: Smart TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Donald S.
Reviews.Content: I am only beginning to appreciate all of the benefits of this TV.  It has all of the initial requirements of a great picture and so much more.  I am connecting it to my DirecTV and Internet to watch what I want when I want.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV
Reviews.Author: buster
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV with a lot of options for picture and sound features. I like this TV for picture quality and smart features via Hub.

Reviews.Title: This TV is Redonkulous
Reviews.Author: DunDix "WindowCleaner"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend it to anyone that is trying to step up their game or watch a game.The only downside is that it does not have 3D which is over-rated anyways

Reviews.Title: Good value, nice picture quality. Blacks are not perfect, but decent.
Reviews.Author: O F
Reviews.Content: I bought the 55-inch. It is good value for money. The screen is relatively matte, which helps reduce glare in bright rooms. The menus and remote are straightforward. The blacks are not the best, but overall, this is good value for moeny.

Reviews.Title: Great Value Best Features
Reviews.Author: Robert G.
Reviews.Content: Samsung is the go to brand for consumer electronics. The quality of the TV and the features all at a price that is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: decent picture quality with good smart features
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: I am not a Samsung fan especially software produced by them whether it is on phone or on tv, but this tv took me for surprise. Smart features are really good and work really well. I stopped using my Roku device after getting this TV.Picture quality is also good after some calibration :)

Reviews.Title: So far only 1 issue
Reviews.Author: C. Marriott
Reviews.Content: I had no idea it made noise when the volume is turned up or down.- Very annoying - but reluctantly getting used to it.Really there is no reason to add noise when adjusting the volume.We own another Samsung (diff model) and the only extra noise (Chimes) it makes is when the tv is turned on/off.Other than that, another great Samsung tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV under $1300
Reviews.Author: KT
Reviews.Content: Grabbed this 60 inch TV for $1200 before christmas. awesome  TV. Only things that could make it a better 1080p TV is a bit better blacks, wider viewing angle, and 3d. The TV looks great. Has nice color and has brightness and contrast levels that can make your eyes hurt when cranked up.Unless your looking for a wide viewing angle TV, I recommend this TV. This replaced a 2008 55 inch 1080p Sony Bravia LCD. The Samsung best it in every way. Bravia is now in bedroom and have compared them. Id love to see the 65 inch. I bet it looks just as good, and these dont seam to look bad sitting close, so most rooms can pull these 60-65 6300 models off in even smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: really great
Reviews.Author: daniel
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine, except connecting samsung app center.Looks slim and clear, but not such a great display, though.Sound not bad..

Reviews.Title: No Complaints!
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Great TV!!! Highly Recommended!!! Samsung is a great brand for the prices, and I will continue to buy products from them!!!

Reviews.Title: My dad LOVES it
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: My dad has a 24x24 entertainment room. He had an old Tube TV and wanted and upgrade. This item went on sale and he asked me to buy it off Amazon for him. I was able to buy the mount on amazon as well. I mounted the TV hung it and also hooked up the Pioneer receiver with no problems. The set up of the TV was great. The smart hub is awesome. I am hooked on samsung tv's.

Reviews.Title: samsung hd tv
Reviews.Author: cleophus leatherwood
Reviews.Content: samsung tv is the only tv brand i like having in the home, the picture is very good and the products seem to be very dependable

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Goverdhan R. Gaini
Reviews.Content: Excellent display. Good audio. Remote control needs to be a little more user-friendly. No way to change the picture size when watching NetFlix or any other internet streaming. No 'CC' when using HDMI connection.

Reviews.Title: nice color easy to set up
Reviews.Author: btf
Reviews.Content: beautiful TV that I ever had! the delivery guy was very profession, not only bright it to my 2FL apartment also set up the TV for me. was very Happy bought it from amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Tonya Whittaker
Reviews.Content: Meets my expectations. All specs and more just as described in the description details.  Happy I bought this tv. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Samsung never disappoints
Reviews.Author: S. C. Shevchik "Shelfly"
Reviews.Content: After much research, and price shopping, I chose this specific model for our bedroom.  I havent really used all of the features yet, such as the internet for checking mail, home alarm cameras, etc.  Typical of Samsung, the picture quality is great. The stand that it sits on is handy if you need to swivel the tv, or want to dust around it.  The timer feature is nice, especially because I have a tendency to fall asleep with the tv on.. so I just set it to go off at midnight every night.  Problem solved.  The price point was the deciding factor for this model.  I bought it during a cyber monday sale.  We have two other Samsung models (same size, but different models, and more $$$) and a high-end Sony.  There is a difference of course between this and the Sony, but there is not a district difference between the 3 Samsungs in reference to picture quality, that I (or 3 others) could see.. so.. you will have to determine what is most important for the price you are willing to pay.  If I wasn't getting such a great price for this, I would've been just as happy with the lesser model probably.  Now, for the best tip..  if you are ordering with Amazon Prime, make sure you have delivery arrangements set in stone when purchasing.  There was a huge snag for me personally.  Guess the delivery man was not happy about delivering a big box by himself! He actually ignored it, and left it at the facility for a couple days.  I kept getting notices that I had to pick it up, which was impossible in my case, because I didn't have a vehicle big enough. Another selling point when I made this purchase was free 2 day delivery and NO tax. Cha-ching!  After much ado, I finally got it taken care of, and it was delivered to my door,  but it did not arrive in a timely manner.  An isolated incident?  Perhaps.. but worth mentioning.  And, sadly, it was never determined who exactly messed the delivery up..Amazon or UPS.  Amazon was VERY nice and accommodating, and in the end, so was UPS.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Jeanine Brudenell
Reviews.Content: Great picture, amazing dimension, terrific apps, and Amazon Prime and Netflix buttons right on the remote!  I did need to buy a soundbar to get better audio quality, but that seems to be a neccessity if you have any new TV in a larger room these days.  I think Samsung is the best out there for TVs.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: Philip
Reviews.Content: The images are crystal clear. I am almost purely streaming stuff from my TV, no cable, and I really enjoy having the smart features.

Reviews.Title: love this
Reviews.Author: Margaret T. Huskins "Margaret"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice size and a wonderful TV. Researched it before buying it and it lives up to our expectations. Easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: it's perfact
Reviews.Author: Park, Sang-Ho
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on Amazon and I normally dont do this, but I feel compelled to write one because most of the reviews on this fabulous TV are missing a key Demographic...GAMERS!!! Skip down to the 2nd paragraph for gaming if you dont want to real this background paragraph. To start off, I purchased the Samsung UN46F6300 46 inch LED TV solely for the purpose of Video gaming, but also for streaming Netflix and Cable TV. With the new XBOX One coming out I knew I had to upgrade from my Dynex 40 Inch LCD TV I purchased before I went away to school in 2009. I did a lot of research and was split on buying an LED TV that was either 120 HZ refresh rate or 240 HZ. After learning that the human eye can barely tell the difference between 120 HZ and 240 HZ I decided to go with 120 HZ because its cheaper and the technology is better developed than 240 HZ. Long story short, I researched brands endlessly looking for that "flawless" TV, and came to the conclusion that my first LED TV is going to be a Samsung. I was then split between the Samsung UN46F6300 (this model) and the Samsung UN46F6400 which is the 3D version with 480 Clear motion rate. After consulting on CNET, my most trusted electronic website, there is no difference between 240 CMR and 480 CMR because they both have an 120 HZ refresh panel. Thus, the decision was made, and Ive been mind blown ever since.

Reviews.Title: Best TV EVER!
Reviews.Author: Dr_Gonzo
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  The picture is fantastic and the Samsung apps are the frosting on the cake.  Also, this TV is actually a 240Hz refresh, not 120 as advertised.  I scored mine for $1197 so watch for the price to drop back down.

Reviews.Title: Super Duper
Reviews.Author: Kringle
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations with this item, and I feel that it delivers flawless on every point. I used chetah mounts, and am very satisfied how it all came together.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: So far happy with purchase and reviews
Reviews.Author: Wendy Hefferan
Reviews.Content: So far works great. Used calibrations from a previous customer for a better picture. The reviews are very helpful. I recommend reading other calibrations for settings.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Jack P. Scharnberg Jr
Reviews.Content: Main issue was getting the hd Cable box to work better with the TV.  Also programming the remote to be cable box remote requires trial and error.  The 2 power buttons can be problematic.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Peter McNally
Reviews.Content: Did my research and this was an awesome purchase.  Hung the TV on the living room wall.  Easy to setup and a great picture.  I had Family over the Holidays and they loved the picture and was inpressed with the SMART TV abilities.  The deliver process goes through a private company and you have to be there for delivery.  The gentlemen that delivered it broke the box down and were very friendly.  They asked if i have any questions and answered the ones i had.  I have had no issues with this tv.  If you are going to hang on the wall, be sure to get the wall mount also.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Picture, User Interface and Controls
Reviews.Author: Victor  Johnson
Reviews.Content: Given that I bought this product to be my office TV, to play media from a USB drive, to use the netflix and other apps, to be my computer monitor and to use the guide to tell me what shows are available on cable, I was disappointed.The picture quality varies drastically from channel to channel and source to source.  Even after calibration, re-configuration by samsung via their remote support and tweaking repeatedly using the menu options,  sometimes the picture was washed out with little color.  Other times there was too much black and sometimes the light colors were washed out. Samsung provides picture modes like Dynamic, Standard, Movie, and Natural for some inputs but only Standard and Entertain are available for a PC input.  In essence right out of the box you'll find yourself having to fiddle with picture settings for every input and sometimes wanting to retweak for different content because there is so much inconsistency.The builtin guide mostly doesnt work if you connect a cable Tv RF cable to the Television.  I was hoping the guide would tell me what channels are coming into the television via the cable. After the auto-program feature finds all of the available channels the guide wont tell you what's on.  It expects a set-top-box.  And maybe it wants to duplicate what the set-to-box would tell you.  This seems odd since the software knows there's a cable plugged in, its knows what frequencies were received, it and  knows your zip code.  One would think, this Smart TV would lookup the frequencies over the internet and populate the guide with the names of the channels and shows, just like a normal cable guide.When using the TV as a computer monitor, unlike my old Vizio, it doesnt turn on when the computer comes on.Commonly used buttons like Aspect, Closed Caption, Color Temp (Cool, Warm, etc) dont appear on the remote.  You need to access the menus.If you're using an app like netflix or the weather app and you turn the TV off, the TV will shift to another input when you turn it back on.There is no picture-by-picture so you cant use it, say as a computer and a tv at the same time with side-by-side windows.The USB input and the USB browser windows have a very primitive design - like the earliest version of Window.  Although you can browse photos on a USB drive, you cant control the speed of the slide show and there is only one transition available.I was unable to play any movie format from a USB drive except mp4.  Mkv and avi files wouldnt play.  When trying to play a movie from a DLNA server, the TV would not allow me to fast forward or rewind the movie.The TV has a nice browser for selecting movies to buy / rent.  The screen shows large thumbnails of movie posters or box covers but this format is not available for your own content.  This was a very disappointing discovery.  Quite often in advertisements you'll see a picture of the screen showing movie thumbnails, but you wont be able to get thumbnails for your movies on your drives (think XBMC).Overall after the hype and dazzle wear off  it seems like the apps and TV functions and user interface were all designed by different groups that didnt share a common set of interfaces or approaches to building software so it all seems a bit of a hodge-podge and in need of homogenization.

Reviews.Title: Very Good!
Reviews.Author: John Selph
Reviews.Content: All is good except for some concern about the sound distribution.  Had to add a sound bar to make the sound as good as I hoped.

Reviews.Title: TV works well
Reviews.Author: James C. MacRae
Reviews.Content: I got the TV in good shape and could set it upcould not get wireless internet to work correctly

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the
Reviews.Author: Hoyonh Jeon
Reviews.Content: Samsung products are also incredibleMany benefits, but is quite easy, especially with smart featuresToo harden stuff looks crisp picture quality andTo be too pleased to buy cheap stuffI highly recommend this product

Reviews.Title: Love the vibrant colors and clear, crisp picture!
Reviews.Author: Pamela Shinn
Reviews.Content: Samsung has done it, again! The color and crispness of the video is awesome. It's like being in the same room.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: moda_way
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely stunned everytime I watch anything on this TV.  We have other, older Samsung TVs in the house and they are either 60hz or 120hz LCD lit panels.  I was so convinced by this 6300 series panel that I switched purchasing recommendations for a family member when they were looking to buy a 60".  They too love their 6300 series 60" Samsung.  Both panels are wall mounted and connections are very easy to make, though component plugs do face the wall.  The wireless works very good, though I moved to a wired connection using a 5 port switch.  All menus are very easy to navigate.  Simply a great TV and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: waited for ever for price reduction and it was worth it
Reviews.Author: Dr. Terrance Nordmann "Wolftwo"
Reviews.Content: Wanted the 65" Samsung with no 3 D. Price drop the Sunday before Thanksgiving. Ordered and it was delivered the day before Thanksgiving. Worked perfect. The self instructions in the TV told me everything I needed. Cable guy checked everything day after Thanksgiving. Now it is new year and it has been perfect. The UN65f6300 is everything that was advertised and has pasted my expeditions. I am the retired former NASA TV Producer and Spacelab and Space station video lead since 1983 and demand the video set up to be perfect, and this set is. Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: No disappointments
Reviews.Author: 1 Man Army
Reviews.Content: i have the Samsung UN55F6350.  Just picked this up in early December to replace a Sony projection LCD television in which the light engine was on its way out..and ok, as a treat to myself.  I believe this tv is in sweet spot of price and features.  Thin, great picture, good sound and Smart TV functionality.  Indeed it is even lightweight - roughly 60lbs so that I was able to easily single handedly wall mount it in under 45 min using a wall mount purchased from Amazon. I am looking for things to poke at, but have no real complaints.  Ok, so it doesnt have a full Qwerty keyboard in the remote for accessing the Smart TV functions. That said, Its a tv not a computer. I really doubt that I'll be doing much, if any indepth web searches from my television.  I have used the SmartTV functions to access alternate content on the set and such things as Pandora, YouTube and Fitness Channels as well as the occaisional web browser search.  No problems.  The set up of the functionality was easy and intuitive.  The set easily found my wireless signal even though the modem is located in our finished basement.  One thing of note however was a slight intermittent picture jutter that i would encounter on some video content initially.  This was ultimately resolved by turning off the Auto Motion feature.  A very good set.  And at a price of $849 (Costco) in early December, a great set.

Reviews.Title: What A Deal
Reviews.Author: V. Roberts "Advocate"
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking for a different TV on Black Friday that was $150 cheaper but they were sold out. I bought this one instead and it is fantastic. It was an easy set up and perfect. I like the slim design and everything that it does. Especially like the pre-programmed apps. The only complaint is that I wish there was a keyboard on the remote. But we just use the one on the screen and we also connected a wireless keyboard and a mouse to it. If I had to do it again, I would buy it again!! It's in my husband's man cave and he is happy!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F6300 46 inch  A great TV!
Reviews.Author: SJM
Reviews.Content: The Samsung TV came packaged beautifully, was shipped early, and is clear, bright, with blacks as they should be.  We're watching the Rose Bowl Parade right now and feel like we're there.  Same with concerts we've seen.  Such a different viewing experience.The Netflix wireless connection for streaming movies is very fun, the Samsung apps are fun to explore (how to do things, exercise, movies etc.)  and it's so different seeing our photos on the large TV screen (46") vs a small laptop.  I was told by a tech person at Crutchfield that these thin TVs just don't have space for good speakers, but there was rarely an issue.  We did get a cord from Crutchfield that allowed us to use our older receiver to connect to the TV and now we can use our regular speakers which all of our neighbors can hear if we're not careful.  I was concerned about the stand which has 4 prongs instead of a flat black stand, but it's steady and I'm getting used to it.  You see the beautiful picture instead of the stand.The price on Amazon was the best and so far we haven't had any difficulties with it.  The remote is easy to understand.  The only complaint I'd have is there's no physical manual, except for a minimal one for set up.  I prefer paper over online or on the TV.  But the TV is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: Meet expectations, but there are a few issues
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV (paid about $650 in 11/13) because I had an old analog TV and I got rid of cable about 3 years ago. I stream everything, so the smart features of this TV were important to me. So far I have used the netflix, amazon and pandora apps and the TV's web browser. I have had some issues with the netflix app. In particular, I have had to re-enter my password 3 times since purchasing this TV. With the included remote entering text is really annoying. The issue has been annoying, but it is not a deal breaker. The TV's web browser is really slow and does not work well with all websites. For example, I could not make a video from cbs full screen (on the bright side, the advertisements in the video did not work either). The slow browser speed could be my wireless internet, but I can stream fine with my computer.I am very cheap, so I am not willing to pay for Huluplus. Of course, the TV cannot access Hulu. So, I just bought a 15' HDMI cable that I run from my TV to my computer. That works great and saves me the cost of Huluplus.To finish everything off, I bought a $10 indoor antenna (check TVfool.com to figure out what channels to expect) so that I can watch sports.As to the video, I am not sure I like the clear motion since it makes all of the video have this sort of "soap opera" effect to the video. I turned the clear motion off and that makes it a little better. So perhaps I am just getting use to the 120Hz display.Overall, I am happy with the TV and my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: aamagerscole
Reviews.Content: This really helps make our family time experience something special every time. It was not difficult to set up and very easy to use. I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: Michael Young
Reviews.Content: We are impressed by the TVs clarity and reaction to ambient lighting.  We have it connected to a Dish Hopper system and remote sound system and can't believe the improvement over our last set.

Reviews.Title: Awesome buy
Reviews.Author: thamitch
Reviews.Content: This TV is hands down awesome!  I'm not going to claim I know a lot about frame rates and what the Hz actually mean, but this is a no regrets purchase.  The smart features are nice to have, I would recommend spending the extra amount to upgrade to a smart TV.  I've had a 3D TV before this one and I wouldn't say it was worth the price.  This TV is so clear it almost seems 3D, not to mention the fact that it's 65 inches which is just absurd anyways.  No one needs a TV that big, but it's really nice to have it.I can't find any problems or reasons not to buy this.  I'm very happy with it, and it was free shipping.

Reviews.Title: 1080P, Not So Smart
Reviews.Author: Mister Moot
Reviews.Content: This television has an amazing picture and features. If your looking to use it as an all in one media center for streaming, then I suggest look elsewhere. The processing power to handle apps is not quick enough to make the experience enjoyable. However as far as just a thin profiled television, it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!
Reviews.Author: Aaron B. Smith "Smithers4486"
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional product and I got it for great price!If you're looking for a high end set then look no further then this 55" from Samsung. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv
Reviews.Author: Willie of Virginia "Golf is my Passion"
Reviews.Content: I had a 40 inch flat screen, the aqueous which I gave to my boys when I purchased this tv as a replacement.  The picture is amazing, it is a smart tv and that I am enjoying .  I recommend this tv it doesn't chop in hi def as it remains smooth in transition and color is remarkable.  Going to 120hz is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Samsungz
Reviews.Author: Sue Magnuson
Reviews.Content: Over the top....love all the streaming capabilities. Picture is so clear and large.  Highly recommend it to everyone.  Sorry I did not get it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable (in the best way)
Reviews.Author: big.al.steward
Reviews.Content: This TV has the clearest picture I have ever seen. It is the slimmest design I have ever seen. I have no idea where all the booming sound comes from, with it being so slim. I have had this awesome machine for over a month now, & by playing with it every chance I get, I learn of some new kick ass feature it has that continues to blow my mind.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN65F6300 65-Inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: limhyoil
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN65F6300 65-Inch 1080p 120Hz Slim Smart LED HDTVCheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch...Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch...

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart Tv
Reviews.Author: Wayne W. Litchfield
Reviews.Content: This is the tv If you want a nice size the bedroom or smaller room. The 120hz refresh rate adds to the viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic buy for the price
Reviews.Author: Brett hodges
Reviews.Content: I have had my TV for about a month now and I am really happy I got it when I did. The picture is great the gaming seamless and the apps directly through the TV was something I thought was overrated until I was able to do it myself. I would however reccommend aftermarket speakers be it a soundbar or surround sound system etc. That being said the stock speakers arent terrible but are what you would expect.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV for a fair price
Reviews.Author: Dennis D Brown
Reviews.Content: A very feature rich TV with an extraordinarily good picture.  Easy to set up, the remote is very handy.  My only complaint is that it is not compatible with my old headset, I like to pop on the headset when the wife heads to bed.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our new Samsung UN55F6300 55-inch Smart TV!
Reviews.Author: Lars North
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived quickly and set up easily. The picture is very clear and bright, especially compared to our old CRT TV. It connected to our WiFi internet service smoothly and works very well. At first I was having difficulty getting Netflix to work, but I may have not given the TV time to "boot-up" entirely. Netflix began working nicely shortly thereafter, and we've been enjoying it immensely.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F6300 Smart TV
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected, stunning picture [ be sure & put the picture in dynamic mode in tools ] Don't really know anything about the Smart functions yet but I'll learn in time.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gene Todhunter
Reviews.Content: great tv but wish the speakers were better.  will need to buy a sound bar.  great picture and features, easy to set up

Reviews.Title: I like it much
Reviews.Author: kannappan gunalan
Reviews.Content: I love the TV much It meets the expectation nice.I have used this TV almost a month now the speed and resolution is good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Brittany Carroll
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful TV! The size is great. We really like the ability to stream netflix, youtube and VUDU on here. It is also very nice being able to use 1 remote rather than multiple like we did on our previous tv. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Nice screen
Reviews.Author: Iam_Jammal
Reviews.Content: well the looks good and has got a cool display. have got in in my living room an it looks awesom. was expecting the screen with 3D glasses in it but found none.

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: James Pooley
Reviews.Content: Tv works great. I bought a Samsung smart tv so that I could connect my galaxy s3 to it and share screens, which also works great. Definitely recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great tv.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv. Exceeded expectations. Have absolutely zero criticisms. Ability to adjust settings is fantastic. Will purchase another next Black Friday for our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy operation.
Reviews.Author: Adam J. Titone "SciFi junky"
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the picture quality. It is taking me a bit of time to get use to the clarity and sharpness of the picture, but this is an easy matter.

Reviews.Title: Terrific
Reviews.Author: Sherleen Oliver
Reviews.Content: Received the TV in a timely manner and it more than met our expectations.  I bought it for our sons and had it sent to their home.  They couldn't believe the picture.  They said it was easy to hook up and they watched the surfing championships on it and it was just like being right there.  I also bought a mount and they said it looked great hanging on the wall.
