Reviews.Author: Yoon Jinyong
Reviews.Content: it was the first time in a long time that i bought samsung tv at ameria not korea. i think it is excellent tv i've never saw.but... i really want to samsung display... but.. my tv has....... sharp display.... it is aweful....if i get smasung display... i will very happy..

Reviews.Title: Greate size!!!
Reviews.Author: SeungChun Baek
Reviews.Content: I used 24" LCD monitor for PC. no TV.65" LED size is make me crazy. :)Anyway, I'll be use PC monitor, watch movie, drama, play game. :)

Reviews.Title: get one
Reviews.Author: robert james hagadorn
Reviews.Content: shipping was good no damage to tv just wish i had enough money for 85 inch 4k ultra high def tv instead

Reviews.Title: Great TV and can not beat the white glove delivery!
Reviews.Author: DALE S
Reviews.Content: Samsung quality says it all. Easy to compare and great prices. Sometimes you have to wait for a special and jump on it!

Reviews.Title: awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Chuck Groseth
Reviews.Content: great sound, very light and it's the reason why Samsung leads in the LED cataglory.  I've connected to WiFi and the applications are superb

Reviews.Title: quit working after 4 months
Reviews.Author: Joyce I. Landry "JIL4346"
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to work with Samsung customer service for a over a week and still no results. I guess I'm stuck with a broken TV.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is far below expectations
Reviews.Author: John Jancsek
Reviews.Content: Lines are not crisp. Images appears unrealistic. colors are not vivid. Perhaps the unit was dropped in shipment. Tested with multiple inputs

Reviews.Title: Don't buy in Washington State!
Reviews.Author: Paul Huguenin
Reviews.Content: Well, the TV is all it is advertised to be, but DO NOT buy it if you live in Western Washington State.  The automatic service provider feature cannot locate a cable provider for any of the cities zip codes in the Puget Sound region.  Samsung's official response:Scarlett A: I am afraid; Presently there is no selection for it. However In the future updates it may be added.Scarlett A: Is there anything else that I can assist you with?Awesome.  Not.  All of my channels set up just fine, but the Channel Guide is using some odd numeric sequence, and every channel line shows "No Information."  Anyone care to guess if I can find ESPN HD before the Seahawks play again.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: khatereh motamed
Reviews.Content: I got a 50"one which was damaged and had to return it and then got a 55" one which is great and I love it!

Reviews.Title: This TV is very specific, and not very smart.
Reviews.Author: tom
Reviews.Content: I bought this model TV thinking that it would hedge my obsolescence with future purchases. We all know how fast thing change in this industry. I guess I was outsmarted by a not so smart sales gimmick.Pros: nice pictureCons:When I do use the TV with the Wi-Fi connection, I can’t put my computer it in sleep mode, it keeps waking my computer back up.The sound doesn’t always match the video. The picture and sound skip a lot. On my other TV I never had this Issue.This TV is not easy to setup in the beginning or to make changes. You have to know a lot of jargon to understand things like screen size and what the difference means. And if you want to change something while watching a show you wind up missing things because it is so cumbersome.I use the TV as a monitor to my computer and when I change back and forth from one to the other it, again, requires many remote key steps. How about just one?Let’s talk about the remote, what a piece of junk! It is poorly designed. You can’t tell by just picking it up if you have it in the right direction, you have to look at it and be awake too. It is difficult to pick up, say from a table with the keys facing down, then you have to look at it before you can use it to make sure the direction is correct, and lord forbid if you get it wrong and you press the wrong button. It transports you to some wonderland and takes you hours to recover from with an act of congress to get changed, and we know congress gets nothing done these days. So you screwed. Really! I should not have to go and buy a separate remote that’s even somewhat intelligently designed, and user friendly. If you want I’ll come by your plant and show you how to do it. That engineer should be fired.The response of the commands from the remote to the TV are sluggish at best. And forget about back to back key strokes. It seems you have to wait for one function to complete before you can key in another. E.g. change channel, then mute. Ain’t happinin’!!PIP (Picture in picture) does not work for 95% of the functions, I feel it should. If you are considering buying this TV for this purpose --- don’t. And to get to-it using the remote is, again, arduous. I even chatted with the sales guy at Samsung about this and there were not offers of caveats about its use.The noise, HUMM, coming from the back is enormous when this thing is just turned on. If you like quiet, again this is not for you. You cannot control the volume of an extension speaker from this TV set. You have to have another remote for that. In other words, with all the buttons you have to deal with you have to have another remote to control other pieces of equipment that are connected to this TV. I say this because my other TV did not require this. I could control everything from the one TV remote. It wasn’t even smart!!! Again fire the engineer.

Reviews.Title: Dumb TV
Reviews.Author: Col Mustard
Reviews.Content: It did not start well the day I bought it the server was down so no apps worked,  but when I called customer support they knew nothing of the problem, it was 2 days later I found out it was a problem with the server and 6 days later that it actually started working.  There was no notification on the web site or anywhere else even the customer service team where not aware of the server issues and its not the first time its happened I found out while looking for help. Real poor service from such a massive company.As for the TV the picture is ok the sound is average or below, it only has optical audio out so older surround sounds need a converter. The other thing that really makes this a dumb TV is it will not play MP4 or any of the other popular video formats I have tried so far. Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Do not waste our money
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Caccese
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this product.  After 7 days the TV does not work at all.  Samsung warranty prohibits the return of the TV to the seller.  It requires the owner to drive up to 60 miles one way to have the TV repaired.  They will not have in home repairs.  In the competitive world for high end TVs, it is amazing that Samsung builds a TV that last 7 days and then will only repair it by driving it to a TV repair shop.  Samsung treats its customers like it is the 1950s where TV repairs only occurs at a repair shop.  Worse, it builds a TV that last only 7 days. I have bought Sony TVS for many years, This is my first and last Samsung

Reviews.Title: poor support and wrong parts..samsung smart tv
Reviews.Author: K. Urso "katsanc"
Reviews.Content: I suppose the warehouse was timely but they are selling me a product I am unhappy with. Samsung put in wrong screws, then told me it would be up to two weeks to deliver right screws. Should have over nighted them. I waited. Wrong screws, and an odd assortment of them. Ir extender still doesn't work. No after hours help, so I used chat. She gave me wrong info because of limited English ability. She interpreted 'at least 2 inches' as closer than 2 inches. I corrected her. Then she resorted to sending written directions in sentences that made no sense. If customers are consuming in a different language than the seller, the seller needs to hire native speakers to edit....that would apply to us as well.

Reviews.Title: I thought I would love this...
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Girl
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung TV a few years ago and it is wonderful, so when I needed a new TV for my living room, I purchased this one.  The odd thing about it, which I don't like at all, is that even though it's not 3D, some of the movies look like they are.  It's really strange.  It might just be that it's too high def for my taste.  Also, some of the movies I have watched look strange, almost like they were filmed on cheap video. For instance, I watched Breakfast at Tiffany's on Netflix using the Samsung app.  The picture looked really odd and the motion looked lower.  I don't know if this is due to the conversion from film to HD, or if there is even such a technique, but I do know that I did not like the visual at all, and I have been watching my older TV much more than this new one because I like the quality so much better.

Reviews.Title: Samsungs servers must be working to stream anything
Reviews.Author: Negronaut "Waging war on mongoloids."
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 5 months now and it's worked great.  I had to tune the picture a bit so everything wasn't overly bright, but after that it looked great.  However this past week I have been unable to use any of the Smart Hub apps (Netflix, Amazon Prime streaming etc.) on the TV because Samsungs smart hub servers are down.  Apparently all the apps for their smart hub products send information to Samsung when you use them, and if the Samsung servers are down then the app doesn't work at all.  I have no idea why anyone would program them like this, the Netflix and Amazon servers are just fine.  And since we don't have cable TV we can only watch Blu Ray movies now until their servers come back up.  After discovering this, I'm going to stay away from all Smart Hub products and probably Samsung products in general.

Reviews.Title: Universal remote sucks
Reviews.Author: Stuart Lipkin
Reviews.Content: The tv works fine and has a quality picture. However, I'm not able to use the universal remote other than on the tv. I went through the set-up procedures and it told me that it recognized my Comcast cable box. It even listed the model # during the set-up process which indicated to me it should be compatible with the tv. After numerous tries to use the universal remote to change channels on the cable box, I finally called Samsung tech support.  They told me that even though the model # was listed during the set-up, it doesn't mean that the remote is compatible with the cable box (makes no sense to me why they would list a cable box model that is not compatible.) I went and got a new cable box, hooked it up and still had the same problems.  Once again, the model # of the cable box was listed on the TV set-up screen.  I called Samsung again and all they could tell me was the new cable box was also not compatible. I asked for a list of cable boxes that are compatible and they told me they don't have one. They can only tell me what won't work. Totally frustrating and difficult to believe that Samsung could't figure a way to include the most popular cable boxes from Comcast to be compatible with their universal remote.

Reviews.Title: Drops Internet Connection Constantly
Reviews.Author: Shannon L Guy
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good, but continually drops the internet connection. I only bought this TV because I wanted the integrated smart features. No other devices in my home have trouble maintaining a connection. You have to have the router within 20 feet of the TV "with no obstacles in between" to use the wireless connection in your house, which is not possible in my house. In the last 30 days, Samsung's smarthub has been down as well. Would not purchase this TV again.

Reviews.Title: Samsung So Far Unable to Advise Me  How To Use The SMART TV!
Reviews.Author: Robert Bass
Reviews.Content: The TV is OK as far as picture and picture quality,however one of the reasons for buying the unit to start with was, the so called ability to connect to the Internet. I do a lot of Genealogy Research and wanted to be able to read old Wills and Land Deeds from the projected picture from the Internet, on the TV Screen. I have made more than 9 calls to Samsung for Technical Assistance,and all Technicians have been very kind however no one has been able to guide me through the process.My inter-net service provider has been out and checked all lines and signal strength everything is a OK.However they are going to provide me with a NEW Wireless Modem just to be sure the Technology of the Modem is as advanced as the Technology in the Smart TV.  I will then attempt to call Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Stop buy trash product
Reviews.Author: alexander
Reviews.Content: STOP do not buy samsung product if you have warranty they just give you the one-time use services are terrible and are not responsible if the technician damages your tv bad products with the time. white spot on the screen  dont buy Samsun TV I hope it has helped you make a desicion on this waste product if they want photos of the two tv that eh had will gladly sent them do not spend your money in trash

Reviews.Title: picture quality
Reviews.Author: michael brezinski
Reviews.Content: cannot seem to get picture tone and sharpness dialed in , despite numerous attempts, picture on certain programs seems hazy, and not high definition

Reviews.Title: Of couse it's on sale now !!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Jahn
Reviews.Content: I would have given it a 5 star but I just bought it a week ago and now it's on sale for 300 dollars less. Great TV with a outstanding picture and sound. Very easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: missing screws. replacement screws lost in mail?? Never given a tracking #.
Reviews.Author: rene white
Reviews.Content: Over 2 weeks passed b4 I recieved correct screws. (no tracking # for screws??) had to go to hardware store on broken ankle.NFL playoffs missed because of this. I was told to try local hardware store where no screws matched.Out of options, I tried the closest fitting screws and cracked the stand. an employee suggestion, by the way. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: Poor Service
Reviews.Author: NICK BRUSH
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 55 inch Samsung 6300 TV from Costco in late November. The screws used to attach the TV to the stand were missing. I called Samsung, and was forced to pull the TV out of the box to obtain the TV serial number and required to email my receipt to Samsung in order to obtain 8 screws. They refused to overnight screws. It will take 5 to 10 business days to receive. I had been a loyal Samsung customer. I will not make another Samsung purchase.

Reviews.Title: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BCGRVX0/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0. A very disappointed and dissatisfied customer.
Reviews.Author: E.C.Clyde Parris
Reviews.Content: I have in my possession a 55 inch Samsung Smart TV - price $1,097.00 -which arrived with a broken screen. I am unable to use it and cannot rate performance.  Both Beach Camera and Amazon declined any liability because the freight forwarder accepted the package which they observed had an indentation and only when I opened the package did I observe the damaged screen on the TV in the same area as the indentation on the box packaging. ......................some Christmas present but still considering my options......Buyer Beware

Reviews.Title: great picture and design while it works
Reviews.Author: James A. Sharkey IV "jsharkiv"
Reviews.Content: This seems a common problem with Samsung tvs. They use faulty capacitors and have even accepted a class action lawsuit. They said my model while having the same capacitors identified in the lawsuit was not determined by OUR engineers to warrant coverage under the class action lawsuit and they could not help me. Otherwise a great tv picture and design - I guess I was just one the unlucky ones in their calculations for an acceptable failure/dissatisfaction rate.

Reviews.Title: Woefully disappointed in Amazon Warehouse Deals Sales tactics...
Reviews.Author: G. Ryan "Gmy"
Reviews.Content: As I'm still a relative newbie with Samsung tvs...having just purchased a Samsung 46 led a couple of months ago...Let me say they make a gorgeous tv screen... night and day difference between a 46 Sony Brava that failed on me and prompted the need for replacement. But this review isn't about the TV but about Amazon Warehouse Deals...as I sought to add another Samsung tv as I was so impressed... So I bought a used 50 in LED SMART TV...for what I thought was a good price and I've bought from Warehouse in the past with hit or miss results. But this is insane!!! The descriptions says "Front of housing has minor cosmetic imperfection". WAS some BULL...a large imperfection of the LED panel being displaced and multiple deep scratches to add to the small imperfection mentioned. Whoever is in charge of inspecting returns and writing used item fault descriptions...need their eyes examined for real!!!! Or even just open the box first before offering for a "fabulous" deal. I understand the risks of buying used products...but damn...be accurate with what is wrong with it!! And this was not the first or second time this has happened with Amazon Warehouse Deals.  Needless to say, the tv was accepted for return and larger point is BUYER BEWARE with AMAZON WAREHOUSE "so called" Deals as the waste of time waiting for a busted up tv... was no deal!!! Buying brand new next time....

Reviews.Title: Smart Features Don't Work! Internet connectivity POOR!
Reviews.Author: Winterfell1
Reviews.Content: I selected 5 Stars simply so this would show up near the top of the reviews.  I would really give this TV a 1 or 2 star rating.  The TV picture is pretty good. However, Everything about the smart TV functions and internet connectivity is TERRIBLE! Do yourself a favor and make sure you read the 1 and 2 star reviews.  These problems may not affect everyone, but obviously this is a pretty big problem.  My TV required a firmware update.  Since no connectivity, Samsung has to send a thumb drive with the software from Korea. Only 21 days to go and the TV may work!!  Wow. This is pretty bad.  Customer service was terrible.  Plus, before the connectivity completely died, the TV could not stay connected for more than a few minutes.  BEWARE.  Read the lower rated reviews.  Those people were not kidding.  I actually looked at the overall good ratings before I bought the TV and figured that the people that downrated this TV were just not very technically competent. I really messed up.  Please don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: cant seem to get this thing to work correctly
Reviews.Author: hansu chu
Reviews.Content: im having issues with this tv. i have it connected to a direct tv genie box.. not the main box but my bedroom box and i cant seem to get the tv to have good picture quality and also no matter what it reimages the picture of the tv so the top and bottom of the screen are black.. anyone else have this problem???

Reviews.Title: Programming
Reviews.Author: Gh
Reviews.Content: The tv comes with preloaded programs that do not work, and can not be re-set. It appears to be directed to indian people, since the programs link you to indian soaps and channels.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. Scaia
Reviews.Content: Thought I would venture away from plasma and try LED....Picture quality does not compare to Plasma technology....however, it is a pretty decent product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED TV
Reviews.Author: Keno72
Reviews.Content: I have not installed the TV as yet since it is a Christmas present for my wife.  It will go on a wall on our sun porch.

Reviews.Title: Very Mad
Reviews.Author: Chuck Soukup
Reviews.Content: I mounted it and hooked it up to only find out that this TV didn't even work.  I contacted Samsung Tech Support and they ran me through a few tests and it still didn't work.  I returned the TV back amazon and found out I had to pay for the shipping and insurance to send back.  What a Joke!  I am very disappointed with Amazon and Samsung with this purchase.  $38 to ship back and insure.  I bought a better Vizio from Walmart.com and picked it up in town.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!!
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: The only thing on this TV that is any good is the picture.  Having said that, the picture isn't good at the same time,  the picture get chopped by about 1/8th of  an inch all the way around the screen,  which means anything important in that area never gets shown.  also my TV arrived with the stand broken while the box it was shipped in was completely undamaged.  you are also unable to delete 90% of the apps that are preloaded on the system. If you are thinking about getting this TV think again.Picture 7 of 10 would be 10 of 10 if it didnt chop 1/8th of an inch from all sidesAudio 4 of 10  not as bad as most for sound quality but you have to crank up the volume to hear it (like most tv's today get a soundbar)Remote 1 of 10  scored a one simply because it can be backlitmenu system 4 of 10 cumbersome and slow,  but does provide lots of customization of its options

Reviews.Title: Defective TV Panels in SAMSUNG TV's.,
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as other models.  This defect occurs on start-up and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture progressively declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00The repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel"......all told, another $1,000.00SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at 20% per year.

Reviews.Title: Samsung has dropped the ball
Reviews.Author: Jaron
Reviews.Content: TV is excellent except for one fatal flaw, no Flash Player on web browser.....defeats the purpose of having a SmartTV

Reviews.Title: Amazon sent bad tv
Reviews.Author: Paul Collister Jr.
Reviews.Content: Because u sent me a bad tv.. If I'm paying the money for a nice tv, I expect everything to be working properly.. thanks...

Reviews.Title: Will NOT Stream Netflix
Reviews.Author: LAX2012
Reviews.Content: A few days after the return-period was over, the TV quit streaming Netflix and Amazon.  Having a home entertainment system for movies was the primary purpose of this purchase. Now that I am looking, there are lots of reviews complaining about this issues - wish I had read more of the negative reviews.  FYI - if you are a network/cable person the picture is great - you'll just head to the theater for your movies.

Reviews.Title: Received Damaged TV! Warning! Return cost is on you! Totally Screwed
Reviews.Author: Guan Lian
Reviews.Content: The package I received is the most basic packaging with no warning signs like "Fragile" or "This end up"...This came all the way from New Hampshire to California on ground. The TV screen is completely cracked with obvious evidence that it has been damaged good. Now I look at their return policy and I cannot believe my eyes that this is a exchange only return and the shipping cost is on you! And they say you have to ship this back 14 days after RMA number is issued which has 2 days left! Understand what is going on here? I am not saying this is complete fraud but I am super pissed right now. I will fight to my last breathe over this!

Reviews.Title: no amazon instant video app
Reviews.Author: aky
Reviews.Content: no issues with the tv itself. just that that the amazon instant video app is not supported by the smart hub. For some reason i just assumed that the amazon app would be avail to download like netflix/youtube etc... But it's nowhere to be found. After doing some searching online, it's not supported by Samsungs Smart Hub. Booooooooooo.

Reviews.Title: Samsung, please make a dedicated game mode!
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: Played with the TV for 10 minutes at Bestbuy and decided to give up - with much regret.  The picture quality and panel uniformity is great for its price, but I cannot stand how difficult it is to enable game mode.  I alternate between gaming and watching videos/movies a lot.To enable game mode, you have to push menu - settings - general - game mode - on - exit.  You have to push buttons about 10 or 12 times to enable game mode.  And when game mode is enabled the picture looks washed out and loses color/contrast accuracy.And when game mode is enabled, the settings (brightness, backlight, contrast, etc) is based on movie mode.  For a lot of people, they use movie mode with warm temperature, low brightness, and low color, and use game mode with medium temperature, mid or high brightness, and slightly higher color.  So every time you enable game mode you have to change these settings as well.I could watch videos with Natural or Vivid presets, the problem is that auto dimming is forced on these presets.  Auto dimming kicks in when the picture is mostly dark.  It dramatically lowers brightness and backlight.  It is very annoying and you cannot turn it off.Samsung has just ruined a great TV by not including a dedicated game mode.  Until Samsung has a dedicated game mode like LG or Sharp, I will not buy a Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: A VAST DISAPPOINTMENT
Reviews.Author: Karen Howe McDonough
Reviews.Content: It doesn't seem to be able to keep ANY CONSISTENT  level of brightness.Also your shipper left it on our lawn-WAS THAT YOUR INSTRUCTION?

Reviews.Title: Box was badly damaged
Reviews.Author: Baldwin Velasco
Reviews.Content: The tv was delivered with the box badly damaged already. I did not bother to check the tv as the box alone was in bad shape. To be fair to amazon, i was able to return and had the item refunded with no problem as the they did not have any stock of this model at that time

Reviews.Title: screw problem
Reviews.Author: Sathish kumar Jaganathan
Reviews.Content: Happy that v received the package b4 time. package was fine... but the gr8 problem came in wen the screws required for assembling the tv were not thr rite size... feeling weird called the samsung guys nd was shocked to knw that the screws will arrive only after 15 working days... pathetic... v got the screws only aftr a month until den v couldnt use the tv... overall bad experience... no complaints wid tv, picture etc etc... loved the tv but samsung response was vry vry bad.....

Reviews.Title: Terrible service. No manual no instruction-- go figure
Reviews.Author: ismai m talaat
Reviews.Content: I have received this TV Today. I have seen a similar one somewhere before and I liked. But low and behold when I received this set today, I got no instruction for how to put it together with the stand. Yet, the biggest problem of all the fact that there is NO manual what so ever. How does Samsung expect any body to run the product without manual? The product might be good but the service from Both Samsung and Amazon are terrible. Hence, just 2 stars .

Reviews.Title: POOR SHIPPING
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Tv is great. Don't count on the shipping its third party and does not come as soon as expected. ll

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy Samsung
Reviews.Author: christi
Reviews.Content: I have a 56" and it was great the first 2 years.  Recently the TV started developing the notorious "white dot" issue that many other Samsung TVs have. There are hundreds of white dots on the screen.  A defective chip made by TI was installed and Samsung will not fix despite the huge number of complaints. Cost of repair is $500-600. Customer service is of no help and refuses to take responsibility.  There was already a class action lawsuit against Samsung for defective TVs last year.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Disappointed - Screen Ghosting
Reviews.Author: Rick in Dallas
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 Samsung LCD TVs a number of years ago from Amazon.  In the past 6 months, 2 of these have experienced ghosting and lines across the screen, rendering the TVs virtually unusable.Samsung's customer service (even escalating to Executive Customer Server) was no help at all, hiding behind the "Out-of-Warranty" claim.Repairs would cost more than it would be to replace the TVs with non-Samsung products.[...]

Reviews.Title: Frustrating
Reviews.Author: W
Reviews.Content: Received as a gift - Setup was so frustrating I boxed it  back up and it now sits in my storage unit collecting dust. Maybe someday when have the patients to deal with....

Reviews.Title: Ok till it stops working
Reviews.Author: Jauron Hunter
Reviews.Content: Tv was great till it stop turning on. As I write this review I'm getting it fixed thank goodness for the warranty I'd just go with buying a brand new tv don't take the cheap way out its to great of a tv to.

Reviews.Title: cheap company
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: I bought a $1000.00 46" led smart TV.  The 12 screws were missing to put the stand together.  I did live chat and after 30 minutes they still wanted a copy of my sales slip and other info----Come on for 12 screws.  I packed it up and am taking it back.  I do not want to deal with a company that is that cheap!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Too Expensive if all you want is a HD TV
Reviews.Author: John F. Yee
Reviews.Content: Wanted a simple TV, but this one has too many features that I won't sue, but had to pay for!

Reviews.Title: The set is not working yet; not conecting to antena??
Reviews.Author: mark donowitz
Reviews.Content: will call for help this weekend.  I have tried to set it up and will need more help; seems llike all connected correctly but not able to get picture. hope you guys are good at helping or i wasted a lot of monely

Reviews.Title: Is what it is
Reviews.Author: J. Cleveland
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why people are so easily taken in by the overrated picture of this manufacturers TV. Just proof that most of the consumer base is easily led like lemmings by marketing. It's disgusting how poor the picture quality is on these.

Reviews.Title: Need to replace LCD panel just after 4.5 years of light use
Reviews.Author: dongurao
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review knowing that it is for a different Samsung TV model but I think my points are relevant. I bought a Samsung 55-inch LED TV model UN55B7000WFXZA in 2009. After about 4.5 years of very light use (The TV is in my media room and mostly used only when we watched movies), last week, it started displaying overlapping double images on the top quarter of the screen. I requested repair service from Samsung, agreeing to pay the service charge ($70 for visit and diagnosis). Service person came and told me that the LCD panel needs to be replaced. Estimated cost is $1200!!! I called Samsung, explained the situation, and asked their help to mitigate the repair cost. Samsung said "too bad". The warranty expired so they won't help. I know the warranty is only 1 year but should I just swallow the fact that the TV I paid a couple of thousand dollars for lasted only 4 years? And repair costs as much as buying a new one? It's ridiculous. As automobile manufactures do for power-train, TV manufacturers should provide longer warranty for the most critical and expensive parts like the LCD panel. I have many Samsung products including another 52-inch Samsung LCD TV, Galaxy Note tablet, smartphone, etc. but I'm done with buying Samsung products, at least Samsung TV's. I'd give a 0 star rating if I could.

Reviews.Title: Not acceptable
Reviews.Author: Marion E. Severson
Reviews.Content: Not acceptable for us.  We are elderly and had no idea what a SMART TV was.  We wouldn't be able to run it.

Reviews.Title: 120Hz is no good.
Reviews.Author: Samantha Barron
Reviews.Content: 120hz sucks. Need at least 240Hz for HD these days. This TV disappointed me.  For the amount of money I spent, I was expecting better quality.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I own an older version of this TV. When it just got off warranty it started having some issues with image. You can find a lot of complaints if you ggle 'horizontal lines and ghosting samsung'. Apparently the problem is created by samsung, to save some money, making a decision to put cheap chinese parts in their tvs that deteriorate very quickly, within ~1-2 years. This is perfectly timed with their warranty period. So if you do not want to buy a new $1K tv every two years do not buy this product.

Reviews.Title: This TV??
Reviews.Author: Roger Miller
Reviews.Content: I'm considering this TV...maybe it's new, but both reviews posted here so far are for a DIFFERENT model.....beware! I don't know if this is an error or what, but these reviews should not apply here.

Reviews.Title: There is a reason I'm giving this great TV 1 Star
Reviews.Author: shopper
Reviews.Content: The picture on Amazon show's a clear plastic bezel. The TV I received had a solid Black bezel. It doesn't look as nice. The TV itself is fine and works as advertised. Amazon should take care in advertising their products correctly.

Reviews.Title: Garbage wifi. Will frustrate you to no end!! Save your money.
Reviews.Author: Eric Robinson
Reviews.Content: Good luck getting this piece of S*** to connect to your wifi network. This TV will frustrate you until you want to break it. I just got off the phone with Samsung. Their explanation was that "our TV does not like the information given off by a Cisco Linksys router and that's why it won't connect to the internet. Our engineers are working on a firmware update that will overcome this problem, but we don't know when it will be available." WHATEVER..... Another non-working POFS piece of electronic junk made by 9 year old captives in a foreign country. LMAO... Good riddens.

Reviews.Title: Joke no help from samsung or amazon going back...........donot buy
Reviews.Author: Don't sell me junk
Reviews.Content: This tv was a joke and so is samsung they would not help me i was on the phone over THREE hours.......... Also please note the delivery guy would not help me with setting the tv up on my table. He could SEE i was in back brace. He said if i paid him $30 cash under the table he could help.......This not the way  to treat people........Amazon and Samsung getting to big and don't care any more!!!!Pilot, one of our specialty shippers not!!!! What can I say beware!!!! It you want help or service that new $1800 tv then go some place other then samsung.

Reviews.Title: My Samsung TV Started on Fire!
Reviews.Author: Midibouncer
Reviews.Content: My Samsung TV started on fire!  No lie.  The very day I brought my baby home from the hospital, my 6 year old Samsung TV started blinking, then started on fire.  It was an LCD TV, so probably not precisely the product I’m reviewing here.  There’s a huge (I mean HUGE!!!) safety difference between breaking down, and starting on fire.  It was always plugged into a surge protected power strip.  I unplugged it once we smelled and observed smoke, and it just kept coming out.Draw your own conclusions, but I have not received any sort of customer service support based on my situation from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Mr. Bill
Reviews.Author: William A. Roe
Reviews.Content: This was a great purchase with a great price. I have it mounted on the wall . I have a great picture . I enjoy watching it.
